Reviews.Title: “The biggest gem amongst the others in town!”
Reviews.Author: vSeraphina
Reviews.Content: Found this place through guidebooks and Tripadvisor and I say, I'm glad I booked this place! The usual check-in time is after 3 but we arrived at about noon and we were able to check in with no problems. The room we were allocated was rather small, after experiencing big ones in DC but it was cosy. The doorway was rather dark, seeing that there wasn't any overhead lights. The bed was rather small but comfortable and the bathroom was pretty small but clean! The daily breakfast was the usual fare but certainly good enough if you are on a budget. They have tiny teapots for hot water which you can help yourself to 24 hours a day with complimentary teas and coffee at the bar downstairs. The location is probably the best since it is a block away from Copely station, Newbury Street, Prudential and the library is just right across from the hotel. Overall, this is a decent and convenient place if you are on a budget. The staff were friendly enough, even offering tips on what to do and where to eat in Boston. I would stay at this place again the next time I visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: el_cap
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this hotel to attend a conference across the street at Westin (much more expensive). I got a great deal on hotels.com paying for 2 nights and getting 3rd free. In total I paid about $280 for 3 nights. This hotel was in a great location on boylston street, with restaurants and bars within walking distance. The presidential center (large mall) was also right down the street like 2 blocks. The hotel itself is not your typical hotel. It has a small bar (which had a few people at night) and a small lounge. Free wifi and breakfast (basic: bagels, donuts, fruit and cheap coffee) was nice. The hotel did have 2 computers in the lounge with a printer which I used. The room itself is different then a typical american hotel, more european. My girlfriend had 1 double bed and bathroom but not much floor space. The room did have a stereo and a small TV. Not sure if the other rooms have 2 beds but mine did not. The room was probably about 8' x 10' not counting the bathroom. The room was small but it was clean and comfortable. For the cost it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Bistro Hotel in heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: shoots4themoon
Reviews.Content: Absolutely LOVE this funky hotel ! While the rooms are on the small side, they are tastefully decorated to the point of being wonderfully functional. Price is awesome and you are right in the heart of all the action in Boston. Great bar, nice helpful staff and to boot--it is an independent hotel (owned by a Bostonian)... Love supporting local! Nice touch with taking luggage to the room, having music playing and water bottles waiting. If a large room is what you want, stay at a known chain--but for charming, eclectic and well worth the money--stay at the Charlesmark---We will again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: obiwankenobiTroy_NY
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks and feels like a hip youth hostel. The rooms are not fancy/glamorous but rather comfy. I loved it. In the hotel has a martini bar as well. The bar was well attended. I could not hear the noise of the bar in my room! One big downside though is that the elevator to the rooms is accessible by everybody, not just hotel guests. I would have preferred an hotel-guest-only elevator key...or some kind of higher security system. Same for the stairways. After checking out from the hotel, there was the possibility to leave the luggage with the hotel. The luggages are locked with a rope so that they cannot be stolen but are accessible by everybody - so make sure you lock you luggage since people could go and open your zippers. I didn't trust the storage enough, so I only left my luggage but took my laptop and all other electronic devices with me. This was quite inconvenient. In overall, I loved my stay and would stay there again. Though I would not bring any valuables along.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: laura v
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and I enjoyed a wonderful weekend at this hotel 1. arrived early after a 6am flight, were shown to the breakfast area and told they would try to have our room ready as early as possible, very friendly helpful staff got us in at 11am and gave us maps of the area. 2. wonderful location right across from the library and near lots of attractions, enjoyed the boutique feel of the hotel 3. great price for the room, yes they are tiny, but beautifully decorated and all the amenities you need 4. would highly recommend this hotel, the downside is the breakfast as other reviews have pointed out (very few selections) but they are pleased to point you to other restaurants in the area, and helped us with dinner reservation which was a big bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, exactly what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: GSteadman
Reviews.Content: Can't beat this location in Boston as it is in walking distance of a lot of great food and bars and the T is nearby. The rooms are on the small side, but the value makes it perfect for a short stay in the city. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a hip property”
Reviews.Author: not-a-redshirt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 2 different occasions and were quite happy both times. The rooms may be small, but the are functionally laid out, modern and clean. Nice amenities that gives an air of sophistication throughout. There is no lobby per se, the downstairs is all but taken up by the nice bar, which is used for the cold breakfast buffet (basic staples as you would expect). Considering the location, design and cleanliness, well worth it for a small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: lindyjg
Reviews.Content: First trip to the US and booked hotel online as read Trip Advisor feedback. Charlesmark was in a great location. We walked throughout Boston from the hotel but could easily have taken the 'T' located across the street. Close to shops, restaurants and the Freedon Trail. Excellent service from reception, good continental breakfast in the bar area and free tea/coffee all day if required. Lovely room and fabulous bathroom. Loved the Duck Tour and walked to Harvard Uni - took an hour and a half but worth it. Would definitely use this hotel again and recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Well Situated”
Reviews.Author: GCutter
Reviews.Content: Our third time to the Charlesmark and owner gave us complimentary drinks for anniversary to start...right outside is the Boston library, Newbury street and the Prudential Center. Cannot beat the location...rooms are on the small side but you are in heart of the city and the staff is great. Love this little nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: wabect
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while attending a wedding. We were so pleased with the location, the service, the breakfast, the room, and our view from the 6th floor. It was very easy to park in front of the hotel for checking in and out. The walk to the parking garage was reasonable. I liked being able to have hot tea at any time in the bar area. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: cgmaine
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very reasonably priced. The rooms were very clean and well decorated. Staff were nice and helpful. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: festive_9
Reviews.Content: Rooms and bathrooms modern but very small, nowhere really to hang clothes, Corridor outside room had a funny smell ( damp ) Buffet breakfast not really that great bagels, butter, jam, cheese, muffins tea/coffee/juice. However the location was brilliant opposite the Boston Library with a subway station on the corner and across the road, very easy to get to. A bit too expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Small Boutique Hotel in a Awesome Back Bay location!”
Reviews.Author: brinalulu
Reviews.Content: The rooms at CH are small but modern. The bathrooms are uptodate - no bathtub just a shower. Our room (both times I stayed there) had a small couch that was a pull out so that was fantastic for when my sister stayed with us one of the nights. The bar downstairs is nice enough for a quick drink before you go out or when you return from a day out of either shopping or sightseeing. The location in Back Bay is unbeatable with plenty options of shopping or sightseeing adventures. I have stayed on the top floor and the room was spacious and lovely! I also have stayed in the smaller standard rooms mid floors and they were also lovely just small. The staff was friendly and upon our arrival we did get a free drink at the bar. Great bargain in a fantastic Back Bay location.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: MBRECED
Reviews.Content: I had a last minute business trip to Boston planned, with a certain dollar budget I needed to stay within. The "name brand" hotels I would usually stay in were either sold out or prices were outside the budget. When I started to extend my search I found the Charlesmark. It was within a mile of my meeting and it seemed like a good alternative. I checked their website for parking choices as well. Overall I was very happy with the hotel. It was only me so the size of the room wasn't an issue. It was clean, well appointed and had a nice modern feel. The small wardrobe as others have mentioned is a drawback, but they had two hooks on the wall where you can place hangers/clothing, so not really a problem. The lounge has an arrangement with the Thai restaurant next door, so I ordered a dinner and the bartender brought it to me within about 10 minutes. That and a glass of wine was perfect. The breakfast was coffee, fruit, bagels and donuts in the upper lounge area, starting at 7am. That was fine with me. I had room 106, which is the first floor in the back, with a view of the alley. I really didn't care until about 5:30 the next morning when a trash truck woke me up! Avoid that room if you can... The only other issue I would report is parking. The website said for quickest walk, pass the hotel, take left on Dartmouth, left on Newbury, left on Exeter, and the garage is on the right. I pulled into the garage that ended up being valet only, which I don't really like.. It also closes at midnight and reopens at 7am. That worked for me, so I decided to stay. They quoted me a price and when I cam back at 7:12am the next morning they quoted me 5 dollars more because I wasn't there at 7am.... Now, in the room in their hotel book on the night stand they also had parking information - but on that page it said turn left on Exeter, CROSS OVER BOYLESTON, and the garage will be on your right. A detail that they should fix so guests know EXACTLY where they are recommending... Now that I have been there once, I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad in the heart of the city. Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Cronista-xna
Reviews.Content: Our room was definitely small and the aisle definitely narrow. That marks. The breakfast was more like in a hostel than in a hotel (sharing the butter, etc.). On the other hand they take the most of the space, there is free wifi in your room, there is a lively bar and the hotel is just on the marathon finis line, in front of the Library, there is a subway station on the corner.... so location, location, location. Uau! Work in progress in the nearby: at five o clock we finished our sleeping time, every single day (3).

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: yuccan2
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by accident and the reviews were good so we decided to try it. It is a nice hotel, clean and surprisingly quiet in the room considering the noisy bar was just below our window. Staff were friendly and helpful. No in room safe which I would have preferred but the staff were not put out by my constant need to retrieve a piece of jewelry. I run a small B & B and needed some information regarding supplies. On my return home I received an email with links to the supplier. We had a minor issue in the bathroom that was fixed upon request. Rooms are small but nicely appointed and we found the bed comfortable. It is good value!

Reviews.Title: “Simple Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: ClergyChick
Reviews.Content: The Charlesmark occupies a narrow space on Boylston, almost unobtrusive -- but incredibly convenient and excellent location. Meant to be 'boutique' style, a tiny but efficient lobby checkin sits side by side to an inhouse lounge. The nightlife didn't detract from the stay - our room to the rear of the first floor was completely soundproofed. Smallish, but clean and streamlined style of the 1980s, comfy bed and adequate space. No bathtub (who takes a bath in a hotel anyway) -- but large and lovely tiled shower. Good value, and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricHalfaBee
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, stylishly cool boutique hotel with a great cocktail bar and sidewalk dining area. The rooms are very compact but have everything you need (unless you need a big desk) and the location is great. The hotel provides a basic breakfast but it is worth crossing the street to sit and eat in the library courtyard If this hotel is full, my next favorite is the Chandler

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Peter V
Reviews.Content: This quaint hotel combines the best of European styling and feel with American comfort. All of that at the perfect location in downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Scoorie
Reviews.Content: the website for this hotel looked great but the rooms were disappointing. Not in our mind a boutique hotel. If I could equate in UK terms, it reminded me of a Premier Inn - functional and practical. There was no wardrobe except enough room to hang up shirts - so girls, no dresses can fit in there, there was also no drawers for clothes - just some shelves which actually had ornaments on them. the breakfasts were rubbish and we went out every day to eat n the morning even though the were included in the price - tepid coffee from a flask and a donught type item is not my idea of a breakfast. However, the location is fantastic - back bay is a fab area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Lennox Instead”
Reviews.Author: francoberri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of recommendations on TA. Unfortunartely we were very disappointed.The plus points are the location and the fact that there is free wifi in the hotel. Other than that, it wasn't good. We had booked one of the 'larger rooms' and it was tiny. The 'wardrobe' was only long enough for shirts, not for dresses. And there were no drawers/cupboards - we were supposed to use the shelves which were also covered in ornaments! And then there was breakfast - best summed up as the worst we have ever had, anywhere! Unfortunately we were booked for three nights - on our return after five days in Cape Cod we stayed at the Lennox which is literaly across the road but light years away in terms of quality; and we got a room for a lower price!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: wrdywmn
Reviews.Content: We needed a nice place to stay that wasn't $300 to $400 a night like all the other hotesl, and Charlesmark fit the bill. As other reviewers have noted, GREAT location near the T and premiere shopping. The rooms are very small, but very nice and modern. I was doubtful about our room assignment on the second floor, given comments about the bar noise; however, our room was toward the back of the building, and it was nice and quiet. As other reviewers noted, you can hear footsteps from the room above. All hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. One small complaint: we'd asked for a wake-up call, and it was 40 minutes later than our requested time. Fortunately, we were traveling for pleasure, not for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Maryjanes764
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the hotel and enjoyed it very much. The staff was very helpful and friendly, the room although small was clean and well maintained. We were located on the fourth floor and found it very quiet and not noisy at all. We really liked the location as it was a short walk from Back Bay train station and walking distance to many attraction in Boston. They offer a continential breakfast every morning and have a very nice Bar that serves Thai food which was very good. We have stayed at two other hotels in the Copley area but the Charlesmark Hotel is by far the best value and we would defiinitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvements”
Reviews.Author: TerryPhilpot
Reviews.Content: In terms of what it charges, The Charlesmark offers excellent value for money - it is a handsome hotel, slap bang in the middle of Boston - by Copley Square station and the Boston Public Library. However, even though we were on the fourth floor - a good room but given we had an upgrade I did wonder what a standard was like - it was very, very noisy. This is because downstairs there is a bar, which insists on playing music very loudly late into the night, but insulation is such that the noise still travels four floors up. Also, the construction of the hotel is at fault in that the ceilings are insufficiently insulated to stop one hearing every step across the floor above. Another point. We were delayed two days due to the hurricane. I could not call the hotel with the required cancellation notice time - we were given only a few hours notice of flight cancellation - but the hotel refused to drop our fees even given the extra-ordinary circumstances. When I pointed out to the receptionist to whom I spoke that, in such a hotel in such a city, they were likely to get bookings for those nighs anyway, and so not lose, she affected not to understand what I was talking about. This is par for the course. You may ask why I rebooked this time but in 2006, when Heathrow was closed due to a terrorist scar, we also had to forgo a booking - even though we could not even reach the airport, let alone fly to Boston! Not only did the hotel still charge for the room, but an email to the owner, Mark Hagopion, to state that this seemed an extraordinary decision given the circumstances did not even warrant the courtesy of a reply. Here the hotel seemed to place a quick buck higher than some sympathy for British guests - ironic when you think that the US suffered 9/11/

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our choice - great value in central Boston”
Reviews.Author: TGO42
Reviews.Content: The Charlesmark is a boutique hotel in a location that could not be better. The hotel is a few blocks away from the Back Bay Amtrak train station, is central on Boylston St (which seemed central to everything in Boston) and it is around the corner from Newbury St's shops, cafes and restaurants. Boston Common is a few blocks away, the Esplanade is a few blocks away, and Beacon Hill is a short walk! We were given a free upgrade to a nice sized room (which was still small relative to large hotels) on the top (6th floor) that faced Boylston (right across from the library). Room was comfortable and clean. Even though we were facing the street, noise was not a problem at all. There was no refrigerator and no coffee pot and the closet was half the length of a normal closet. For our two night, weekend getaway, however, these things were not a problem. (Grab coffee around the corner at Wired Puppy cafe). We generally found the front desk very helpful and they were willing to hold our luggage for a few hours after we checked out. We also paid about $75 less a night at the Charlesmark than our family paid at the Doubletree -- which did not seem to be located in as desirable an area as the Charlesmark (across from the Tufts medical center). We think this was a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: beznee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in September 2011. It is in an amazing location (Copley Square, great neighbourhood, right next to the T, in walking distance of lots of sights of Boston) and a lot cheaper than other hotels in this area. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They held our luggage for us all day and offered us free tea and coffee when we arrived at 10am and told us that our room may be ready earlier at around 1pm. We booked and paid $119 for a standard room but the room we were given looked like a bigger one! Good size, really comfy bed, sofa, a view of Copley square, nice bathroom. Big TV with lots of channels and DVDs and videos available free downstairs (dated but good collection). Free wifi and guest computers if you need them. Street was a bit noisy outside during the night but perfectly understandable seeing as it is in the middle of a big city. Free breakfast was good - delicious bagels! Great value for the location. An all round great little hotel! Would recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tight squeeze in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ChuckTheDuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend and had a pleasant experience overall. The location is excellent as it is walking distance to the Prudential Center, Copley Square, and a bunch of great restaurants. The staff was very friendly and professional. The room was modern and clean, but pretty tight. The TV was an old CRT at the top of a high shelf, but they had a great surround system that included speakers even in the bathroom. The view was of a brick wall of the building next door. The hallways are very narrow, and there always seems to be housekeeping carts left out that you have to squeeze past because of the lack of space. The room didn't have a microwave, so we had to take the elevator to the basement and look for a lonely little microwave sitting on a cart in an empty hallway -- seemed a bit odd. The breakfast is pretty basic, just your typical unimpressive continental breakfast. There is a bar in the lobby area that looked pretty cool, and a nice little outside patio out in front. All in all, a cozy place for a weekend getaway, but might be claustrophobic for some.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel for Quick In & Out”
Reviews.Author: TravelFoodBeachFun
Reviews.Content: Boston The Charles Mark Hotel Copley Square The location is approximately a $32.00 cab ride from Boston Logan Airport. It is in a fantastic location amongst several cafÃ©â€™s and upscale shopping. There is a Thai restaurant right next door that they use for room service. They have an outdoor seating area attached to the bar that plays loud dance music (at least when I arrived on Sunday evening around 10pm). You might miss the hotel the sign is small & there is no door man standing outside. It is a very small boutique style hotel that I found online because I was stuck at the airport. My rate was $119. Before taxes. The room very small #103. The walk there was as unique as the room itself. Pleasantly surprised, when I walked in the had classical music playing on their sound system and the lights dimly lit. I called ahead so they knew I was coming & thought this was a really personalized touch. There is no view in this room but I didnâ€™t care, the room was cozy, the bed comfortable, the bathroom small but has the best showerhead ever!! There are many lighting options in the room 2 end tables, a very large mirror on one wall a leather chair and a love seat as well as a desk area. No food after 10pm but plenty of cafes around. If you love chocolate there is Mark Brennarâ€™s around the corner where they specialize in everything chocolate. Nice indoor outdoor seating and wifi. Try the mac and cheese itâ€™s unique but donâ€™t mix it with their chocolate martinisâ€¦they just donâ€™t go together. They have complimentary breakfast in the am at the hotel and two computers in the sitting area of the hotel. You can print your boarding passes out here. Affordable not sure I would choose this as a first option next time in the area but, itâ€™s a good go to place if the price is right. I had no problems getting a cab back to the airport at 5:45am.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Boston it would seem.”
Reviews.Author: raecheyraech
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. In a town where accomodation appears to be very expensive - you get a lot for your buck at the Charlesmark. Great location on Boylston St - right in the midst of all the action. I found the staff to be friendly and courteous at all times. Check in was a breeze, the lounge area is terrific for taking a break with a cup of coffee and as well as free wi-fi they provide two computers and a printer for guests to use without charge. I just had a standard room which I found to be very comfortable and more than adequate in size. Breakfast is just basic - fruit, oatmeal, bagels and pastries plus tea and coffee. But more than enough for me to start my day off with. The only things I think could be improved - provide a kettle and a fridge in the rooms. But as there is free tea and coffee 24 hours a day in the lounge and an ice machine and bucket for keeping things cool it was very easy to make do. I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel would book again”
Reviews.Author: cvs50
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reviewing it on tripadviser and I was not disappointed. For my purpose which was seeing the sights I found it just right. Staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: gabbyAthens_Ga
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thought the Charlesmark was an excellent choice for us. The location was great for sightseeing, restaurants and shopping. We walked most of the time, including the Freedom Trail twice, the river park, and several lovely nearby neighborhoods. There are many, many restaurant choices and an unbelievable assortment of shopping opportunities within easy walking distance. In addition, it was close to the subway which we used to travel from the airport and go to Fenway Park and the Samuel Adams Brewery. The room was very clean and modern,with space well-planned, and bed super comfortable. Breakfast included juices, coffee, a variety of fresh bagels, fresh fruit, cereals and oatmeal, as well as fresh pastries. The hotel bar had large open doors to a patio and sidewalk that made an excellent place for people-watching. The service was friendly and helpful. We would definitely return and recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant stay in central Boston”
Reviews.Author: swj
Reviews.Content: Directly across the street from the Boston Public Library, the Charlesmark Hotel is in an excellent location for business or pleasure in the City. It is only a few steps from the Copely station of the MTBA. The Boston Common is about 1/4 mile away. A myriad of restaurants were nearby. After entering the inauspicious doorway (partly hidden behind the awnings of the adjoining restaurant) we had a very friendly and helpful greeting. Our room was small, reminding me of hotels I've stayed in in Europe. What it lacked in size it made up for in modern fixtures, cleanliness and comfort. The bed was a full-size double, not a queen or king; the mattress was comfortable. The air conditioning worked just fine. We were on the back side of the hotel and it was very quiet. There is no refrigerator or microwave. I'm typing this on one of their free computers in the lobby. The bathroom was tiny, with only a shower and not tub. The fixtures were very modern, clean and in excellent condition. The bath towels were nice and big and fluffy. They give a good rate for these small rooms to members of the New England Historic Genealogical Society. For downtown Boston it was an excellent bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and welcoming in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DSMIW
Reviews.Content: First time in Boston with a couple or three days to explore the city on foot. The Charlesmark is a great base for this and economical to boot. The location is perfect and staff are personable, knowledgeable and very helpful. Rooms are small, actually very small, but comfortable, functional and quiet. If you bring people back to party stay in the bar; more than two in the room is very cosy. Definitely high on the list to consider for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique with boutique sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: MisterMikeSeattle
Reviews.Content: GREAT location near Copley Square, Newbury Street, etc. Small and friendly hotel. The rooms are small too, so don't come looking for space. Even the ironing board is mini. No in-room coffee but coffee available 24x7 in lobby. (I had some at 3AM and it was fresh, so kudos to management). I asked for a quiet room and got one, though it faced a brick wall maybe 2 feet from the window, ie, no noise but no view. All in all though, it's a fine place to stay if you want to / need to stay in this location.

Reviews.Title: “They aim to please!”
Reviews.Author: TonyC1958
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel on-line and then spoke to Curt(hotel manager) to get more information on the phone. My wife and daughter stayed here for 3 nights to attend a dance competition at the Hynes Convention Center. The thing that attracted me about the hotel was the price. However this is one of those hotels that gives you a tremendous value for the dollar. First of all the staff was awesome-Curt and company went out of their way to make my wife and daughter's stay very nice. The location is great-heart of Boylston and a 5 min walk to the Hynes. They include a nice continental breakfast so that brings additional value. Rooms are small but very clean and functional. In short if you are looking for true value at a quality boutique hotel in Back Bay this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: travel60878
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Hynes Convention Center and stayed at the Charlesmark. The hotel was conveniently located just a few blocks from the convention center and within walking distance to restaurants and shopping. A light breakfast is included and there is also a Starbucks just a few minutes walk on Boylston Street. The room was typical for a boutique hotel, small but well furnished, only lacking a room safe. The staff was wonderful - everyone I encountered during my 3 night stay was friendly, knowledgable and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST value in Copley Square area!”
Reviews.Author: living_life_1966
Reviews.Content: Located across the street from the Boston Public Library, on Boylston Street, this boutique hotel is, in my opinion, the best value in the Copley Square area. It is small and trendy with an art deco ambiance in the lobby/bar area and in the rooms. The furnishings are contemporary, the room has surround sound in both the bedroom and the bathroom and the bed is really comfortable. The bathrooms are really pretty with slate tiles on the floor, walls and into the shower. The queen size rooms are very spacious but the double room is very tight, so choose the queen size room if it is available. The front desk staff are very friendly and gracious. I have stayed here three times in the past year and, for the money, it just can't be beat! You can stay a block away in a bigger, fancier hotel with restaurants and bars and shops and pay almost twice as much. If you aren't interested in paying a premium for those "amenities", then stay at the Charlesmark. You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Eatsbonbons
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great location, stylish and clean, good buy. Yes, the room was on the small side (but not the smallest Boston room we've stayed in), but the room was designed so well that every inch of space is used to the maximum. Our room was facing Boylston Street, so there was some street noise, but that's to be expected. Continental breakfast was included with the room and was decent. For the location and price, this hotel is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “We lucked out.”
Reviews.Author: jazismine
Reviews.Content: With a spur of the moment change in hotel plans, we came across this hotel name & a phone number. We called and they were able to find us a room on a two day notice. Once we arrived we found the rooms were small but the next day they were able to accommodate us with a larger room. This small hotel was centrally located in downtown Boston and the staff were very helpful. There were no frills but the personal attentiveness to our needs far outweighed the the feeling of a "big box" hotel. I also thought the prices were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling alone, I want to find: nice staff, good location and feel safe!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieMC1988
Reviews.Content: I came in town for a wedding in August 2010. I had never heard of the Charlesmark Hotel, so I took a chance.. WOW was I surprised to find such a jewel!! The staff could not be any nicer, I asked a lot of questions and evey person that I spoke to was well informed of the Boston area and said it with a smile. The locationis in the heart of Boston, you can walk everywhere including the wedding I went to. You are also right next to evey bar, resturannt and shopping you need! My first night there, I was a little tired and went down stairs to the lounge, the bartender made me feel safe and welcomed! Greta menu, just waht I needed on my first night! I will stay here every visit to Boston, which is a lot!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with excellent staff and awesome owner.”
Reviews.Author: goo69
Reviews.Content: Went to the hotel for the Boston Marathon. We enjoyed the boutique hotel with all the amenities which still has the artistic feel of an art gallery. Lovely out door patio in front and clean, modern rooms with fluffy towels and hot showers. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat. Thank you, Mark.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Barracuda67
Reviews.Content: The Charlesmark is a jewel of a property smack in the heartbeat of the best of Boston. The staff is wonderful - makes you feel like home and the bar area attracts an eclectic group of regulars including politicians making for excellent Boston banter. Good energy!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel with boutique service and business class amenities”
Reviews.Author: July19561956
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to refer clients to a lovely hotel in a great location you won't go wrong with the Charlesmark. The rooms are well apponted and reasonably priced! The lobby bar is a great place to entertain and have fun

Reviews.Title: “Make your stay personal in a big city”
Reviews.Author: tmrc55
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in Boston. All the staff was so friendly and wanting to make our stay nice. Continental breakfast was fine. Standard rooms are not large, but this is what we expected in the heart of the city. Would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “They made it right and went beyond”
Reviews.Author: littlebit0
Reviews.Content: We stayed happily on an upper floor front room for our niece's wedding 18 months ago and loved this hotwl. Being in Boston to care for very sick relative, we needed peace and quiet as well as a fabulous location. I read another review that challenged the "quiet" promised by the staff, and asked the staff about room 101 being quiet. I was assured that it was very quiet. When we checked in on a Saturday, we talked to the reception desk staff about our need for quiet and he reassured us that it was very quiet. We checked in and unpacked. The room faces the alley at the allet level and had numerous trash bins (the large rectangular metal ones). I went to the front desk again to ask about trash pickup day. The woman did not know when yhe trash pickup day was, but assured us that 101 was a very quiet room. No trash pickup on Sunday morning...gloriously quiet, comfortable, more space than we needed. Then, Monday morning, 2am...until 4:30am, the various sanitation companies drove their trucks through the alleys and pickep up, dumped and slammed down the now empty metal bins. This was followed by a delivery truck idling outside those lovely windows, so we left early to catch breakfast near the hospital facility. We asked about the trash pickup and complained about the noise...this gentleman said the pickip was every day. After following up our cimplaint through managers, we were offered room 103, which has no exterior walls, but is on a short hallway to rooms 101 and 102. THIS is the room you want for quiet. They not only changed our room, but gave us a 50% refund for the noisy night's stay. Then I left prescription glasses in the nightstand when my husband checked out (I was at the hosp already). Figured it out 2 days later at home and called the hotel. They found it and fedex'd it back to me. Thanks to Kurt and Scott and the front desk folks for easing the strain of this kind of family visit. We will stay there again because of the excellent response to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Very well done...we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Dan_the_Man_Staziak
Reviews.Content: The beds and pillows were comfortable, the shower is slightly bigger than normal and the spray was perfect. The smaller of the rooms was tight for two people . Location was excellent...parking close by and the T is right there...or you can even walk most everywhere in an hour. Breakfast is fresh... 24 hr. coffee, tea & juice are good. They have fast, free internet and a good sized common work area with two computers and a printer if you need it. The bubbly red head was the most helpful and pleasant staff person I have ever met...which might be why the night person seemed a bit rude. If you're a light sleeper, consider earplugs...doors close a bit loud and sound seems to travel more than usual...garbage trucks can make a lot of noise in the alley; but, I never heard any police sirens. We'll be staying there again the next time we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: AcademicTraveller44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really great location near to the main attractions, good restaurants and transport links. The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. My room was a very good size and had everything I needed from a guidebook I could use while staying there to complimentary bottled water. As a woman travelling alone, safety is important to me and this hotel felt completely safe. The breakfast wasn't amazing but there was fruit, bagels, and donuts so some choice at least. I'd definitely recommend staying here and would book again if I was returning to Boston. Ask for a room on one of the top floors to avoid any potential noise from the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Charlesmark Hotel is situated ideally in Copley Sq., so comfortable, friendly and convenient to everything in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: SallyPerry297
Reviews.Content: Charlesmark Hotel though small offers a friendly staff, very comfortable rooms and food amenities that are excellent. Their simple breakfasts in the lounge are just what you need. The price is right too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: talaulia
Reviews.Content: the beds were sooo comfortable, the shower cabin is slightly bigger than normal and the stream was awesome. we really enjoyed out bathroom. location top, breakfast is really good, and you get free and tasty coffee and tea all day. fast internet.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a bargain”
Reviews.Author: Jct_9_M3
Reviews.Content: Room rates in Boston can be ridiculous. Not least if you want to stay in the Back Bay area when there's a big event on. Which makes this place something of a find. As others have said, the location is superb - very close to Newbury Street, the convention centre and a host of restaurants. Given all that, it's a bargain. Downsides are that the rooms are a bit pokey. Of course, all you intrepid travellers won't be spending much time in the hotel, but maybe that's just as well given the closet I stayed in. Although when I say closet, there wasn't actually anywhere to hang my clothes up. And why this annoying hotel habit of mounting the TV at ceiling level? Maybe I should get out more. I'd stay here again though. Credit crunch innit.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST location and value in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelBrain
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Charlesmark Hotel several times and it's my favorite for the Boston area. Since I travel 200+ days a year for business and pleasure, I'm very selective about hotels. I discovered the Charlesmark Hotel because it's located one block away from my company's headquarters and also the #1 choice of several colleagues. Service: Curt, the Operations Manager, and his staff are always very friendly and helpful. I always enjoy relaxing at the lounge & bar downstairs after a long day at the office and catching up with everyone. When I mentioned to Curt that I would be in the area often for business meetings, he offered personal assistance any time I needed to make a reservation. My wife always handles my travel arrangements and she says Curt has been a pleasure to deal with. When you spend as much time as I do on the road, it's great to be treated as a valued client and friend of a hotel! Room: The room is not large by "normal" hotel standards, but it's very comfortable and well-appointed. Visitors should remember that they're staying in a city and some noise should be expected from traffic, people, etc. My expert travel advice: 1) Read the FAQ's provided on the hotel's website so you know what to expect (http://www.charlesmarkhotel.com/questions.cfm); and 2) The room is for sleeping. Get out and enjoy the amazing city! Location: I grew up in the Boston area, so I know the Charlesmark Hotel is located in one of the best areas of the city. Staying in the Back Bay neighborhood puts you within walking distance to everything you want, need, and more: dining, shopping, sightseeing, transportation, etc. I have two upcoming stays at the Charlesmark and I'm looking forward to them!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Tripsagogo
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Charlesmark before so when returning to Boston we had no hesitation in staying there again. Our room was perfect and a lot more spacious than the one we had stayed in previously. The breakfast was more than substancial, along with very nice coffee which started the day well. The location of the hotel is definately a selling point. A couple of blocks away from Boston Common and a few away from the Prudential Centre. We were looking for somewhere for our anniversary meal so we booked a table at the Atlantic Fish Co which was a short walk away. The food and service was excellant. I wish we could get lump crab cakes in England. They were fab. A highlight of our stay was going to see Boston Celtics play New York Knicks. Definately a hotel we would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Confort in the heart of Back Bay Boston”
Reviews.Author: Washboardmary
Reviews.Content: What a great little find. Located on one of the premier Boston streets in the Back Bay neighborhood, the Charlesmark is situated right in the heart of all the action. There is a downstairs bar, which can be noisy on a weekend evening, but the noise stays downstairs. My room on the third floor was quiet and very comfortable. Smooth cotton sheets, a plush mattress and upscale fixtures make the room feel more like a high-end resort. The room was quite small--perfect for one person, but perhaps tight for two. Breakfast the next morning was included, free. There is a nice Thai restaurant next door--worth the short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DuvallSC
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Charlesmark several times and have always had enjoyable experiences. The location is ideal - you are walking distance from several things and there is a T stop 1 block away. The customer service here on our most recent trip totally blew me away. Our flight was delayed and we got stuck in Baltimore and couldn't make our reservations. The manager went out of his way to put our room up on Expedia so we weren't stuck paying the fee. Luckily, the room sold and we were able to come in the next morning and have a room waiting on us. The staff here always seems to go above and beyond the call of duty and really do care about their customers. While the rooms are somewhat small, they are all charming. I recommend asking for a room with a view!!

Reviews.Title: “over priced and very unfriendly/unhelpful reception staff”
Reviews.Author: traveller211964
Reviews.Content: we have stayed in many hotels across America. Am always willing to pay high prices for good quality hotels, BUT. We arrived at the hotel having booked via the internet from the UK some 5 months previously. Credit card details were supplied. There were also several e.mails back and forth confirming that we required a ground floor room these being quieter (having read trip advisor about the noise from rooms at front of hotel). Having arrived from New York where we were staying with family only to be told that photo ID was required we did not have this. I supplied an old non photo Driving licence stating that it had not stated anywhere that this was required. The very unhelpful receptionist Cassie stated that she could not believe that we had no photo ID as this was required over the whole of the US (not where we had been so maybe only in Boston) she was condesending very unhelpful and finally helped by another receptionist showinf confirmation E-mails we were allowed into our tiny noisy room would not recommend to anyone. Staff were unhelpful and looking at their faces clearly were not cut out for dealing with members of the public.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff & Perfect Locations”
Reviews.Author: MariB529
Reviews.Content: I read great reviews and so glad I decided to take this cute boutique hotel instead of going franchise as we normally do. Did a New York/Boston trip and this was a gem! Can't beat the location, close to train, Copley park, right across Boston Library, and walk to Commons. Moreover, they have a great bar downstairs where we caught the World Series, the bar staff was awesome and will stay here on next trip again. Since this was our anniversary, we were given comp drinks and a room upgrade! I didn't hear any noise, in fact it was pretty quiet at night..we stayed in middle on top floor! Wonderful Stay, Thanks Charlesmark

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff, Can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: TravelGoonerLondon
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I visited Boston from the UK and stayed at the Charlesmark hotel for the week. The Hotelâ€™s location on Boylston Street is perfect. It's a short walk from the shops on Newbury Street, opposite the Copley T stop, and is a short walk from lots of nice bars and restaurants. The hotel is fairly small for Boston, with only 7 rooms on each floor. The rooms are not particularly big but are fine if you are traveling alone, and they have all the facilities that you'd expect. On the first night I was woken at 3.30 am by the garbage truck at the back of the hotel emptying bins for 30 mins. I called reception and asked to change rooms but unfortunately the hotel was full that night. The night receptionist did go to the effort of finding me some earplugs though which was appreciated. The following morning I had to leave early but was informed by email during the day that I had been given a change of room and that my belongings had been moved for me - Great service! My new room was slightly bigger and a lot quieter thankfully. The free Breakfast was simple but very nice (Bagels, Juice, Coffee, Donuts) and was served in a nice comfortable room above the bar. The hotel was clean and well kept throughout. The Hotel bar had a good range of drinks and although we didn't try the food, it did look really nice when others had it. Given the Hotel's location, its cleanliness, the complimentary breakfast, and the extremely helpful and professional staff , this hotel is fantastic value for money and would suit 90% of people visiting Boston for work or pleasure. If you are thinking of booking this hotel, do so with confidence but I would advise you to request a room towards the front or middle of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: annasmom88
Reviews.Content: The staff at this lovely hotel near Copley Square in Boston were friendly and accommodating. Our 4th floor room was small but had everything we needed for our two night stay. Bed was comfortable and the room was quiet; could not hear any outside noise. I liked the bar/lounge area on the first floor. They serve a continental breakfast (bagels, fruit, coffee) that was just fine. Close to T, shopping, restaurants, and sights; 20 minute walk to Boston U; free wireless and also use of computers (with printer) in first floor lounge. TV was a little hard to use but this was only real annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute accomadation”
Reviews.Author: Regf
Reviews.Content: Turned out really good. Easy to find on Boylston. Free Internet and printer(nice). Friendly staff at check in. Thought maybe would get a better deal booking directly with the hotel, but got a cheaper last minute deal on expedia- prepaid. Room was all we needed. Clean, cool. Private bath. Nice view of brick out the window. Room had a queen bed and a hide-a-bed sofa if you needed more sleeping space. Hallway was a little bit noisy in the morning being in front of the elevator but nothing crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WashDC09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Charlesmark in early October. Thought the location was great (across the street from subway) and the rooms were nice (small, but nice). I especially liked the nice sound system in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price, and Service”
Reviews.Author: w0rldwander
Reviews.Content: I had a conference in Boston and decided to explore before booking a hotel. I arrived late and Charlesmark was the nearest hotel to the subway exit. Check in for a night and stayed for a week. I got the last room located on the bottom level and the next day a huge rain storm caused some flooding problems. They called me to let me know about the problem and they wanted to move me. The rooms are clean, modern and all you need if you are enjoying the city. The real value for me and a great overall summary of the hotel is toward the end of the week I was running out of clean clothes and called the front desk to see if they knew of a laundry drop off service. I was told they would do the laundry for me for $10 and should bring a bag down. When I returned at the end of the night I had clean shirts hanging in the closet and the rest of the clothes folded on the table. All for $10! If you are looking for a small hotel with great location and a reasonable price where they really seem to care about the comfort of the guest then you can't go wrong with the Charlesmark.

Reviews.Title: “Few frills but location and price more than makes up for it”
Reviews.Author: whereisnext
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the Lennox Hotel every time i'm in Boston, I thought i'd give the Charlesmark a try as the reviews on here were generally positive. First of all this is a no frills hotel. The reception is shared with the restaurant on the downstairs level and there's no breakfast/dinner or gym available. Meanwhile the rooms and corridors to the rooms are small and tight and not for those lovers of open-spaces. However, the rooms are very modern and sleak and are usually accompanied by a floor to wall mirror which gives the false sense of more space. I also had surround sound in my room which was a nice surprise so I could bang out some David Bowie while I was getting ready. Ultimately though the location is what makes this hotel. It's in the middle of ALL action in Boston, whether it's local to Back Bay (shopping at the Pru or on Newbury Street) or a 10 minute walk into Boston and the nearby Theater District. It's a clean and modern place to crash after a long day in Boston although perhaps it's not for the type of people who like hanging out in their rooms all day. Oh and perhaps most importantly they give you a cocktail voucher for the restaurant on the bottom floor. Great margaritas!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SophomoreJinx
Reviews.Content: Put simply, the Charlesmark is one of my favourite hotels. There's not a whole lot to add really, but the staff are always fantastic, the decor is contemporary and sharp, and the bar is well stocked. Location is spot on - you're as close as you need to be to everything that the delightful city of Boston has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Emmmi
Reviews.Content: We went there in december during the holidays. The hotel was nice and cosy and the room were well equiped. They even provide a travel guide that you can borrow. The staff was very helpful and nice. We had a little problem with the bathroom and it was fixed really quickly! . The hotel is located 2 steps from a subway station, across the library and close to many shops and attraction. The only downside is the lack of cheap parking close to the hotel (but isn't it the case everywhere in Boston?). We tought the included breakfast was so so (donuts, oatmeal, coffee and fruits) . I'd definitively go back again, mainly because of the location!

Reviews.Title: “early morning trash removal the Only flaw...”
Reviews.Author: meegandevo
Reviews.Content: I'm very picky about beds and the mattress was firm but comfortable for my 6'4" husband and myself...would have been nice to have a king-size though. The feather pillows were fantastic--such a small thing, such a big difference. The room was snug but not too small--you can't do better IN Copley for that price. They had nice classical music piped in on surround speakers--very nice, but they should have piped in some serious white noise for the 5:30am trash removal that seemed to go on forever. Breakfast was brief but functional: hot coffee, decent donuts, fresh fruit, oatmeal, bagels. For a 1-Night-stay it was great. Location, price, and style can't be beat. Longer stays might leave you sleep-deprived... I would definitely go again though.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: JulieGMelbAust
Reviews.Content: Great location for this hotel but............. Rooms were tiny, and every night I was woken at 2am with rubbish bins being emptied from the businesses behind the hotel. <My room was at the rear of the hotel, the bed was tiny, room was tiny, and when not woken by bins being emptied I had 3 hours of street sweepers keeping me awake from 2-5am. If you choose to stay here (and the location is worth it) then ask for a room not at the front or rear but in the middle somewhere so you can sleep. Also skip their "complientary breakfast" it is very ordinary...... great coffee around the corner in newbury street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good stay, but some issues"”
Reviews.Author: dkm1776
Reviews.Content: In general, I liked this hotel. It is a great value for the location, and included a basic breakfast. This was not a greatbreakfast but good enough for me, as I had to be at a conference for job interviews, and didn't really need any added stress to the day of finding breakfast. Like some of the other reviews on here, I found the front desk staff to be, well, unfriendly at times. I was coming and going most of the three days I was there, due to circumstances, and rarely did I get a hello or acknowledgement of my entering the building. The exception were the wonderfully cool, friendly housekeepering staff and the person who checked me in. The one time I ate at the bar, there were three bartenders on, but only one was actually attentive to the customers. Like some others, I had to be a conference the day I checked out, so before my flight I asked the staff to hold my bags. Having read the reviews on here, I was aware that this meant my bags were going to be left tied up in the bar and in plain sight of passersby. This did not really bother me, as I was aware of this issue before I checked in. The staff was also nice enough to hold my laptop bag behind the desk for most of the day, which was much appreciated. Only once did I come back and the room was not made up, unlike some of the other reviews listed here, but again, I was keeping odd hours at the hotel. As a single traveler used to city living, the size of the room did not bother me so much, but it seems I may have recieved some sort of upgrade. The bathroom was large and well designed. I found the bed plenty comfortable, though I agree that the living space may be small for some. I did not mind, as I was travelling alone. My main complaint about the Charlesmark was the room lighting, which was so bad I thought I might go blind after my three nights, as I am a reader and computer user and need light. The room faced an air shaft, had only one window, and no overhead light in the main space-- only lights by the door, and dim lights by the bedside tables, and which did not provide much light. Overall, I recommend this hotel, but keep in mind all of the things that have been mentioned in previous reviews and you won't be dissapointed. I've stayed in higher priced hotels in similar cities and have recieved a lot less for my dollar. I would recommend, however, that the management work on the lighting issue and making sure that the front desk staff acknowlegdes people when they come into the hotel. This is big for single people.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid functions at the Charlesmark hotel”
Reviews.Author: quietside55
Reviews.Content: The Charlesmark is squeezed into a narrow space. It has minimal function facilities and no lobby. We felt as if our function was double booked, and we could have piled into any old bar for a better experience. We were squeezed into a narrow bar while the while the public was served on the sidewalk and a political meeting took place in a back room. Noise level was awful. Waiter had to clear paths for guest to enter and exit hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location & Best Price Hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: HDrought
Reviews.Content: The CharlesMark Hotel, a charming boutique hotel, is located in the heart of the Back Bay and costs a fraction of the price of other hotels. Right out the CharlesMark front door brings you to some of the best shops and restaurants on Boylston and Newbury Streets; there's Copley Square, Trinity Church, and the park at Copley Square; and across the street is the Boston Public Library. The CharlesMark has a better location than both the Westin or Copley Marriott hotels and costs a fraction of the price. The rooms are cozy and incredibly well-organized and nicely designed. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and they let you in on all the "secrets" of enjoying Boston like a Bostonian, rather than steering you to over-priced tourist traps like other hotels. Staying at the CharlesMark makes you feel like a Bostonian (even though you're stay is temporary). Be warned though, the CharlesMark makes Boston so inviting and wonderful you might be tempted to move there! Basically, the CharlesMark is just a whole heck of a lot friendlier and more personal than other hotels. Did I mention there's a great lounge downstairs? Well, yes, there is! The street-level lounge is cheery and well-lighted during the day (and includes a wonderul little outdoor patio with tables and chairs). In the morning the lounge hosts a FREE help-yourself continental breakfast of bagels and cream cheese, muffins, toast, fresh fruit, coffee, juice, etc. and basically has the pleasant ambience of a European pensione. In the afternnon it's a perfect place to come back and have a cool drink on the patio before heading to your room. At night the lounge becomes a hip Back Bay neighborhood place to have a drink at night. It's the perfect combination --- hip, friendly, and not loud at all (the lounge was active the nights we stayed, but when we got to our room, we didn't hear a thing and it was as quiet as a cabin in Vermont!). And are you interested in the Boston Marathon? The CharlesMark is is situated exactly at the Boston Marathon finish line! What could be more convenient to runners and their families and spectators than that?! All in all, the CharlesMark is a unique blend of charm, friendliness, utility, convenience, great location, and cost effectiveness. My only hesitation in publishing my review is that I don't want the hotel to be booked the next time I call to stay there --- and believe me, the next time we go to Boston, we'll be staying at the CharlesMark! Vive la CharlesMark!

Reviews.Title: “I love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gman203
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, clean and smack in the middle of the city. The rooms are very functional and atmosphere is fun!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: sjdrought
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Charlesmark for St. Patrick's day last week and just had the best experience! To start the location is fabulous. Right in the middle of all of the action and great for the kids because the Public library, mall, and Copley Square (park) are right across the street and you are right around the corner from Newbury street which is a great place to walk around and shop. To stay in such a great area of Boston for such a reasonable price was great. The staff at the hotel were so friendly and accomodating. They greeted us as though they had been waiting for us to walk through the door each time we came back to the hotel. They made a big deal out of the kids and made them feel right at home. They offered to help us with luggage and the stoller with a smile each time we came in. We have two small children 5 and 2 years old and we stayed in a room with a queen bed and a pull out couch. It could not have been more comfortable. The room was so organized that we had plenty of space and there was a very nice desk and closet that made organizing our stuff..diapers and such very easy. The kids were thrilled that there was a tv and dvd player and vcr...you can bring movies to entertain them while you get shower and get ready (or sleep in a bit)! The room was really really clean and in great condition which made me very happy. I used a restroom outside of our room twice and it was spotless each time. The room was also very quiet and dark so the kids slept well...and late! There is also a lounge downstairs that was very nice where you can have a glass of wine. We had such a great experience staying at this hotel our family will stay there every time we are in Boston and I would highly reccomend it to anyone else with or with out children!

Reviews.Title: “Charlesmark Hotel - Boston”
Reviews.Author: VMTexas
Reviews.Content: The room was small, but very clean. The lighting wasn't very good. The breakfast was skimpy - so I just got coffee and did my own thing. It wasn't the best I have ever stayed in, but it definitely wasn't the worst! It was decent for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_BR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really well located, everything could be done on foot and in case it's needed the subway is close to it. The room was not too big, but it was clean and as I was travelling by myself and was looking for a confortable place to rest for one night it was perfect. The hotel staff is frendly and willing to help and the price was really worth.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel with a budget price”
Reviews.Author: LittleDIreland
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews we were a little unsure about this hotel, but it is a little gem and we would reccomend it to anyone. Friendly staff (for the most part), clean hotel, free breakfast, nice food and all about 10 feet from the nearest T station. Rooms are small, but certainly comfortably big enough for two people on a city break. As for noise, yes, sometimes you could hear noise but certainly not enough to interfere with sleep and when you are staying in a city centre, do you expect silence?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with noise and basement rooms”
Reviews.Author: TexasAMC3
Reviews.Content: There is a lot to like about this hotel. Location, cleanliness, great staff, well decorated rooms and bathrooms. I love that the sheets and towels smell as though they came from my home dryer. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room boasts unique storage solutions. What I didn't like was initially being given a room in the basement but the front desk understood my discomfort and found me a room on the 4th floor. Never before had I heard of a hotel having rooms in a basement. On the third night of my four night stay the guest above me created quite a ruckus between 2:30 a.m. and 4:30 a.m.. Because of the wood floors, you will hear creaks, moving about which didn't bother me. The cranked stereo, things falling on the floor, etc., during the middle of the night, however, did. Thankfully, that guest stayed only one night. I really liked this hotel but wouldn't stay here again because of the noise potential.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: mildjourney
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel can't be beat. It's within walking distance to shopping, restaurants and landmarks. The room was clean and spacious. Get to the lobby early for their breakfast foods (muffins, bagels, fruit & coffee) or you will miss it. Only small thing to mention was the noise of other guests in the hallway ---walls are thin.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: gweagni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this "boutique" hotel on a recent visit one-night visit to Boston. The location is wonderful near many restaurants, stores, churches, markets and the hustle and bustle of crowds. I thought the room was somewhat pricey for the size but the place was immaculate and quite comfortable. The staff were polite and accessible. Our room was on the sixth floor and going up and down was somewhat slow. There appears to be a "scene" in the evening with a lot of energy for those who are interested. Parking in the area is quite terrible and driving requires loads of patience. All in all a very pleasing experience and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: wpttb
Reviews.Content: went to visit my daughter on college campus in Norton,Ma, booked Charlesmark Hotel last minute, wanted to spend evening time in centre of Boston, first considered booking a hostel as hotels are so expensive so when we found the the Charlesmark Hotel for $50 more then a hostel we weren't expecting much. location is perfect for exploring boston, the T is right outside the hotel, the lobby area is very small but functional and staff was very friendly and helpful, our room was on the 6 floor (queen room ) good size room, sofa, tv/dvd, music system, very comfortable bed, bathroom was beautifully tiled and had plenty of towels, it was a bit noise from a/c unit on roof outside but no loud enough to keep you awake breakfast is a small area in lounge where you help yourself to drinks, bagels, spreads etc, enough to give you a start in the morning hotel also has a small bar area returning to Boston for Thankgiving, wish we could cancel hotel we've booked and change to Charlesmark Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, clean hotel, close to transportation, plenty to do in the area.”
Reviews.Author: wenndell
Reviews.Content: A comfortable hotel, in what seems to be a trendy area of Boston (Back Bay), just steps from subways, buses and Copley Square. Also very close to plenty of shopping and dining options. The room was clean and cozy, with simple, modern decor - great for one or two people. There was one double bed, a very nice bathroom (shower only, no tub, which was fine for me), and plenty of drawers/spaces to hold a long weekend's worth of clothes. I was pleasantly surprised to find that in addition to cable tv, there was satellite radio in the room. Oh, and free wireless internet - a big plus! The staff was very friendly and helpful. They also provided continental breakfast in the downstairs lounge. In the evening, this same bar/lounge turned into a pretty happenin' hotspot for the locals, and a nice place to have a drink and relax after a long day of walking around Boston. All in all, a great hotel for folks that like to keep it simple, because how much time are you going to really spend in the hotel anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Great location.....just dark!!!”
Reviews.Author: mdstephenson
Reviews.Content: Great location, couldn't have asked for more! Good value, in an expensive city this is a definite find. Nice room, very clean.....but really dark at night, I'm all for mood lighting but lets's have the option of turning it up when you actually need to find something! Didn't bother with breakfast so can't comment.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising little gem!”
Reviews.Author: seela
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this cute little place for only one night but would definitely go back. I chose it because of the price and proximity to my daughters place and it was a delight. The rooms are very small but well appointed, clean and quiet. It has windows you can actually open to enjoy the cool breeze! The location can't be beat for everything Boston. Close to a T stop, shopping and lots of interesting restaurants. I was a little worried about noise as it is over a restaurant/bar but I slept like a baby. The staff was pleasant and helpful if a little aloof and answered all my questions. The free breakfast was definitely continental - coffee, bagels and danish so we went somewhere else for something more filling. I plan on bringing my husband back next time to show him this place I've "discovered!"

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable value - in the right rooms!”
Reviews.Author: linda528
Reviews.Content: Just had our second visit at the Charlesmark, this one a three-night stay after we were in Boston for the Paul McCartney concert. Got a really amazing deal on Travelocity -- $118 per night -- which was so cheap it was an offer we couldn't refuse. The Charlesmark did not disappoint. Rooms, although small, are clean and well-designed and the location is fantastic. Staff is helpful, and the bar is a great place to have a drink at the end of your night. Speaking of the bar, if you are someone who likes to go to bed before 2 a.m. on a weekend, *do not* let them put you in one of the two rooms on the first floor (106 and 107). I read someone else's TA review that the noise wasn't a problem. Well, we were in 107 and it was fine on Thursday night, but on Friday night the noise was outrageous. The hotel was good about moving us the next day to a quieter room. (Really, they should just charge less for these rooms and let folks know the bargain they're striking!) Other than that, absolutely no complaints. A great deal. P.S. Go to JP Licks on Newbury Street for the best ice cream you've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Best...Service...Ever...”
Reviews.Author: ArtTourist_9
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveler with limited mobility due to multiple sclerosis, I am always concerned about accessibility issues. Because the Charlesmark is a small boutique hotel, they lack some amenities, and the property has some disability limitations, but this was more than made up for by the tremendous helpfulness of the staff. Practically every request was honored, up to and including staffers physically carrying my walker up stairs and hand-delivering ice and food to my room, always with a smile and a gracious attitude. And not one staffer would accept a tip for doing it. I was genuinely touched by the kindness and attentiveness of everyone from Mark the owner down to the housekeeping crew. Many thanks to Mark, Curt, Kelly, Katelyn and everyone for really making my trip! Best service I've ever had at a hotel, in Boston or elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Using Tripadvisor paid off!”
Reviews.Author: RossOrpington
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned our 3 night trip to Boston many months in advance (September 08), looking at different hotels and taking particular note of prices and then looking on Tripadvisor for the experience of other people. Consequently we quickly eliminated one cheap hotel. We found most hotels were very expensive. However, one that was within our means was the Charlesmark. Having read the reviews we decided on a Queen size room, rather than standard. Booking the hotel was no problem - we exchanged emails and everything went smoothly - the hotel staff were very helpful. No charges were made until after we arrived. By UK standards, the room was a good size. We flew into Boston airport and easily took the metro all the way from the airport to Copley station, which was only a few steps from the hotel. We are both in our 50s but had no problems coping with a suitcase each and a flight bag. Well recommended as the metro cost only $2 each. The hotel was in a great location, directly opposite the Boston Public Library which was well worth visiting. We did have a few criticisms of the room and hotel. We had a sofa in our room but there were no lights nearby for reading purposes. The TV was too high for comfortable viewing from the sofa. The TV and audio/video equipment appeared to be of a good quality. There were not many places to store our clothes etc. The room did not have curtains - blinds instead which took a few minutes to get used to operating. The bathroom was clean and plenty of space, although the shower door only just cleared the WC. The shower was spacious and lots of lovely hot water - no bath but we knew that. Although continental breakfast was free, it was very basic, consisting of bagels, doughnuts, orange juice, coffeee, tea and possibly a type of cereal. Sadly, although it was supposed to be ready from 0700, the breakfast was not always all there. Furthermore the gentleman putting everything out was not particularly friendly or chatty. Lastly there were 2 larges TVs in the breakfast area which were always on and on the loud side. The rooms did not have coffee/tea facilities but 24 hour supplies were available near the breakfast area. All-in-all, although there were some minor faults, we very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definitely stay there again. We would also recommend it to others - best to get a Queen sized room if you want a bit of space.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Boston's Back bay”
Reviews.Author: RuralMA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on July 3rd as sort of a "get away from the kids" night. We were checked into room 107 - a little weird as the entrance to rooms 106 and 107 is actually through the lounge, but ended up being nice and quiet despite a decent bar crowd. Room was small (we just had overnight bags so it wasn't an issue - not sure what we would have done with a large suitcase) but very nicely done and clean, and at ~$150 a nite with a good continental breakfast included it is a really good value for the Back Bay. Location is very convenient to public transit, parking options are more limited. Staff was friendly, and when we checked out they already had our receipt in an envelope with our room number on it.

Reviews.Title: “small but not quite boutique...”
Reviews.Author: rerBoston
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent free wifi and 2 PCs in lobby, with free access to printers. (nice touch, much like Euro & Canadian hostels I've been to. Not a boutique hotel, so don't pay boutique prices (no more than $225/night, in my opinion) rooms are ok but small-ish.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel - Just refuse to stay in Room 205 !”
Reviews.Author: Jen067
Reviews.Content: Reserved through Booking.com. We were allocated room 205 whch has 2 generators directly outside the window and the noise is intolerable.Staff who were extremely helpful could not give us another room until the next day. This new room was on the 6th floor and made this hotel 'perfect'. Location is excellent and I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Just ensure you do not get room 205 though !

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its good ratings!!!”
Reviews.Author: VivekKolkata
Reviews.Content: Was lucky to get rooms when I called. More so cause I had booked for 3 nights but wanted to extend my stay for another 3 nights but couldnt because they were booked. Location is great. Right next to the "Subway". Its also walking distance from most of what you would need to see or do. Hotel is absolutely fantastic with the rooms and lobby done tastefully. Rooms and bathroom real small though its not really a problem. Fridge in the room along with the free internet, basic breakfast and free printing service. Hotel staff were a real plus as well especially a certain receptionist. She was a real delight. The bar at the lobby and the Thai joint right next door sum the place up. Overall A real delight in Boston. I would deffinately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location + price”
Reviews.Author: poochie77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location and close to lovely restaurants, shops, the common etc. The staff were OK, not too enthusiastic - coming up from NY we found them far less friendly and helpful..booked a trolley tour with the receptionist and she was certainly not going to explain the tours available . The male receptionist was more hospitable. That said i would definitely stay here again. The rooms are small but have all needed, really nice shower and bathroom in general. Soundproofing is an issue - just hope that the people in room over you aren't as "passionate" as the one's we had to listen to one night! TV/DVD in room, free internet in lobby which is useful when you are on holiday as most places have wifi and wasn't carrying a laptop. Breakfast is made a self service of bagels, pastries, instant oatmeal, fruit, and tea/coffee and little cookies available 24hours in lobby. Bar in the lobby which seems to attract an after work crowd but is not too loud or late. All in all a lovely little hotel for a great price in a great location..will be back when the rain stops!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: PeterBoyPerfect
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, the rooms are small but well equipped and suited our week long stay perfectly;, the bathrooms have speakers in which is pretty cool for keeping up with whatever's on the TV whilst you, shower etc. if they were a few feet bigger this would surely be a 4-star hotel. The staff are helpful and welcoming, and the complimentary breakfast pretty decent; pastries, coffee, the usual. Very pleased with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a solo business traveler!”
Reviews.Author: yoopie
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 3 days at the Charlesmark and was very pleased. I was attending a conference at a very formal nearby luxury hotel. Not only do I not feel very comfortable in luxury hotels (I like to dress casually), but the price at that hotel and most of the others nearby was very high. The Charlesmark's rooms ARE small and if I had been traveling with my family, this might not have worked. However, for a single traveler, it was great. The rooms were pleasantly decorated. Beds were very comfortable. Shower was tiled slate, has good water pressure/spray, and the room had wall mounted speakers with an additional speaker in the bathroom. The hair dryer was powerful.
