Another reviewer complained a lot about the TV channels and lack of DVD player for movies. I did not want to spend my free time in the Back Bay of Boston watching TV--there was plenty to do and lots of shopping and dining in easy walking distance. The location was ideal for me. The breakfast was not expansive, but as a light breakfast eater, it suited me fine. Good coffee. The martini bar downstairs was a bit too trendy for my tastes, but there were plenty of other places nearby that were great (I'm more of an Irish pub type of girl). Unlike the previous reviewer, I did not hear any noise from adjacent rooms--I was there on a weekend when it appeared to be quite full, too. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A 3 dressed up as a 9”
Reviews.Author: ultyrunner
Reviews.Content: We booked the Charlesmark on what was available on the web. It's a nice looking hotel, with nice wood touches and accents. I also understand that in Boston's back bay area, particularly, rooms tend to be small and pricey. These rooms are very cramped and the beds are small. Staying with another person in the smaller rooms with a double bed, had us tripping over each other constantly. They are very poorly laid out and nothing is really all that ergonomic. Very illogical. Everything looked nice, but the experience of staying there was far from pleasant. Since I was in Boston to run the marathon, sleep was important. The walls and ceiling were very poorly soundproofed and every time someone above us walked around the joists creaked like crazy. Light music or TV in adjoining rooms was very audible and normal level talking out in the tiny hallway came through the door loud and clear. You have satellite TV, but in the smaller rooms it was 8 feet up in the air to your side so you had to wrench your head to watch it. There wasn't a particularly good selection of movies or sports that came by default and ordering PPV was not allowed. I've never experienced that before. The DVD player in our room only played CDs. So we couldn't rent movies or order them. Lastly, they actually billed our credit card in the morning prior to our checking out and before we could sign and confirm the charges. A very poor customer service practice in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “very much ok :)”
Reviews.Author: harmagnu
Reviews.Content: Location and price are probable unbeatable. Room decore was old, the draws where stiff and noisy. Some staff members where wonderful, others lacking interested and a little bit to much interest in talking with coworkers.... Our room view was a brickwall.... Breakfast was really good, and overall I liked the experience. Room was really clean and bathroom good, Hairdryer worked very well and shower was a great experience with good towels. Needs a little bit updateing in rooms tho.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely decorated, convenient and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: annielu11
Reviews.Content: This hotel absolutely met my expectations during my trip to Boston. The staff members were friendly and helpful, the room clean, and the location extremely convenient. I appreciated large windows in my room, as well as the modern decor. This is not a luxury experience, but was more than adequate in terms of comfort and amenities. The towels actually smelled as fresh as if I had washed them at home, and the shower was quite nice. I was a little surprised that there was no bathtub in the bathroom, but really I shouldn't have expected it given the "boutique" nature of the room. The best perks were free wireless internet, affordability and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value inb Boston”
Reviews.Author: MrJoelB
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel offers excellent value in a high priced neighborhood. Rooms are reasonably sized, with premium sound systems. Continental breakfast is included. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but there is a decent, inexpensive Thai place next door, and for a splurge, Morton's steakhouse is a few steps away. What staff lacks in polish, they may up for in friendliness. Overall, a very satisfying experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay....”
Reviews.Author: My1babydoll
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Charlesmarks hotel. The price was reasonable and I was close to where I had to go. The Hotel is small but I loved it. Very reasonable in price and the staff was nice. I did not have any problems. I had a queen size bed, which was on the second floor. It was a nice size for me. I was not planning to live in the room, it fit what I had come to Boston to do. Go visit friends. A great place to stay if you dont plan on staying in the room all day and night. I love the sound system in the room. The music was also heard in the bathroom during a nice hot shower. The hotel is directly across from the "Boston Public Library". The bar is really small downstairs; however really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: lisakristine
Reviews.Content: The Charlesmark Hotel gives incredible value for the money. The rooms are clean, stylish, and remarkably spacious. The continental breakfast is great. The service is fantastic. The entire staff was friendly and polite. Our every need was met. The bar was trendy and fun, with great drinks and food. The hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Back Bay with a T stop directly across the street. I will definitely stay here again and again and recommend to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great little retreat after a day of work!”
Reviews.Author: airhart
Reviews.Content: After a frustrating search in an expensive city for a hotel that met my daily allowance for work travel, I found this hotel at the last minute, perhaps a cancellation in a sea of $600/night prices (some sort of convention in town). It was small, friendly, clean, and the attention to detail was wonderful after such a long day... my room was playing satellite radio classical music (not elevator-style, either) when I walked in. Everything was spotless, the bathroom was great, and although the view was of nothing but a wall, I didn't care at night after a long day. Not good for a long stay - the rooms come with impractical but charming minifridges, and the 'closets' are clever cubbyholes - but for one night, a perfect retreat. Morning oatmeal and the paper was nice too... a decent bar, and a friendly staff. Definite recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, small room, good price for Boston”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Charlotte
Reviews.Content: We drove to Boston so parking was a bit of a problem. You have to park in a parking station about a 10 minute walk away. The hotel is on a busy road so there was no available parking spaces in any block near the hotel, let alone in front of the hotel and you can't double park to drop off your suitcases because of the traffic. We dragged our suitcases all the way from the parking station. It would be challenging if you had young children or elderly travellers The hotel itself is modern and the rooms are clean and modern, though quite small - there really isn't anywhere aside to put your suitcases - wherever you put them, you will have to step over them to move around the room. There was free internet and a free breakfast. The Location is great - Boylston St has several bars, restaurants, the subway to downtown and there's a street that has upscale boutiques and shops that is one block away. The price was under $300 which is good for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shaun1967
Reviews.Content: I took this hotel on a recommendation via the Tripadvisor forum. The stay was booked a few months ago, just before the credit crisis was in full blown mode, so at the time I thought my successful bartering of a $15 discount on a queen room was a coup. Maybe the way things are $149 a night might get you a bit more, I don't know. Anyway, by pre-crash standards its a good deal. Location is great, rooms are modern, clean, good spec, loads of TV channels. Rooms are small - even the queen rooms, but that's already well documented The breakfast and lounge for us are a bonus (I use the present tense as I'm writing this up during our stay). Two free to use high speed internet terminals (always available, never a queue) is something not always complimentary. The breakfast also saves you a few bucks on your holiday budget and for most people the breakfast would be fine. A previous reviewer described it as little more than hard bagels and bitter coffee, but that is unfair. There are muffins, fresh bananas, apples, oranges, doughnuts, tea, orange juice and cereal. The fruit and beverages are available free in the lounge 24 hours in fact, plus the daily papers. There are no egg/quarter of a pig options, so if that is what rings your bell then the breakfast will be no bonus to you Traffic noise is something that seems to divide opinion, and I can say that from our sixth floor front facing room you can in fact hear the sounds from the street, but they are by no means insufferable. I guess it depends on what you are already accustomed to. I do appreciate that some people will be used to deathly quiet nights and a small amount of noise can be very unsettling. But that's a city centre location for you, nothing to do with the hotel Reception/front desk staff? Some say can't do enough, some say cold and frosty. Well ... I can see both sides. What they do is get you what you want and answer all your questions without any fuss, what they don't do is fawn all over you, so again, if this is important to you ... All in all because of the location and general specification in context of a very competitive rate, I'd certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Top situation”
Reviews.Author: MissBirdseye
Reviews.Content: Small room (despite higher price) but very well designed and with large bathroom. Self service breakfast boring and hardly worth bothering with. Very friendly and welcoming staff. Great situation in Copley Square with excellent access to T (underground) but view of airconditioning units not great.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but overall excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mungo57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Charlesmark for 3 nights, thanks to Trip Advisor reviews. Really loved this hotel - lovely decor, fantastic location on Boyleston (at Copley), really nice bar area and free internet in the lobby. Nice food next door - Bangkok Blue - and there are lots of other bars and restaurants nearby. Walking distance to all the sights and shops in Boston! Be prepared - The rooms are small, and it was noisy - but I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, good location”
Reviews.Author: pinkpidgin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a pleasant stay at the Charlesmark. It is excellent value for money and the staff were helpful and friendly. There are several good restaurants nearby and the discounted rate on parking is very handy! The rooms are small even by European standards but they are confortable and well designed. We needed our laundry done during our stay, the receptionist took our big bag of clothes in the morning and when we returned that evening everything was washed and dry and back in our room for just $10 it cost twice that to have one pair or panties washed in our previous hotel in NYC! Breakfast was a little minimal but ok. You could help yourself to bagles, oatmeal, doughnuts and fruit as well as coffee, tea, hot chocolate and juice. We found the complimentary wifi very handy but if you don't have a computer/smart phone with you, there are computers for use in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressive”
Reviews.Author: StarletDublin
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a 4 night stay at the Charlesmark and I wasn't too impressed. The location is great and its ok value for money. It was also good to have internet access and lots of movies. However the bedrooms are pretty small and the beds are tiny. They are so short and narrow it wasn't very comfortable and I'm only 5'3'. The staff aren't the friendliest and the room cleaning service is pretty laid back. For instance on 2 occasions we dropped back to our room at 2pm and the room still wasn't made up, pretty inconvenient. I would definitely look for somewhere different if I was to go back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Charlesmark”
Reviews.Author: QueenieC
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week's holiday in Boston and stayed at the Charlesmark throughout. Having read the reviews on here we requested a Queen room on the 6th floor. This was perfect for our needs, we overlooked the Boston Public Library and the marathon finishing line. There was no noticeable noise and we were certainly not disturbed by anything. The room was not massive but plenty big enough and very comfortable. Not a lot of hanging space for clothes but loads of shelving space so that was not a problem, the iron and ironing board were a nice touch too. The shower room was excellent and a high quality range of toiletries were provided each day. TV/audio facilities were brilliant, the DVD/VHS library was a bonus - after a day's walking and sightseeing there were a couple of evenings when we did not feel like going out so just relaxed and watched a film in our room. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, the rooms were very clean, there was tea/coffee/fresh orange availabe free of charge in the lounge 24/7 and bottled water left in the room each morning. Breakfast was fine, staff were vigilant in keeping everything topped up. Bagels/doughnuts/muffins/jams/cream cheese/oats/fresh fruit/coffee/tea/orange juice all very fresh and plentiful. Free use of internet and printer was very useful especially when it came to printing boarding passes for return journey. Very best of all though was the perfect location, right in the middle of everything with the green line T station just over the road. We loved Boston and cannot speak highly enough of the Charlesmark. We could not fault it or its staff in any way and would highly recommend it to everyone. If there was anything at all I could have wished for it would be a safe in the room but reception would have been happy for us to use their safe had we requested it. Go, go, go! Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Charlesmark perfect for Boston”
Reviews.Author: AoSPR
Reviews.Content: Let's first dispense with the only neg: yes, the rooms are small. But this is a small building and the spaces were very cleverly distributed. It was not uncomfortable at all. Room size is sufficient to crash after walking the city and they are fairly new, well decorated, very clean and I didn't experience any noise problems. Now with the good: This was my first time in Boston. I made the reservations by e-mail for pre and post cruise stays. The e-mail reservation was handled swiftly, as was my re-confirmation request. Price/value - I really looked around and couldn't find anything better in such a central location. $206.00 is really a good deal for this little jewel of a place. Location - Excellent. If the location was any better, it would probably be ruined. We walked everywhere from the hotel. Steps from the Prudential mall, T-Station, Newbury street, and right next to some pretty good restaurants (make reservations early). Check in - We first arrived around 6:00 Pm on a Friday and the check in process was fast and painless. Nice young lady at the desk. On our second check in, we arrived too early, but another nice young lady took our bags and was very dilligent in informing us when our room was ready. Our bags were waiting for us in the room. Facilities - Nice bar just off the lobby. Great bartenders. Good people-watching outside deck. PC's and laser jet printer available for guests just off the bar. Again, building is small but the elevator is full size. Food - The hotel has an adequate and basic breakfast available for free. There's a Thai restaurant right next door. I didn't try it but the other guests seem to like it. They serve in the hotel as if it were a hotel restaurant, but it is not. There are many nearby eating places, from cheap and fast to very upscale. On busy nights, wait times can be from one to two hours so make reservations early. We tried the Legal Seafoods at the nearby Prudential - overrated. We settled for the Cheesecake Factory also at Prudential (we had enough seafood and gourmet cooking during our cruise). It's the best value as restaurants here are too expensive. Attractions - I cannot emphasize enough about the central location of this place. In two hours, we leisurely walked from the hotel, to the Gardens, Commons, Freedom Trail up to the Quincy Market. We took the T green line back (that sucked). On an evening, we walked around Newbury just behind the hotel. Did I say that the hotel is in the middle of everything? Plumbing problems and such - NONE. Everything worked just fine. Check out - Also painless. We left early for the airport and the gentleman manning the desk was nice enough to help us with our bags and even risked life and limb to step into the street with a whistle and a flashlight to hail a cab from the nearby Lennox hotel for us. Before we had a chance to thank him, he was already walking away. I say this because he did so very professionally, not hanging around expecting a tip or anything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: auntietat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Charlesmark from 9/29 to 10/4, based on the great reviews on Tripadvisor.com. We stayed (2 people) in room 501, "Queen" room on the 5th floor facing the street. We brought earplugs due to some of the reviews below, but I never ended up needing them. Even with the construction going on at the Boston Public Library directly across the street, it was not that noisy. The room was small-ish (like a lot of European hotels), but was totally fine. We had plenty of room to put our clothes on the bookshelves, and store our luggage away in the cabinet. Bed was super comfortable, shower was good. The only small qualm I had was that the room needed more lights/lamps. Location of the hotel was GREAT, and the staff at the Charlesmark were all very nice and helpful, too. Breakfast was fine (fresh fruit, oatmeal, coffee, tea, bagels, muffins, donuts), and there are 2 computers in the lounge for guests to use. Housekeeping did a great job of straightening the room everyday, and provided complimentary bottled water in the room each day! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lanneNL
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in the Charlesmark Hotel in Boston, and it was definitely worth it! Okay, if you are looking for a big room in a chain 13-in-a-dozen hotel room, the charlesmark is not your place to be. If you are however looking for a charming hotel in an excellent location in Boston, this is it! The rooms are indeed small, but everything is custommade for the room, and you have a good bed, tv, stereo with in bathroom speakers, reading chair, airco and great bathroom with lovely shower. Add 2 free bottles of water daily, a lively hotel bar downstairs (open to public), free wireless internet and 2 computers for use downstairs, and good service to that, and you sort of have the charlesmark! There is a complimentary brekafast every morning with bagels, doughnuts and muffins and fruit. The location is execllent: across the street from copley square including T-station, around the corner from newburey street, and amidst all great restaurants, bars and shops from backbay (and copley square and prudential centre). Only minor side: as said, small rooms, and there is an AC-unit outside the back which you do hear, however, I have to say that I never woke up because of it, I just heard it when I accidentally woke up by something else! After all, I would definitely recommend the Charlesmark!

Reviews.Title: “Great location wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gomac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Charlesmark Sept 21 and 22, 2008 and it was a wonderful choice. It's location almost across from the T is very convenient. The continental breakfast selection is awesome and easy to serve yourself. The bar is lively and you can entertain yourself peoplewatching from the front tables. The front desk was extremely helpful. The printer on the hotel guest computer wasn't working and they let me print my boarding passes on their printer. The computers are usually unused and fast. The front desk directed me to the PO, a fax place, called a cab when we departed....going out in the street with a whistle and a flashlight to hail one from the nearby cab stand. The response was instant. They were just super. While I was there I heard several people come to the desk and 'complain' about the room size. It is small, a bit like a railcar bedroom. But the layout is very convenient. The bathroom is lovely and large. There is plenty of storage space for 2 people. However if you want a large sitting area or something this hotel is not for you. The hotel's public area is very comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a room in the back - if you want quiet”
Reviews.Author: Merrymonk
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at this very nice hotel; a number of individuals complain about the noise; I asked for a room in the back and we heard absolutely no noise. It was hard to believe that one could be in a city and not hear any street noise. Room size was very acceptable for 2 adults, adequate storage under the bed and for clothes that needed to be on hangers. Location is fantastic!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My second stay here was not as good as my first: noise was awful”
Reviews.Author: GMY68
Reviews.Content: There are many fabulous things about this hotel, which I will lay out below. I enjoyed my first stay, a year ago, but my recent stay was sadly clouded by two extremely noisy and sleepless nights. I was given a standard room at the back of the hotel. You might think that this would be a quiet option (i.e. away from the main, busy street) but it was a bit of a nightmare, for two reasons. First, there's a very noisy vent that blows loudly through the night. With ear plugs, one can just about handle this. But second, at 3.30am every night an extremely loud garbage truck comes by, very slowly, to pick up what sound like glass bottles from the bins behind the restaurants. Yikes. It was really painful being woken up both nights by this crazy, crashing noise (I was in town to give some lectures, and so having sleep interrupted was a real downer). So you should be aware of this problem. If you are a very heavy sleeper, maybe you'll be fine. As for the great things, there are many: *Terrific location *Stylish design *Very friendly and helpful staff *Free wireless, two computers with printer (so you can check-in online for flights and print your boarding pass) *Very clean and comfortable rooms, with lots of nice touches e.g. free bottled water *The bar is lively and really a great place to meet friends *It is decent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: dadsnowman
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great vacation in the northeast US and spent three nights in Boston. I struggled with selecting a hotel in Boston as the cost for most of the hotels in the areas was outrageous. A week before leaving, I ran onto the Charlesmark Hotel and after reading the reviews decided to make a reservation. It was a great choice. The room was very comfortable and decorated very uniquely. We loved the bathroom; very nicely done with the stonework and very spacious. The stereo system you can hear even in the bathroom was a great addition. Our evenings in Boston were especially enjoyable by having the pleasure of visiting with the awesome bartender, Vanessa. She was such a joy to visit with while kicking back and having a few drinks ... she's a true keeper Charlesmark!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ARGOMAN
Reviews.Content: After finding this hotel and reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided to book at the Charlesmark. We found the staff to be very nice and willing to assist with all the little things, like watching our luggage before the check in time and even after signing out, so that we could take in few more sights of Back bay before leaving for our flight. The location is excellent and our room was on the forth floor, looking out on the Library and the Boston Marathon finish line. Our room was clean, with a good bed and pillows to crash after a day of sight seeing. Noise from outside was minimal, given our windows looked out on to a main street with lot's of cars and patios. The price was excellent for the quality and location of the hotel. We took the T line (subway) everywhere or just walked to our destination. The only item we had was a light that did not work in the shower, but it was not needed since the bathroom was well lit. Maid staff is very good. With this kind of hotel available in Boston, why spend more for a high price chain when you can stay at one with character. Would recommend this to anyone, but note that rooms are smaller than usual hotel rooms, but "space" is really not an issue if you are only using to shower and sleep after a beautiful day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a lively part of the city”
Reviews.Author: agrippina17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Charlesmark hotel with friends for 5 nights in late August and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The hotel rooms are small (around 3m by 5m for the main room) but it didn't bother us - we have stayed in smaller rooms in the US, and a lot of thought had clearly gone into making the most of the space (tabletop ironing board in the cupboard, pull-out bedside table space). The bed seemed to be a little bit short, though. The building is very overlooked but the hotel has venetian blinds for privacy. The bathroom was shower only, but it was great. The room itself was very clean and a good size and the shower was very powerful and hot. Shampoo, shower gel, body lotion and mouthwash were provided. The TV allows free access to hundreds of channels and there was also a DVD player and stereo in the room. Local phone calls are free - but longer distance or international calls are not available through the hotel's phone system; you have to buy a phone card from the CVS or Walgreen's stores (about 1-2 mins from the hotel) and use this to dial out. There were two internet terminals in the hotel lounge which were free to use (and very seldom in use!). There was no safe in the room, and no minibar. However, there was an icebucket, and ice was available from a machine on the first floor. The bar in the hotel was great (very strong cocktails!) so there wasn't much call for a minibar in any case. Housekeeping left two free bottles of water in the room each day. The best thing about the Charlesmark is the location - right in the centre of town opposite the public library and 2 minutes from the Copley T stop. The next street up is Newbury Street, which is great for shopping and even better for finding somewhere good to eat and drink in the evening. It was also easy to get around Boston from the hotel - both on foot and using the T. The hotel breakfast is basic and self-service but good quality: lots of different bagels (with jam and cream cheese), oatmeal sachets, doughnuts, muffins and fruit, plus coffee, fruit juice and iced water. For something more substantial, the cafe in the Trident Bookstore on Newbury Street serves really delicious cooked breakfasts. The Charlesmark is perfect if you want somewhere modern and central, and are planning on spending most of your time exploring the city. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - great location”
Reviews.Author: netheredger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about cost and location. Compared to most hotels in Boston with such a good location, this is great value for money. Yes, the standard rooms are small but more of a problem was the small bed. However the rooms are very clean and well equipped. Great shower, good bedding and towels and the room cleaned and re-equipped each day. Above all else this hotel is in a great location. You can literally walk anywhere and the subway, which is safe and efficient if a little shabby, is right across the road. Overall, excellent value for money for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good”
Reviews.Author: cantwait2getthere
Reviews.Content: Here's the good: -Very convenient location close to the T -Nicely furnished room and nice decor throughout the hotel. -Even though the hotel doesn't offer any official laundry service, the front desk staff accommodated our laundry needs by getting housekeeping to put a load on for us while we were out touring the city (for a $10 fee). -The hotel accommodated my request to have a room on one of the two top floors so that there was less street noise. -The variety of television channels was HUGE. The bad: -The room is indeed very small, though this didn't bother me all that much because boutique hotels in Boston and New York tend to be small, so I expected it. -The "breakfast" offered downstairs was sad. Hard-as-a-rock bagels and some bitter coffee doesn't really constitute breakfast in my mind. -The view from the room consisted of a brick wall about four feet from the window. All in all, yes, I would stay there again considering it was very centrally located and very clean, and it was one of the only hotels I could find in downtown Boston for under $200 a night. However, next time I would factor in the cost of eating breakfast out each morning when comparing prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of small rooms, but great location”
Reviews.Author: tripgrl727272
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Charlesmark for three nights the second week of August. I booked us a "double" room on Expedia. I had read reviews prior to booking that mentioned the rooms being "small", but I had no idea exactly how small that could mean! Our double room was so little that we couldn't open our suitcases on the floor at the same time (there was no suitcase stand, because it wouldn't have fit.) The bed was so short, that my feet hung over the edge (I am 5 ft 8.) Needless to say, we did not get much sleep that night. The next morning, we went to the front desk to ask for a bigger room. They were very nice and accommodating, and immediately moved us into a "queen" room. This room was very appropriate in size, and we were very happy with it. The location of the hotel is great, just a few blocks south of Boston Common. We really liked the old feel of the hotel, and we would likely book here again.... being very careful not to select a DOUBLE room when booking!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a little freshening up”
Reviews.Author: The_Sherriff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Charlesmark as an alternative to the mega-convention hotels in Back Bay for a major conference. It was mostly a very pleasant experience - the staff are particularly friendly and helpful and the rooms clean and well-equipped. They are small, but Boston hotel rooms often are and I found this one more manageable than the poky little closet that I got at the Omni Parker House last time I was in the city. The complimentary continental breakfast was good value, particularly when faced with a challenging day of eating for the company. The rooms are remarkably quiet considering the location on Boylston, which is quite a party street. The air conditioning is also discreet and effective so I got some really good sleep, which was much needed to work from 08:30 until 22:00. However, all the awards are for the opening in 2006 and some investment is becoming due. Frankly, the towels were threadbare and I would not have been surprised to put my feet through the sheets. I also had some intricate cross-cultural negotiations to get a plug for the bathroom hand-basin (or a stopper for the bathroom sink, if you are reading this in US English).

Reviews.Title: “All show and little substance”
Reviews.Author: Firenzenelmondo
Reviews.Content: The first time that I disagree with the reviews. The hotel is expensive for the cost that IÂ´ve paid. The front desk was ugly when I arrived for the check in

Reviews.Title: “Loved Charlesmark!”
Reviews.Author: prczar
Reviews.Content: The Charlesmark is a charm of a hotel..with only 40 or so rooms you really feel like its home away from home.Went with my teenage daughter for two nights and it was the perfect location. All the staff was extremely pleasant..especially Kyle, the hotel Manager..he always greeted us with a smile and hello upon entering and exiting the hotel. The bar area was great! Everyone is so friendly and the martinis were terrific. The Thai food which we enjoyed on the outside patio was incredible. Morning breakfast which is included was perfect..yummy blueberry muffins, assorted bagels and coffee. Back to the location..we walked everywhere..Newbury was one street behind us and the walk to Faneuil Hall was great. We didn't walk to Harvard..way tooo far:)..but we took the transit system and we were there in less than 30 minutes and it was very safe. Overall..great experience at The Charlesmark..rooms are cozy..beds very comfortable and the shower is gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “it was impossible to have information and to reserve!!!”
Reviews.Author: Coppiabrazil
Reviews.Content: WeÂ´ve decided to write to Chalesmark Hotel to plan a travel with others friends in the next May 2009 after to have read the good references left by others travellers. We sent to them 2 emails and theyÂ´ve not answered to us. We call for them (from Brazil!) to know if the email address was incorrect and anyway if they have rooms. Who attended to the phone was really ugly saying to me that they are a small hotel and they have only "few" rooms avaliable for the next May (now weÂ´re in July 2008!!!). I think just that they donÂ´t want to reserve to us and this was really unpleasent. Anyway they could answer to our email. In my opinion REALLY overestimated!

Reviews.Title: “Local, More Interesting Hotel than rest of area”
Reviews.Author: SkyHigh72
Reviews.Content: Splurged with the girls and had a weekend at this cute hotel. It is a PERFECT location in Boylston Street at Copley Square. Great lounge was friendly and happy to see us every night. Compared to all the other hotels in the area, which are your run of the mill corporate bleh, this is a gem. Hotel is decorated in GORGEOUS artwork which is, according to the staff, all done by local artists. Neat! All in all this place was a great local flavor, fun and relaxing. With free internet, too... which should be the standard these days.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home..”
Reviews.Author: alias720
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Charlesmark while attending a conference at the nearby convention center. We arrived early Saturday morning, and our room was unfortunately not ready yet, but it was perfect time to take the time to go around. By the time we got back, our bags were in our room, and music greeted us as we entered the room (very nice!) If you're looking for a regular hotel room, this is NOT FOR YOU! I've only stayed in one boutique hotel (not by choice) in NYC, and this hotel room was so much better! Even though it's a boutique hotel, the room was pretty spacious. And the bathroom was really nice. Unfortunately, there aren't any closets so if you have to hang anything up, you have use the door knobs (bring hangers). The room also had direct tv-so if you're looking to spend some time in your room, you'll definitely have something to keep you entertained. I spent a little bit of time at the bar-which I thought was nice-nothing special. The hotel also had a small internet cafe with only two computers. The hotel also provides a small breakfast: bagels, muffins, coffee, tea, water, oatmeal. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at the Charlesmark Hotel. The hotel was very comfortable, I felt like I was home! Also, the hotel is located near a lot of different restaurants and the "T"- we took public transportation to all our destinations. Have fun in Beantown!

Reviews.Title: “Half excellent / Half Poor = Average”
Reviews.Author: Pert_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Charlesmark in May 2008 for 2 nights, and I had a mixed experience. I arrived early (my fault) and my room wasn't ready. The receptionist checked for any available rooms but said the only one she had was near the bar and I had asked for a quiet one - top marks for knowing my request and acting on it. She said she'd ring me when my room was ready and took my mobile phone number - great. Unfortunately she never did ring, so that was a shame and left me wandering around the city for longer than I needed to, but not a big deal and she did store my luggage. I returned later that afternoon and they'd already moved my bags from their store up to my room - fantastic service! The room was very nice, wonderfully clean & beautifully decorated, with great attention to detail. Not a massive room, but perfectly fine - don't listen to the people whining about tiny tiny rooms and poor decoration, unless you're planning on bringing more than a couple of suitcases when it might get crowded. However, despite being given a "quiet" room overlooking an outdoor void / shaft surrounded by brick walls, I was repeatedly woken all night by a huge fan at the bottom of this void that kept starting up, running for 10 minutes and then shutting down again. Every time it restarted (regularly, roughly every 30 minutes) there was a large bang before the loud whirring started. I could have slept through the whirring, but the bang woke me up every time all night. There are several other rooms overlooking this fan, so I can't see how anybody in any of them could have got much sleep either. I complained the next morning and got moved to another room, which was actually bigger and nicer than the first, but at the front of the hotel. This was a bit noisier than I would have liked (you overlook the main road) but at least it quietened down later at night, unlike the fan. So what to conclude? I really liked the style of the hotel, the food downstairs from the Thai restaurant was excellent, the rooms were great and it's very good value. I was slightly annoyed that I ordered a gin and tonic from the bar and it was completely flat - when I called the waitress over she immediately asked if it was flat...so why did she give it to me? She replaced it very politely, with a fractionally less flat G&T, but it was still far from sparkling. So I'm giving the Charlesmark an average rating because I really wouldn't go back there because I couldn't be sure I'd get any sleep. It's a real shame, as someone has obviously put a lot of effort into making it a stylish place to stay and the location is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent little find”
Reviews.Author: Jchand62
Reviews.Content: We found such good reviews on tripadvisor that we decided to give the Charlesmark Hotel a go. It is in the heart of Boston right across from the T and is priced very well. It is recently renovated, the breakfast was good, and the staff is extremely friendly. A nice touch was the XM radaio in the rooms and the complimentary bottled water each morning. It is in walking distance to the new Apple Store, the shops on Newbury, Trinity CHurch, Boston Commons, you name it. Overall excellent stay and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Brigida52
Reviews.Content: Very nicely designed hotel in the beautiful Boston Back Bay. I especially loved the view from my 6th floor room out onto Boylston street and the Boston Public Library.

Reviews.Title: “Quite impressed”
Reviews.Author: number44rick
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay at the Charlesmark in Downtown Boston. Although the weekend was damp and cold it didn't hamper us from having a great time in this marvellous city. The Charlesmark proved to be everything I expected it to be: 1. Reasonably priced. 2. Excellent location.. 3. Personable staff who were very eager to attend to all our requests. 4. Very clean. The rooms were a little on the small side but this didn't pose a serious problem. The bathrooms were good size and clean. The only real drawback was the parking was further than I would have liked and the price was not as advertised. Next time I'm in Boston I'll definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tonyeng
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights. Great location but I would say it was a posh B&B more than a hotel. The room was very small and there was nowhere to hang anything up. There was an old fashoined TV and VHS player but no clear instructions how to operate them. There is a thai restaurant next door that delivers entrees and appetizers to the hotel bar/lounge. We ordered some appetizers from the bar and they took 1hr to arrive. Bar lively. Breakfast was very basic. Would I stay here again? Yes

Reviews.Title: “Great, Hip Bargain Hotel With Personality!”
Reviews.Author: TRP1966
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four night stay at the Charlesmark due to a business conference in Boston. I had done a lot of cheking prior to making a reservation because it is a pretty expensive town in which to stay, and even the "conference rates" for other hotels were out of my limited budget. Then I discovered the Charlesmark, which is a true diamond in the rough. Sandwiched between a Ritz Camera store and a really cool Thai place, the hotel is small and lean. I had read some critiques of the rooms being somewhat small and dark, and they were accurate. I could live with the size, but despite the best efforts of the staff, they could not find me a lamp. But that was cool, because the Charlesmark staff is second to none in terms of the personality and customer service skills of the staff. Unfortunately, I can't remember all the names, but Nikki - who took my reservation, helped get me a sweet deal (for the area) on the room and never acted annoyed with my umpteen million calls with an equal amount of questions; Vanessa at the bar who makes a mean margarita and always had a welcoming, friendly smile, and Scott, the other guy who worked the desk, stand out in particular. There are others, but in general, I was very happy with the staff, as many of the other area hotels won't give you the time of day when you call to ask a question, or need some help, or just a friendly face when your hoisting a drink or two at the end of the day. And the location of this place is awaesome as well, as you can pretty much walk to all the cool spots, and cabs are all over the place if you're not up to it. The only real negative, aside from the aforementioned minor inconveniences mentioned above is that there is a large population of homeless folks in this area, and while safety was never really a concern, they constantly hit you up for change. It got a to a point where I was recognizing them and even got a few of their names. But I understand this is a problem with the city in general, so it's not a beef with the hotel itself. Would I stay there again? You bet! In fact, I'd still be there now were it not for the fact that I have an early flight and wanted to be cloer to Logan. Plus they were booked tonight when I tried to add a fifth one on when my travel plans changed. But even then, they put me on a list to let me know if anything opened up, and no doubt would have set me up, as right as I was leaving, there was a cancellation. Unfortunately, I was set to get closer to Logan so I passed it up. I wouldn't stay here (sorry guys) if this were a family trip due to the room size, but if you're a business traveller on the go, or a couple looking for a cool place to stay for a Boston getaway, the Charlesmark could be your home for a few days. They sure treat you like family. Cool places nearby - Bukawski's, Uno, lenox, Whiskeys, ust to name a few. Hope this helps and that the good folks over there read this stuff too. And this is not something I usually do. Definately check this place out! Cheers...TRP in 403...

Reviews.Title: “Excellant stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: BrianScotland73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from Boston where we stayed at the Charlesmark Hotel for 5 nights. The Location of the Hotel could not be better only a short walk or subway ride to all the major attractions. The rooms although small where exceptionally clean and very comfortable and the staff very friendly and helpful. The bar was an excellent place to relax at night with a good selection of beers available. The only thing that could have been better would be the breakfast which was a little poor, Boston is a fantastic city, so laid back and friendly with lots to do and see. The shops, restaurants and bars are excellent. It's easy to get around on foot and also has a good inexpensive Subway system if a little confusing at first. I would highly recommend a visit to Boston and a stay at the Charlesmark

Reviews.Title: “This was a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: englishmarilyn
Reviews.Content: Returned today from three days at the Charlesmark. After the hotel in New York (Radio City Apartments), this was so much nicer. Free breakfast, coffee/tea and water all day, free internet access. The rooms are small but well equipped, beds very comfortable and everyone is so pleasant. We were the oldest people there, but didn't feel at all out of place. Our last day, we sat on the terrace drinking wine and eating wonderful Thai food from the adjoining restaurant. The area is perfect for the best shopping in Newbury Street and Neiman Marcus/Saks/Lord and Tailor are close by . The Hotel is adjacent to the T which will take you anywhere in town. Don't miss the JFK Library.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: EuroReisen
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Charlesmark and agree with many of the previous reviewers: the location and price can't be beat. The main purpose of my trip to Boston was shopping, and the location of the Charlesmark in the Back Bay neighborhood, just a block off Newbury and close to Copley Place, was ideal. Additionally, the T stop just down the street made getting around the rest of the city very easy. The price was also at least $100 cheaper than anything else I was able to find in the neighborhood. Other reviewers have raved about the friendly and attentive staff, but unfortunately this was not my experience. I arrived a couple hours before the check-in time, and my room was not yet ready, which I was expecting. I think the guy manning the desk was the same another review described as indifferent, and I agree; he wasn't exactly rude, but he also wasn't very helpful. Anyway, when I came back later close to the official check-in time, my room was ready, and my bags had already been brought up. By then, someone new was at the desk to actually check me in, and she was much more pleasant but still did not give me any information about the room, hotel, etc. For example, had I not read here that breakfast was provided in the lobby, I never would have known, as she didn't tell me and nothing in the "Guest Information" in the room mentioned it (and it was served in the upper lobby, tucked away from the elevator and flow of traffic). I overheard another guest checking in later during my stay, and she got a full spiel about breakfast, internet, etc. Also, during my four-day stay, I could hardly get anyone at the desk to look up, much less say hello, during my various comings and goings. I had a room on the sixth floor, and the view out the big windows was actually quite nice. The room was quite small by American standards but perfect for my needs (and not unexpected after reading previous reviews here). The DirectTV and radio were nice, as was the complimentary water. Overall, though, the room I had could use some TLC. The carpet in the bedroom was loose along one wall, especially outside the bathroom door, and caused me to catch my toe a time or two. A light bulb was out in the bathroom (and was not replaced during my stay), and a dial on the wall that I assume was volume control for the sound system didn't work. The room had a cordless phone, but the battery in the handset needed replacement, meaning all calls had to be quick to avoid being cut off when the battery died. The hotel also had free wireless internet access, but the signal was so weak in my room that it was essentially useless. And oddly, the room had a folding chair (not sure why) in the closet/cupboard but no suitcase stand, which would have been much more convenient than the floor. Other small things would really make a big difference: replace the thin blanket and bedspread with a nice duvet. Get rid of the VCR (who needs it when there's DirectTV?), and replace the old TV with an LCD on a swing arm to make the awkwardly high position more easy to adjust and view. Add a programmable thermostat so that the fan isn't constantly running. Keep a better eye on the breakfast room so that things are well stocked and the tables aren't dirty and full of trash. Overall, the hotel was good but not great. It really is so close to being fantastic that the small things (and unfortunately there were many that really added up) took away from what could have been a perfect experience. I would definitely consider returning, though, mostly because of the unbeatable location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Reminded me of a 'European style' hotel... and not in a good way”
Reviews.Author: Traveller R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Back Bay area, almost right across the street from the Boston Public Library and about two blocks from the Prudential Center Shops. A block in the opposite direction from Copley Square and a stop to catch the "T" train. My room was located on the third floor, facing Boylston Street. Noticeably noisy throughout the day, particularly in the morning and evening rush hour times. The room interior had high ceilings, and was sparsely furnished with light wood accents. There was no closet but instead a mini-clothesrack. There was an iron with a miniature ironing board in the room. The work desk area is a pullout shelf but is decently lit. There is a folding chair tucked away in the the mini-closet area for seating. The mini-fridge is restocked daily with 2 complimentary bottles of water; don't plan on keeping any food in the mini-fridge as it barely has room for the two bottles of water. Completing the room is a large TV with DVD/VHS player, Stereo receiver, Direct TV and surround sound. The hotel offers a complimentary VHS library. No fitness center - you have to buy a $15 day pass to the Boston Sports Club. No swimming pool - you have to buy a $20 day pass to the Sheraton Hotel Health Club. No room service - if you want to dine in your room you have to order in from a neighborhood restaurant or use the suggested diningin.com option - it takes 45-60 minutes to arrive and although you can order from several restaurants, there is a $6.75 per restaurant charge for delivery and a $10 minimum per restaurant. There is also a decent thai restaurant next door that delivers entrees and appetizers to the hotel bar/lounge. The bar can get noisy but the lounge in back is nice with plenty of comfortable seating. I was not able to access the internet via their wireless service, despite numbeous calls to the front desk. I was asked if I used Mozilla or Firefox and when I replied that I used Windows Internet Explorer, I was told, "Oh, that could be part of the problem". There is a Starbucks about 2 blocks away with Tmobile Hotspots as well as the public library right across the street. Not a great hotel for the business traveler, but okay for tourists looking for a decently priced hotel in the Back Bay area. It was almost $100 less per night than the nearby Marriott and Westin brands, but I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: blackstar9
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend in Boston in mid-February. Check in was quick, then up to our room on the 5th floor, front of the building, looking across to the public library. Rooms were decorated nicely, mood music playing. The view at night was nice as well. Getting to the hotel was easy, parked out front to register, then just a few blocks away to the recommended garage. The walk back is not bad, just stop at either a Dunkin Donuts or Starbuck along the way. The room was nicely appointed. Good bed, sheets, furniture. After a night on the town, got back to the hotel around 10pm, bar was busy, but could have found a seat if we wanted. We needed dessert, so doorman recommended the Cheesecake factory just a short walk away. Felt completely safe walking around at night. They offer coffee, juice, and donuts in the morning, just enough to get you moving. Room was quite, could not hear neighbors or street traffic. Overall, great stay, would stay there next time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location + great price= fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: UM1997
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference and all of the conference hotels were booked- since I used to live in Boston, I remembered the Charlesmark and was very pleased to not only find that they had rooms available, but to find out that their room rates were almost $100 less than the other area hotels!! We arrived early in the day and they let us check in early. It's true that the rooms are on the small side, but I found the space to be more than ample for just me. The room had a queen sized bed and a small pull out sofa. My bathroom was smaller because I was next to the elevator, but I was very happy with the slate tile and the large shower stall. My co-worker's bathroom was about 3X the size of mine, and he had a bathtub, but the trade off was that I had 2 huge windows overlooking the Boston Public Library while he had a window to the alley. Since I was right next to the elevator, I expected it to be loud throughout the night but was very surprised when it was quiet all night long. I love city noise, so I wasn't disturbed being right on busy Boylston St., but if you're not used to nighttime city noise, it might take some getting used to! I think one thing that we all loved was that the room is wired with surround sound and besides the Direct TV channels, it also has all of the music channels, so showering with music playing was a big hit for all of us! The hotel serves a small continental breakfast in the morning with fruit, bagels, muffins & donuts & instant oatmeal. There is also coffee & juice. Since I'm familiar with the area, I opted to grab breakfast elsewhere but I did bring it back and sat in the hotel's lounge to eat. The lounge is really nice and at night, turns into a very hip bar. It got pretty busy on the weekend but was still a nice chill place to relax. The Charlesmark's location can't be beat. You're right across from the Copley T stop and within walking distance of pretty much the entire city. I highly recommend this hotel. I know that when I come back to Boston, this is definitely where I will stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Charlesmark ROCKS... literally!”
Reviews.Author: dissident19
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at the Charlesmark Hotel if you are NOT a fan of impeccable service, an unbeatable atmosphere, great interior design, surround sound XM radio throughout your room, incredibly convenient location, and an ultra-chic lounge that also manages to be lots of fun at the same time. This hotel has thought of everything, from satellite radio in your bathroom, to two free bottles of water in your room everyday, free wireless internet access, and of course the complimentary continental breakfast. While you're there, make sure to say hello to Jefferson and Justine in the lounge, and tell them Travis sent you. The Charlesmark truly is a hidden gem in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not for people with cars!”
Reviews.Author: DartmouthTravels
Reviews.Content: The two best things about this hotel are 1- price, and 2- location. The hotel, right across the street from the Boston Public Library and Copley Square, leaves the traveler right in the heart of Boston. Public transportation (the T) is located only steps from the front door, and the Charlesmark benefits from many nearby restaurants. While other travelers claim the Charlesmark is designed in "modern style," I felt I could do similar work in my dorm room with a trip to Ikea. The hotel is clean, but I actually felt that $139 was more than I should have paid for my queen bed room overlooking Boylston street/ the library. There is surround sound music (even in the bathrooms), and the bed was quite comfortable. The shower didn't always offer hot water. For location and price, it works...but one should not expect anything extraordinary. Furthermore, because we paid $32 for parking, we didn't really feel like we saved much from having chosen the Charlesmark. In the end, we thought it was a funny experience and something unlike what we would normally choose. I would probably pay around $200 next time to get parking and a much-upgraded room nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JF945
Reviews.Content: The Charlesmark Hotel is an excellent, small hotel. It only has 33 rooms and it's in a great location in Boston. I do live in the greater Boston area but some friends come up annually for a convention. We found this hotel 3 years ago and it was a great find. Rates are less than the larger hotels in Boston. If you are looking for a pool, health club, though, this is not the place for you. The Charlesmark doesn't have either of these amenities but they do have agreements with a health club in the area for use if you are so inclined. There is free internet in the common area as well as continental breakfast each morning. The breakfast has tea, coffee, hot chocolate, fruit, muffins, bagels, juice. The lower level (basement) has a microwave and ice machine. During the day, the bar isn't open and it becomes a place to sit and read the paper or watch TV. The large common area also has comfortable seating and at night this area doubles as a club. It is up a few stairs and one night there was a private party up there. The steps made it easy for the management to close it off for the private event. Each room has toiletries, iron/ironing board, hair dryer, CD/ DVD player. Our room for 3 had a double bed and a twin sleep sofa with wall shelves and an armoire with plenty of storage.The only thing the rooms lack is a refrigerator. Bottles of water are placed in the room but it would be nice if they were cold. A small cube fridge in each room would make it perfect. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: bigdog6668
Reviews.Content: The Charlesmark is a hidden gem. My son and I traveled to Boston for an audition at Berklee College of Music and this was the perfect place to stay. The hotel is located just steps from the Copley stop on the Green line. It has a trendy, boutique feel to it. The staff was excellent - very helpful. I asked for a lunch recommendation and they sent us to the Parish Cafe (outstanding sandwiches and an amazing gourmet mac and cheese). We stayed in 502 and had a great view of the Boston Public Library. The breakfast was mediocre at best, but why would you want to eat at a hotel when there are great spots all around you on Newberry Street. While the room was on the small side, it was appointed well and the granite bathroom and shower was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the CharlesMark”
Reviews.Author: lxoxoxo
Reviews.Content: First time at the CharlesMark and I will certainly go back! The girl at the front desk was extremely helpful, the bar staff was great - friendly, entertaining, great martinis. The room we had was fabulous. Clean, modern - everything you need. It was great walking into the room with the lights dimmed, a great smell and classical music playing softly from the speakers - just a nice extra added touch. Great location on Boylston St. Great prices. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great place to start our holiday”
Reviews.Author: EricWindsor
Reviews.Content: Very easy to find from the underground station. Rooms small by American standards but big enough for a couple of days stay. The one down side was the air-conditioning - it was very hot when we arrived in Boston so we had to use the air-con. Our unit was noisy and so was the one in the room next door. The breakfast provided was a good way to start the day. The hotel staff were friendly, room was clean and shower was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: alaskajazz
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Charlesmark was outstanding. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel has a wonderful design and atmosphere. Everything we asked for we received and the martini bar in the lobby was busy but comfortable. There were holiday parties going on in the lounge area but services were still available to the guests throughout. Our questions were always answered and every need taken care of. The rooms were small but were so well designed that 3 of us fit just fine. Breakfast was just enough with fresh fruit and pastries as there are so many excellent restaurants in the area, it provided just enough to get us through to lunch. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the Back Bay area. It is one of the best boutique hotels I've stayed in and within walking distance to everything in Back Bay. Thank you Charlesmark for making our stay so comfortable! We'll definitely be back and wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Totally detested the Charlesmark!”
Reviews.Author: colmil
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back in England from Boston and three nights at this hotel. I have always trusted Tripadvisors comments as we travel quite extensively, but were they wrong this time! As soon as we walked into the foyer I could tell what we had let ourselves in for, black and grey was the greeting, it continued in the lift, into the passagway, yes, grey carpet, grey walls. Into the room, grey walls and carpet, a huge mirror greeted us, 6'high x over 5' wide, wow!, however, the tiny wardrobe, only 4' high a 12" wide and contained a fold-up chair and an ironing board was totally useless.. Nowhere to store clothes, so our luggage had to placed on the floor, it could not go under the bed because the minimilistic moron who designed the room had boxed the underside out so it looked pretty, but, again, totally useless. The bedside lights were on a dimmer on the wall which no-one explained, we had to guess, they did not adjust heightwise so we had to turn the head of the light which was in our faces when we were reading. There were two large windows, with charcoal grey blinds, obviously no curtains. The shower was grey slate walls, and dark quarry tiled floor. The Lounge was grey, cream vinyl diamonds on the walls, and guess what colour the carpet was? If you want to wake up in a morning and know what living in a prison cell is like, stay here! I simply cannot understand how owners of a hotel can ignore the absolute basics of travel, i.e. comfort and practibility, this dump has neither.

Reviews.Title: “Boston: " Three nights at the Charlesmark"”
Reviews.Author: GTBlackwell
Reviews.Content: November 15-18, 2007 Trip Advisor member, Auburn, AL My wife, daughter , her boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Charlesmark. Staff is beyond terrific, Great modern design, exceptional location and very good rates. We like small European like hotels, as close as we have found in the US....We would look no further in our next visits.......Gaines Blackwell

Reviews.Title: “Loud and Terrible-Buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: jtraveler76
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I are as easy at it comes when to traveling, and I can honestly say that staying at this hotel is a risk, a risk not worth taking I might add. While the rooms are clean, the staff is laughable at best and it was one of the loudest hotels we have ever stayed at. You hear everything going on this hotel, from doors slamming, to the bar, to people talking. Be weary of weekends as he drunk kids are loud. We are a young couple but found the whole experience to be obnoxious. Spend your hard earned money elsewhere. It was quite maddening. We do travel a lot and I have never actually written a negative post before. But just want to warn my fellow travelers. There are plenty of other viable options within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay at”
Reviews.Author: swaane
Reviews.Content: great place to stay at! good location, good price, near subway, very modern rooms. very nice bar and great cocktails! what more can you ask?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Lounge”
Reviews.Author: cflemmaviva
Reviews.Content: My wife and just got back from a 3 night stay at the Charlesmark Hotel and Lounge and had a fantastic time. The Front Desk staff were very helpful in getting us reservations for local restaurants and making recommendations for fun stuff to do around the city. The bar/lounge at night was happening and the bartenders were unbelievable (Justine and Vanessa in particular). This was our first trip to Boston and it certainly won't be our last, and we're always gonna make the Charlesmark Hotel and Lounge our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Style, Hip Lounge”
Reviews.Author: cat331
Reviews.Content: Loved the Charlesmark Hotel and Lounge. Small property in a renovated 1860's building. I travel all the time and enjoy unique properties. This hotel has very stylish high end furnishings, custom artwork and much more. Very upscale cocktail bar. Jefferson the bartender is first class. I highly recommend the Charlesmark.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but expensive for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: Travelwalker2
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is nice on the inside and a bit hidden from view but the noise on Boylston St can keep you awake at night. It is very close to access to the T and other city attractions. Our room had a nice contemporary decor and it was very clean. The front desk staff was not attentive and on one ocassion we were given incorrect directions to a nearby store. They did not great us when we entered or left the building; they were more interested in the computer than the guests! For the price ($230./night+) they should provide: glass (not plastic) wine and drinking glasses in the room; a small fridge other than the mini water fridge which made a lot of noise and 1 extra set of towels (just in case they are needed). The continental breakfast was probably the worst I have ever had. Package oatmeal, donuts, bagels, apples and oranges, coffee and Lipton tea. Not even a thank you when we left with our $800.00 bill. Suggest they work on their customer relations or lower the room rates to reflect what they should charge for the poor service and food.

Reviews.Title: “Charlesmark-Perfect for 20-30 something couples”
Reviews.Author: hellothere_7
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came to Boston from Kansas City for a long weekend and stayed at the Charlesmark in September and it was perfect for us! We stayed on the 4th floor and didn;t have any problems with noise at night. The hotel was immaculate and trendy, with a cool bar. The showers as everyone has said are fantastic! Awesome location--one block from Newbury St and directly across the street from the Copley Square "T" stop, which is super simple to get around on. Get a pass for $15 for 7 days at the airport and use it unlimited for the duration of your stay, including to and from the airport. I would highly reccommend this hotel, to anyone who is looking for a cool hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient, if a bit basic”
Reviews.Author: naasboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Charlesmark for one night. Location just off copley square is great, close to the subway station. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Room was in the basement with no view, but as it was a brief stay that was not a problem. Airconditioning noise was a bit loud though. Room was fairly basic but clean and well equipped. Coffee and muffins for breakfast and free internet access in the lobby was a nice touch. Great value for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, Small room”
Reviews.Author: scrumbleton36
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews for this hotel it seems only guests from the UK dislike the Charlesmark. May I suggest that we have higher standards than Americans as this hotel is truly dreadfull.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pedro_snr
Reviews.Content: We booked into The Charlesmark for the first three days of our New England tour because of the positive reviews on TripAdvisor and were not disappointed. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, the room small but perfectly clean and functional and breakfast was perfectly adequate. Centrally located in Back Bay, The Charlesmark was within walking distance of the shops, tourist sites and river walks with the result that we walked everywhere and only used a tour bus which we picked up within a few hundred yards of the hotel. Will certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zelda_T
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice little hotel in a great location: there's a subway and Amtrack station 5 minutes walk away. The rooms all have cable TV and there's free internet access in the lobby. They also do a nice free breakfast snack of coffee/ tea and muffins and bagels. The staff were welcoming and helpful with suggestions of where to eat and what to do. Boston itself is a really easy city to walk around and I would highy recommend it for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Hip Hotel with unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kevnord
Reviews.Content: The Charlesmark is within a few blocks of Copley Place, Boston Commons, and Newbury Street. The room I had was great, oozing with style. My room looked out on the very busy Boylston street but was extremely quiet. The only negative thing I have to say about the hotel is in regards to the staff. Every time I interacted with them, I was made to feel as though I was bothering them. The only interactions I had were checking in and out. Lame. If you checking before your room is available, they will hold your luggage for you. However, they do not have a room for luggage and instead store it in the bar, under a counter. They run a wire through the handle and lock it up, but it's still out in the open. There are two computers attached to the internet downstairs, very handy. All-in-all, I would stay at this hotel again. The room/location were nice enough to make me overlook the rude staff members I encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Good”
Reviews.Author: AW-PW
Reviews.Content: We are from Cheshire, UK. We stayed at the Charlesmark for only one night as we were picking up a car the next day to travel to Cape Cod. We found the hotel to be very clean and the staff on reception were more than helpful in recommending local restaurants and giving directions. We would definately stay at this hotel again as we were very comfortable and the location is perfect for exploring the local bars, restaurants and shops. Boston is a lovely place and if we have anything critical to say about this hotel the only thing we can think of is that the free breakfast wasn't up to much - serve yourself buns and coffee. But nearby there were plenty of places to eat, so book to stay here, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Place”
Reviews.Author: obxwahoo
Reviews.Content: We flew up to Boston to spend time in the city and visit old friends, and booked one night here and the next night with our friends. Many high points: great location, very unique decor, not your everyday chain hotel. Sure the rooms are small, but it didn't really bother us. Nice touches: Surround sound system in the room that also plays in the bathroom, Direct TV and music (which was set to classical as we entered our room), light (but tasty) breakfast, friendly service. The bathroom was terrific - made of stone and slate and great water pressure - I want one at home. The bar is "happening" at night, so book a room on floor two or above if noise bothers you. The few lows: the TV remote is a bear to operate (it changes channels, but does not successfully control the sound on the receiver), no closet in the room (cabinets instead), the Internet was down in the lobby while we were there. Otherwise, a great stay at a very reasonble cost. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Good location, happy with stay”
Reviews.Author: AcademicTraveler37
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Charlesmark for one night, as I was doing some research at Harvard. The price was the best available (I paid $169.00 on Orbitz) and the location, as others have said, can't be beat--right on Boylston Street, across from Library and one-two blocks from Copley Place and other shopping. 1/2 block from the T stop. I agree that the rooms are really small--mine was 604, and I agree with the person who stayed in 504 that this is probably the smallest room on each floor, so consider that when you check in. I also agree that there was some sort of background noise that I couldn't get rid of--probably the A/C outside. Finally, I could see the bar was very trendy and popular for the elite Boston set, and that may appeal to some people, but for me it just clogged the lobby (which is TINY) and made me feel like the conspicuously alone, unhip traveler that I am. BUT the room was new, spotless, very comfortable, and had free bottled water, scads of TV channels, free local phone calls, and a stereo w/CD changer, if you like to listen to music. There was also a guide to Boston in the room--not a magazine, but an actual guidebook--for us during one's stay. I've not seen that at other hotels. I found the staff very friendly and appreciated the free internet in the lobby (though it was in high demand, and one of the two computers was broken). overall I highly recommend the hotel for single travelers, esp on short stays, who like to be centrally located and who don't need a lot of space (and who like trendy digs).

Reviews.Title: “Could be a great hotel, but it's not.”
Reviews.Author: 21H21J
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of the Charlesmark based on the tripadvisor reviews, and that the hotel had promised "a great room" when I told them we were in Boston to celebrate a birthday. What we got was very different. On checking in, the member of staff seemed annoyed that we had disturbed his TV viewing in the bar. The only words he uttered were: "Name", "credit card" and "504". If the room was "a great room" as promised, I'd hate to stay in the others. Based on floor map on the back of the door, it looked like we had the smallest room possible. The view was of the air conditioning units, along with the noise. Perhaps this is why they have stereo systems - to drown out the noise! The "complimentary continental breakfast" is $2 worth of Dunkin Donuts. The location is good, but Boston is so compact you'd be hard pressed to get a bad location. The room rates may be less than at other hotels, but you get what you pay for, and at the Charlemark that is not very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant stay”
Reviews.Author: simcott
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel on the Internet and definaltiy sounded what we were after. We weren't dissappointed. The hotel was more than what we expected for the price and the location ws fantastic. The hotel rooms were very cosey and boutique. The breakfast was well worth waiting for after a long journey and the bagels were very tasty. The unlimited coffee definately made a great start to the day for exploring boston.. I can't say what the best part of the stay in boston was but please try the legal seafood lump crap cakes!!!!!! The Legal Seafood can be found at either the Predential Center or the Harbour. The BeenTown Trolley Tour including the Harbour Tour were worth it for seeing the sights of boston. Don't forgot to go to the common to see the DUCKS! If you plan on visiting Boston then stay at the 'Charlesmark' its well worth the staty.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel - good city location”
Reviews.Author: RachelTLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Charlesmark Hotel for one night in July 07. The hotel is in a great location and can be described as a trendy boutique place. We got a good deal on Expedia and didn't expect a lot of the hotel and everything was as expected when we checked in. Rooms - the rooms are very small. I don't think I've ever stayed anywhere with such a small room or bed before. I'd describe the bed we had as a big single. Couples going to this hotel would be advised to ask for two single beds - what the Charlesmark calls a double wouldn't fit the "average sized" american couple!!

Reviews.Title: “Back Bay Star”
Reviews.Author: falsesmall
Reviews.Content: The Charlesmark defines what a boutique hotel should be. The hotel is small but quaint. The rooms are average to small yet perfectly comfortable. Euro styled bathroom, no tub, but the nicest shower I was ever in. The rooms are tastefully decorated, modest and clean. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Direct TV and terrific sound system throughout the room. Efficient climate control. First class martini bar in lobby attracting some of the local beautiful people. As pointed out in other reviews, location is top notch. Yards from the Copley Square "T" stop granting easy access to all of Boston. No parking on premises but you can park your car about 5 minute walk away for a hotel validated $20.00, reasonable for Boston.You simply will not find a better hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DNaada
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Charlesmark. Positives: Excellent location in the Back Bay area of Boston, one block off of Newbury St and good shopping. Service was good, with a modest but adequate continental breakfast (bagels, muffins, apples and bananas,) ,included in the rate. The bathroom ws small but nicely tiled. They allowed us an early check-in, with the room available by 11am. They had a good selection of TV stations (including several HBO channels), and they provided free bottled water in a mini-chiller. Negatives: The room was small, and instead of the promised 2 beds, there was one full-size bed and a fold-out twin sofa. It was difficult to control the temperature in the room, so it was always too hot or too cold. The sink area was quite small. The TV had very poor volume control, with a difficult to operate remote control. It was a CRT TV. There was no refrigerator/mini-bar in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, top location”
Reviews.Author: matthijst
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the center of Boston. Rooms are a bit small, but fully equipped. Newbury Street is right behind the hotel, and all other things worth seeing (ie. Freedom Trail) are within walking distance. We parked our car at Boston Commons for $10 a day. It's a short walk to the hotel and you can unload your luggage before parking. If you're looking for a great hotel in the center, for a reasonable price, look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Charlesmark Hotel #1”
Reviews.Author: elliehartmann
Reviews.Content: I loved the Charlesmark hotel and the staff were very helpful. The manager Kyle carried our bags to our room and then made reservations for us a an Italian restaurant named Massaminos in the Little Italy section called the North End. Food was delicious!
