Claire another ( Beautiful ) manager scored us Red Sox tickets. We loved the martini bar and sitting on the patio. The bartender Jefferson made us his signature Dancing Bear martini. Whoo hoo! Great stuff! I would recommend this hotel to people who want a small intimate type of place. Rooms were clean and modern. Location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the Charlesmark”
Reviews.Author: rjh920
Reviews.Content: Really a fine boutique hotel. Service-Very helpful, offered to make suggestions for dining and fun things to do. Location- Can't get any better in the heart of the city, close to many stores, restauraunts and the T right out the front door. Value- Paid $179 Free internet, continental breakfast, computers in the lobby, free bottled water. This was about $100 less than the other hotels in the neighborhood. Patio and Martini bar- Hip, Jefferson the bartender was awesome. Great people watching on the fashionable street. Downside- Hard to get a reservation because they are so popular!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Paisajista
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for only two nights, the rest of the stay I changed to YWCA, budgetwise. It was a great small hotel with an excellent location, only two block to the subway, one of the most pleasant commercial streets of Boston, malls. So not only it is an above average small hotel it is very convenient. I liked a lot the lounge, very nice and very easy to meet people, have a croissant, a drink or simply watch a good baseball game. Avoid the Thai restaurant next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Knowledgeable Staff, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: julia444
Reviews.Content: I was prompted to write this review after a long business trip and must say that after staying in nine hotels over six weeks I found customer service to be the making or breaking of my stays. Not having much room to work in my suite I spent a considerable amount of time in the downstairs lounge. The staff at the Charlesmark was delightful. Front desk Dustin walked me through a computer meltdown at a less than desirable time of the night and my martinis and conversations with bartender Vanessa were wonderful (she even sent me away with a book to read on my flight). Small spaces made up for with superb staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb boutique hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Michele13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a find in Boston, where it's hard to get a quality hotel under $200/night. I had an upgraded room (at $189/night) which had a large window overlooking Bolyston Street and the Boston Public Library. Though my room was on the second floor, overlooking the busy street and over the bar, it was extremely quiet. The room was very nice and just how others have described -- with a great sound system, gigantic floor-to-ceiling mirror that made the room look bigger, and a TV with tons of channels. My room didn't have a traditional desk and chair, so don't count on having a lot of formal work space. The bar has great outdoor seating, and was usually crowded during my stay. Breakfast was continental, with bagels, doughnuts, fruit, and oatmeal, too, I believe. Although not overly friendly, I found the front desk staff extremely helpful. They helped me navigate my way via T to the new convention center, and one stood outside during a rainstorm to hail me a cab. The 2 computers in the breakfast area were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Rude or indifferent, you decide”
Reviews.Author: Voyageurchic
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fantastic time in New England. I had returned to walk the state of my birth. Our only disappointment during our entire stay was with the Charlesmark Hotel. We generally choose boutique hotels when we celebrate...it was my birthday on the day we arrived. My husband had emailed the hotel-with little interest on recommending ways to make it special. We arrived already in awe of the city to be greeted with a lowered head at reception that did not raise and a monotoned...'Name'. My cheerfulness plummeted, but not detered. Perhaps this is 'uber chic indifference'...but it carried on throughout our stay. To my mind, it became rudeness. We dropped our bags and went down for a drink, 15 minutes early... the bartender was chatting with the receptionist-'not open' again, not interested. As a former actor in New York and therefore bartender. I was disappointed in their disinterest in their customers. I certainly would have offered an alternative to a couple that had just arrived from 14 hours of travel... A true reflection of our entire three nights...they were more interested in gossip than service...which was reflected in the conversation of fellow guests on our final morning. The room was small but accurately represented on their website. The bathroom was great with a terrific shower. In fact, once you made it past the cool indifferent corridors of reception, you could not fault the stay. The donuts and bagels in the morning were fresh and the coffee a perfect start for the day. I wouldn't go there again, which is too bad, as we will be in Boston several times a year...it would have been nice to find a place to come back 'where everybody knows your name'...but I am certain they had no idea or interest in who we were.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Charlesmark”
Reviews.Author: Cville_Sojourner
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Boston. Our stay at the Charlesmark was excellent. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. We stayed on the 6th floor in a "queen room". Walked in, and light jazz was playing on the full Audio-Visual system (even had speakers in the bathroom). Room was good sized, done in a "modern" motif: built-in bookcase, "european" lights. Bath a little small, no tub, but a large shower. Bed was fine, room might be on the dark side for some. No street noise, and quiet, even though we were right at the elevator. No view from the windows (but we don't really care about that). The downstairs lounge was very nice, and the sidewalk cafe pleasant. The location is the thing! Walk out the door and see the public library, look diagonally across and see Trinity Church. A couple of steps and you are on the T. . . Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: agorisk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed in the Charlesmark hotel for 4,days, 3 nights. The location was great and the hotel was a great value for the location. We arrived in Boston very early on Saturday morning. The receptionist went to our room, verified it was ready and we were able to check in. She also encouraged us to have some of the breakfast. We appreciated the hospitality. You are within walking distance to the Boston Public Library, Fenway, Newbury Street, Boston Common and the Prudential Center just to name a few. I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Great!”
Reviews.Author: Paka68
Reviews.Content: If you can handle a small room this is a wonderful place to stay. We really enjoyed the three nights we spent here and the location is excellent. We had a rental car but just left it parked at the garage because the hotel is so close to everything. The parking fee was reasonable for the area, $20 for 24 hours but keep in mind that applies from noon to noon and be sure to get the written directions on how to get to the garage (less than 10 minute walk) because the hotel is not very good at explaining it. The room was very nice as was the bathroom with it's Italian granite. The closet was a joke, totally unusable because it was so small. If you need to hang things, especially full length items do not stay here. The furniture was very nice, comfortable bed and a great sound system with speakers throughout the room and bathroom. It was very clean. The room wasn't too bad in size, it was just the bathroom and closet that were way too small. Front desk service was quite good (except for garage directions) and they were very considerate. The continental breakfast fell short, not much of a selection, pretty minimal. Overall we would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again... just remember - small is the operative word.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl424
Reviews.Content: My company was exhibiting at a tradeshow at the Hynes Convention center so I wanted to book something in Copley Square so we could walk to the show. We had about eight rooms and everyone enjoyed their stay. Yes, the rooms are small, but they were really well decorated. The bar was great too! I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Uneven Service”
Reviews.Author: RailWarrior
Reviews.Content: Location: The Charlesmark is in a great location for sightseeing. It's steps from the nearest T stop, a short walk to Boston Common and Public Garden, a block off fashionable Newbury Street, and surrounded by great restaurants and bars. We found Boston to be a very walkable city, and the Charlesmark was a great home base from which to explore. Reservations: Found it a little annoying that you couldn't check rates or availability online, but I received a very prompt reply to my e-mail inquiry. Called to get some more information and book the room and almost decided to stay somewhere else after talking to a guy who was very abrupt, bordering on rude. I don't think I was asking stupid questions -- maybe he was just having a bad day. I requested a queen room facing Boylston instead of the "residential view" of the alley, but was told there was only one queen room left and it had "no view." Well, points for honesty. Made the reservation for $189/night (no AAA discounts available, though it claims so in the AAA guide) and called back a week or so before arrival to see if any other rooms had opened up. Spoke to a very polite, friendly woman on the phone who said nothing else had. After reading comments here, I was concerned that our 2nd floor room (203) might be noisy if it was located over the bar, but was assured that shouldn't be an issue. Perhaps that was more of an issue when there was a lounge area upstairs. Arrival: Pulled up in front to unload. There was no one to help with bags, but we didn't need it. I was checked in by what sounded like the same delightful guy I talked to on the phone the first time, and he wasn't in a much better mood. It seemed like I was pulling him away from some important Internet research. But he got us our keys without too much trouble and gave me directions to Hertz to drop off my rental car, so that was nice. Room: Our queen room was small, as advertised, but well-designed and not at all claustrophobic-feeling like some hotel rooms in Europe. As promised, there was no view, except of two large air conditioning units, and the room was quiet... and dark. That may bother some, but a dark, quiet, cozy room was just what we wanted after several long days, and nights, out in the city. We weren't there much during the day, except for a nap. At first the sound of the air conditioning units was kind of annoying, but it soon became rather soothing, like white noise. If you want a bright, airy room with more of a view, request the rooms next to ours (201/202?) that have HUGE picture windows looking out onto Boylston. I think that used to be a lounge area. Noise might be more of an issue there, though. I liked the fact that the decor was not the cookie-cutter stuff you find in most chain hotels. Some aspects of the room were a little worn (bedspread, carpet, etc), but overall the room was in good shape and everything worked as intended. I also appreciated the little extras like bottled water in the mini-fridge (which was replenished daily,) the Boston guidebook in the room, the satellite radio and TV complete with a speaker in the bathroom, and the great rainfall shower tiled in really nice stone that felt great on the feet. The small couch was nice and the desk functional enough if you needed it. Nice large, full-length mirror. No full closet in our room, though it seemed like some or the other queen rooms might have had one. Housekeeping was good. The rest of the place: I appreciated not being nickeled and dimed for things like breakfast (a perfectly adequate spread of bagels, dunkin donuts, fruit, coffee juice and tea), local phone calls (I can't beleive some chains charge for this!), high-speed internet access with printer, bottled water, etc. All were included with the room. The bar downstairs served good drinks and seemed very popular at happy hour. It was a great place to begin or end the night. They store your bags for free at check out, though they're just lined up in the bar area (which is closed), but didn't seem all that secure. Service: I think this is the one area with some room for improvement. Unfortunately, most of my interaction with the Charlesmark staff was with the same guy I spoke to the first time I called. He definitely didn't exude the "genuine, warm and intimate" service promised on the Charlesmark Web site. I'm hoping he was just a bad seed. The housekeeping staff seemed very friendly. Overall, the service just seemed a little cold -- it didn't ruin our stay by any means, but a smile would have been nice once in a while. I'm afraid the snide, dismissive management responses that are posted here will only serve to bolster that perception. Even if a guest has a stupid complaint, customer service rules usually dictate that you try to be gracious in your response, not belittling. Overall, a great value to stay at a unique hotel in a perfect location. I'd definitely reccomend it as long as you have realistic expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Really, really overrated”
Reviews.Author: ingrdo
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on tripadvisor, in magazines, Boston's Best of...about the Charlesmark, I decided to book it. I think this place and its staff have let the reviews go to their collective head. For paying $198 per night, I expected a lot more in terms of customer service. When I walked in, there were three people behind the 2.5 foot long front desk. Two continued their personal conversation and the third person looked at me with no interest whatsoever. There was no "How may I help you?". No "good afternoon". No nada. When I asked for help with our bags, one young man followed me out to the car and watched as I unloaded the bags. It took over one-half hour for our bags to make it to our room. Although there was an apology offered for it taking so long, it was given while the offeror was on his cellphone in the midst of a personal conversation. This was not a good sign. None of the three staff we had regular contact with would engage in a conversation without being prompted, no "good morning", etc. The carpets did not appear to have been vaccumed either in the halls or our room in several days. Again, not for essentially $200 a night. There are some positives: The interior design is great, there is one bartender named Jefferson who I'd recommend to anyone, the location is perfect (however, any downtown hotel is strategically located for business/tourist travel), the disorganization and general inattention to detail got us a couple glasses of Pinot Noir and appetizers for free. That wasn't the intention, however. When I checked out, I was told that everything was taken care of. I reminded the person at the desk that we had two nights of a bar tab charged to our room. She looked at me, said, "Well, that's a separate system and he (not sure who) isn't here right now." Twenty minutes later one of the staff said, "Your charge is $10 but I'm having a hard time printing it." In the next ten minutes, he walked by me four times and did not address me. While we were double parked and loading our car ourselves, I ran back in and asked that the bill be mailed to me. BTW, our bill should have been about $50 so I'm apparently as confused as they are. We'll be back in Boston in September and will not be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It--Great location in Copley”
Reviews.Author: GCutter
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Charlesmark was a pleasant one. The location canot be beat. We were greeted immediately by a gracious atendant who held our bags for us and then brought them up to the room for us while we gallvanted all over Boston. Expect to get a smaller room but its quaint for couples and cute decor. If you are looking for a luxurious stay, this is not your hotel. It;s comfortable and for the price in this location, it was well worth it. The bathrooms and rooms are clan though we did have a leaky faucet and a cracked sink in room 503 but nothing that could not be handled. The bar downstairs gets pretty lively during the day so request to tay on a high floor if the noise gets to you. They do make excellent martinis however. While you are in town...go to the top of the Hub at the Pru..it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, phone booth size accomodations”
Reviews.Author: fenwaybill
Reviews.Content: Moved here from hotel on North St. Great location, near shops and food and fun. Anyone over 6 foot tall will find a great deal of difficulty in the elfin beds. Rooms were clean but very, very small. I just had the feeling that 4 or 5 wealthy local students with deep pockets decided to do this place as a thesis project.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if you cannot beat the price”
Reviews.Author: cmalloy
Reviews.Content: I like Boston/Cambridge and have visited the city a lot. The Charlesmark is in a great location. However, I have paid much less or the same for much nicer accomodations also located in great locations. The Charlesmark is NOT worth what I paid: $200.00 approximately for each night. This price includes tax. 1) The rooms are very very small. They are clean but it is difficult to move around in them. Again, if the price had been less, I would have adjusted. The showers are tastefully tiled and the bathroom, overall, is quite nice. Warning: If you require a tub and are not handicapped, you will be sent to the rooms on the floor where the hotel restaurant's bathroom, laundry, and vending machines are located. Not visually appealing! 2) The hallways are narrow and the carpet (outside the rooms) is stained and worn. The elevator has seen better days; I usually took the stairs. Overall, the hotel's appearance is slightly shabby. I do not refer to the rooms but to the lobby and hallways. 3) The staff is a mixed lot. There are those who are helpful and those who are not. You will know them when you meet them. Bottom line: I stayed at the Inn at Harvard (lovely) after I left the Charlesmark. The difference in rooms, lobby, and atmosphere is stunning. Ironically, both places charged almost the same price. If you can get this place for a bargain rate, go for it. Otherwise, I wouldn't waste my time. There are so many better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Butty1
Reviews.Content: The accomodation was clean and neat. The lack of closet space was irritating as it was only a really small cupboard as in half the height and width of a normal closet which was to store the clothes of 2 people! There was more space given to the TV. I knew that the room would be small but that was a little ridiculous. The staff didn't seem to have much of the usual knowledge you would expect for tourists, not even for the local area. We had a problem in that the fan in our bathroom was really noisy and when we complained we were told that maintainace would take care of it. After another night of fitful sleep we complained again and it turned out that nothing could be done about the fan. Only for the fact that my partner who suffered more sleep loss than me got a little annoyed by the desk clerk attitude and asked to see the manager was something done. The manager incidentially would not meet us and told the desk clerk to move us to another room which was slightly better. Breakfast was basic but good for getting you going in the morning. Nice bar also to enjoy a nightcap. The location was great as you are close to everything including transport, shopping, restaurants, bars, tour pick up's, Boston Common etc. Not a totally bad place to stay but a bit more customer service would help.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NatV
Reviews.Content: We booked the Charlesmark for a two night stay at the end of a 10 day trip to the States having read the excellent reviews on here. Unfortunately we were really disappointed and I have to say that of the six hotels that we used during our trip the Charlesmark was by far the worst. On arriving at the hotel at 2.30pm, we were told that our room was not ready and to return after 3pm. Not a problem as the given check in time is 3pm - but when we returned at 3.15pm the room was still not ready. It was finally ready at about 4.15pm. We asked for a room at the rear of the hotel as were told that these are quieter and I need my sleep as I'm in the third trimester of pregnancy, but although we had a room at the back we were kept awake most of the night by a noisy air con unit. When we mentioned this we were told that nothing could be done as the unit belonged to the next-door building - how about warning us or fitting some kind of sound-proofing on the windows? The washbasin in our bathroom was cracked, the toilet did not flush properly and overall the room was extremely cramped. Yes, it's really well located but maybe the Charlesmark has become a bit complacent. I would not stay here again and would not recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freischutz
Reviews.Content: The Charlesmark Hotel could not be better situated. In the heart of Boston's Back Bay directly above the Copley Square subway station, it's in easy walking distance of the whole of the centre of the City. The hotel has recently undergone a major refurbishment and, although the rooms are small (even by European standards), they are very well appointed. The bathrooms are particularly noteworthy: the slate finish is not only very practical but also very attractive. The room in which we stayed had a double bed and a sofabed. We used both. The sofabed - never the most rest-inducing pieces of furniture - was of decent quality and totally satisfactory for the three night duration of our stay. The inclusive continental breakfast was a plus, as was the free internet access from terminals in the breakfast/upper bar area. If arriving in the city by air, ignore the blandishments of the Transit Authority to catch the silver line bus from Logan Airport into the centre. Instead, take the airport shuttle #33 from the terminal to the blue line subway station, changing to the green line at Government Centre station. The journey from the airport terminal to the hotel front desk by this route will take you no more than 30 minutes. If arriving in the city by Amtrak from the South, the hotel is barely 5 minutes' walk from the Back Bay train station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ZipZoo
Reviews.Content: For a 3-day conference at Hynes Convention center, I turned to TripAdvisor to find a hotel nearby that would fit the budget of my employer. I contacted the Charlesmark directly and made a reservation, which was confirmed promptly by e-mail and gave directions to the municipal parking lot where they've arranged a $20 discounted rate, much better than the Prudential Center's $36 a night. On arrival in Boston I parked my car, then stopped in at the Charlesmark on the way to the Hynes and left my bag. When I returned that night, my bag had already been nicely placed in my room. While the room was not large, it was quiet, the contemporary decor was attractive and the space well utilized. Bottles of water were left in the room each day at no charge, there was a stereo, video player, cable TV, and a huge full length mirror. Two computer stations with internet are available in the downstairs lounge. In the morning, there are newspapers, juice, coffee, fruit, bagels and so on, all included in the room rate. Coffee and pretzel-type snacks are available throughout the day. The staff was quite helpful and I was very pleased with the hotel. Those traveling for pleasure might want to ask about room views--my room had a very limited rear view, which was fine for me, but might not work for everyone. This is a nice area for visitors, with plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby on Boylston Street and in the Prudential Center Mall. It's an easy walk to Newbury Street and to the Boston Common, there's a Shaw's Supermarket nearby , and a Green Line subway stop on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Charlesmark”
Reviews.Author: kerryfromsheffield
Reviews.Content: Felt compelled to write a review after a wonderful stay at the Charlesmark. Staff were very friendly and helpful both on arrival and throughout my stay. Room was small but perfectly formed. Shower was among the best I've ever used and loved the sound system with speakers in both the bedroom and bathroom. Centrally located a few steps from Copley Square, Copley Mall, 2 mins from Newbury Street and the Copley subway station. Can't recommend it enough - will definitely stay there next time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ab2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in beginning of April. The hotel is small and quiet, room was a bit small for 2 people and with some not very nice roof view, but very well designed and very clean including the bathroom so the size/view was not an issue. The stereo system in the room is a nice feature as well as satellite TV. The breakfast consists of oatmeal, bagels and muphins, butter and cream cheese, fruits, tea and coffee. Though some reviews complained it was basic, we really enjoyed it . The hotel has a nice lounge, and also 2 PC with free internet in the lobby which is handy. Hotel location is great - opposite Boston public library and metro, next to Copley square and 10 min. walk from the public garden/ Boston Common Park. We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for those willing to walk anywhere in Boston”
Reviews.Author: stevenewman1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Charlesmark for 6 days. This hotel is ideally situated in the middle of Boston and within walking distance of everywhere (if you are the walking type). Good points - room was compact, bed was excellent, shower excellent, rate very very good, room always cleaned to a great standard Poor points - staff NEVER said hello but when spoken to were not rude, breakfast a complete disaster (turn right out of hotel and head for Pourhouse, best breakfasts in Boston), Charlesmark have 100 out of date videos available to watch in room, TV had 300 channels of which 90% were rubbish (not hotels fault), no tea or coffee facilities in room If you plan to be exploring Boston (we saw Kaiserchiefs at the Avalon, Baseball at Fenway, Basketball at the fantastic indoor arene called TNB?, went on Duck tour, walked Freedom trail, went to the navy yard, shopped, used the Amtrak for a day trip to New York, ate in lots of restaurents etc) then this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Paul Waites
Reviews.Content: We just spent Easter in Boston. You can walk everywhere just about.That being the case this hotel is in an ideal location. At the heart of Boston at the finish line for the Marathon. Room was on the small side but very comfortable. There is a fine bar with a great bartender. The only drawback was the included breakfast which was dreary. Paid $149 +tax not bad at all for the location Would return

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT - great location, great room, great staff”
Reviews.Author: frida11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Charlesmark for one night before my husband presented at a conference in Copley Plaza. The rate was perfect - I think we paid less than $150 for a queen room, and the room was great. Some people have complained about the size of the rooms, but I didn't find this to be a problem during our one night there. The room was quiet, clean, and stylish. It overlooked the Boston marathon finish line and the historic Boston Library. The location is amazing. One block from boutiques and cafes on Newbury and within three blocks of Boston Common, Copley Plaza. When we checked out the next day, we were able to leave a gigantic suitcase, a huge box, and a backpack with the guy behind the desk for five hours. He was incredibly accommodating and nice. Overall, it couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT, LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: yps0702
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels that I've stayed at in Boston. Charlesmark Hotel is chic yet affordable. Size of room is comparable to that of most hotel rooms in NYC. Both room and bathroom is EXTREMELY clean and tidy. Housekeeping staff are friendly and punctual about cleaning room. Added bonus about staying at Charlesmark Hotel is the the awesome sound system in the room that majority of the hotels in the area does offer. XM radio and Direct TV made my stay even better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: calilove16
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from another fantastic weekend in Boston staying at the Charlesmark Hotel. This is about the 4th time i've chosen to stay there and each time I'm more impressed. From the minute you walk in you're greeted by an inviting trendy bar area playing contemporary chill music. Checking in has never been easier and the fact that its a cozy boutique feeling hotel you dont feel the hustle and bustle of a huge overwhelming crowded lobby. The atmosphere is so relaxed it just sets the mood for your entire stay. You enter your room and there is music playing, chilled water, magazines, and a cozy bed waiting for you. The rooms are enjoyable (I suggest staying downstairs, you'll get the best night's sleep ever!) The water pressure in the shower is unlike any hotel i've ever been in. The operations manager Kyle is always there to help me out everytime I'm there. You are staying in the heart of Boston on Boylston St. yet you won't even want to leave the hotel because having a drink at the bar or lounge upstairs makes your night complete (the bartenders make the best cosmopolitans I've ever tasted!) I would never think of staying anywhere else when i make my monthly trips up to Boston from NY. Love the Charlesmark! ~Alex from NY

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: elisaNorway
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Charlesmark for almost one week in March 2007. I had read the reviews about the small rooms, but got a good rate so I decided to stay there anyway. I'm glad I did. The location is perfect, practically walking distance to anywhere in the city. The standard of the room was also good, and the room was definately big enough for 1 person. The bathroom and shower was nice. Some negative things to mention though: 1)There was not a proper full size hanging closet. Since I was travelling on business I brought several suits and dresses, and I had to hang these on a hook in the bathroom in lack of other alternatives. 2) very dim light in the room. (I like getting dressed in a room where I can actually see the color of the clothes I'm wearing) Since there was nothing but a brick wall outside the window, no real daylight came into the room and the lamps were not very strong. On the positive side though, I loved the huge dressing mirror! 3) Breakfast was very very basic. (But it was complimentary...) Summed up: the hotel is definately worth checking out, just be aware of the few things I mentioned above... (I could very well just be more picky than the average guest :-)

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good”
Reviews.Author: tritravel
Reviews.Content: We came away with a good experience at this hotel although it did not start well. We arrived at 5:30 pm for our 1 night stay and were sent to our queen-bed room -- only to find that it had not yet been cleaned from the previous guests. Towels on the floor, window wide open, generally a mess. We went back down to get a different room, and the guy at the front desk was not very helpful, friendly, or apologetic (his first offer was for us to wait while he ran and cleaned the room for us, even though we had told him we needed to shower and get on our way for an appointment). Finally we got a different, smaller room with a better view, and we were told we could discuss a discount the next morning with a manager. The room we booked should have cost $139, and they put us in a $119 room. We were told the lowest they could go on discount was $99. The next morning the manager offered a discount down to $99, and when we checked out, there was an envelope with $40 in cash waiting for us, since we had prepaid for the room through hotels.com. This was great for our good will! The hotel itself was very nice, and the lounge and bar were fun. Everything was clean and the stereo system and speakers in the room and bathroom were great. We will definitely go back and stay again -- the location and price can't be beat. It's a funky hotel with nice atmosphere. We will bring our own pillows next time, though -- the ones they provided were pretty limp.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend the Charlesmark”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerNYC
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful little hotel -- and what a deal for $119, per night, including breakfast, Internet stations, and the morning paper. And just a short walk from Boston's Back Bay Station. The rooms are undeniably compact, but well designed -- with high-quality finishes and attention to detail -- and impeccably clean. Having read some TravelAdvisor complaints about noise, I requested quiet accommodations on a high floor, which I found perfectly serene. Room # 607, on the top floor (the 6th), was a sunny corner space with charming rooftop views through two double (essentially four) windows. Though there was a central heating+A/C system, the windows could also be opened (which I consider a welcome option in this era of hermetically sealed hotels). Queen-sized beds are available here, but since I was traveling solo, I went for the slightly better-priced Full-sized one. My room had a comfortable mattress and nice materials throughout -- blond-wood cabinetry and a bathroom with real slate and glass tiles, and a spacious, glass-doored shower. There was also a TV wth an impressive range of cable stations, including premium movie channels, plus a stereo + DVD player with a list of free movies you could borrow from the front desk. Though these accommodations didn't offer a full-height closet, the place was designed with care and the precision of ship's quarters with drawers under the bed and good wall hooks for clothing, etc. All vey well thought out. Hardly a palatial room, it felt homey, with plenty of space to move around (not one of those places where you barely have a few inches around the bed!). The breakfast was a do-it-yourself affair with fresh fruit (apples, oranges, bananas), bagels of all sorts, fresh muffins, good coffee, tea, orange juice, instant oatmeal -- that sort of thing. My only complaint: As the weather had just changed abruptly from unseasonably warm to outright arctic, my room was a bit chilly for the first part of the night. I suspect it simply took a while for the heating system to fully kick in. (And a corner room tends to be colder, even though the windows were double-glazed.) When I called downstairs, the receptionist was very helpful and came right upstairs with an extra comforter. And yes, the heat eventually did the trick. I was more than satisfied and would absolutely stay at the Charlesmark again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: CBJBSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Came to Boston to attend a conference at the Hynes Convention Center...Although not directly connected to the center like the Sharaton or Marriot, the CharlesMark was only a few minutes walk away with a Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks (whichever you prefer) along the way. The rooms were exactly the right size for a single traveler or couple without children, and the showers were heaven...lots of water pressure and beautiful stonework. The ambient music in the rooms was also a plus. I loved to relax in the the lounge in the evenings and check my e-mail or search the web. There are plenty of excellent restaurants within a block or 2 of the hotel, especially if you enjoy steaks, seafood, or asian/sushi. There is also a LOT of great shopping within walking distance, if you are so inclined. We did not utilize the T system on this trip, but the Copley station is within a block. The front desk staff were very helpful as was one of the owners, who interacted with the customers on a regular basis. I would highly recommend this Hotel for any visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Hip Hotel...Great location and Price”
Reviews.Author: sunnyday12
Reviews.Content: The Charlesmark is an excellent hotel at an amazing location. The rooms are on the smaller side, but the space is efficiently used. The room comes with excellent amentities such as Direct TV, state of the art surround sound, bottled water at no charge and a beautiful bathroom with a nice slate/stone shower. The beds are very comfortable and a complimentary Continental Breakfast is available in the lounge in the morning. The lounge also features free high speed internet on two hotel owned computers. The Charlesmark lounge is a hip night spot and is a very comfortable place to have a cocktail. The hotel's location on Back Bay's Boylston Street is excellent. The T's Green Line is right across the street and you are within walking distance to the Boston Common, Newbury Street , Prudential Center and the Copley Mall. The Charlesmark is a great hotel to take in what Boston has to offer for an amazing price. This was our 2nd stay at this establisment and we will continue to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Stuut
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Charlesmark for 1 night on a very cold January day. Ideally I would have given the Charlesmark a 3.5 (I never give a 5 unless something is absolutely perfect!). Reasons why it wasnâ€™t 4 for me: â€¢There was a constant hum from the generators on next doors roof. Although not terribly annoying, it was there (and in fairness, the hotel can do nothing about this). â€¢The heating system is hot air and was quite noisy, even on low. The hotel could do something about this. â€¢I donâ€™t like a hot bedroom so turned off the heating at night but woke later feeling very cold (well, it was -5C outside). I went in search of extra bedding but there was none, so I ended up turning on the heating. I was only staying one night and Iâ€™m sure the hotel would have offered me additional bedding had I asked for it. However, I didnâ€™t really feel like making a fuss at 2am. â€¢There is very little storage area. If two people were staying for a week, they would need to live out of their suitcase. Now for the good things, which would make me come back to the hotel and recommend it to others, bearing the above in mind: â€¢Good value for money. â€¢Very centrally located. â€¢Previous reviews talk of traffic noise â€“ my room was at the back and it wasnâ€™t a problem. â€¢Although the room wasnâ€™t huge (I had a Queen room) it was of ample sufficiency. The bed was very comfortable, the room clean with modern furnishings and good quality entertainment system, and, for a business traveller, the all important free WiFi. â€¢The bathroom was small but perfectly formed with an excellent hot shower, good accessories and well laid out, considering the size. â€¢Breakfast is a very â€œcontinentalâ€� affair with tea, coffee and different pastries available. Not a huge amount of choice put perfectly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, great location-it's the finish line of marathon .”
Reviews.Author: terry1967
Reviews.Content: Very clean easy to find - opposite Boston Library. Great staff,bars, dining, walks (very safe) all nearby. Boston must be one of the prettiest cities. i min from Prudential centre (shopping mall etc) Great value - free internet- they will print maps get info car hire etc- all free. So easy to find by car, train, taxi. There's a silver service train to airport for $2 from station you can walk to or by train acrooss the road or $5 taxi. We hired a car and went to Cape Cod. all of it is great but Hyannis is main beach/shop. DO get the ferry to Martha's - great place with bike hire or a really good bus service.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Nekero
Reviews.Content: My experience at this small boutique hotel in the heart of Boston was outstanding. The rooms and common areas are very fashionable. Breakfast items are included in the room cost which is a bargain compared to similar Boston hotels. The staff was very helpful and provided a printout of nearby restaurants. Located near the subway and within short walking distance of many tourist sites. It's hard to imagine a better choice--one of my most memorable stays in the last few years.

Reviews.Title: “Charlesmark was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: gothgimpbadcooking
Reviews.Content: We had such a terrible vacation in Boston, picking all the wrong things to see on their most crowded days. The one bright spot of our trip was the Charlesmark. It must cost half the price of the hotels just across Copley but we wouldn't know based on the quality of our stay. Our (little) room was SO comfortable and just big enough for two. We had one of the rooms with the double beds and were impressed with how economically space was used. We had a fantastic view of a brick wall -- literally -- but felt very secluded from the hustle and bustle of the streets below because we were all the way at the back of the hotel (room 205, FYI). Lobby staff was standoffish but, hey, it's Boston. Everyone seemed freakin' miserable. And anyway, I called downstairs several times to get phone numbers and information and received it promptly and politely. The shower was INCREDIBLE -- we're talking about it still two weeks later -- and the little perks like strategically placed speakers, satellite TV and radio and a bar right downstairs couldn't be beat. Plus, there were computers for us to use and print our boarding passes when we were ready to get the heck out of town already.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, memorable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mooch_1013
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just got back from two nights at the Charlesmark. I was looking to stay somewhere centrally located, relatively inexpensive, and above all, memorable. The Charlesmark delivered in all of these areas. First, as others have noted, the location can't be beat. From the Charlesmark, if you walk at a decent pace, it's 30 seconds to a T stop, 45 seconds to the Boston Public Library, 3 minutes to the Trinity Church, Copley Plaza, or Newbury Street, and 5 minutes or so to the Boston Public Garden. BTW, the Parish Cafe (361 Boylston St.) had maybe the best sandwiches I've ever had in my life. Second, it's relatively cheap. $129 for the regular room, and $30 more for a slightly larger room. We stayed in a regular room on the top (6th) floor, but took a peek into one of the larger rooms while it was being cleaned. If you're extremely claustrophobic, maybe you'll want to get the larger room, but otherwise, you should probably save your money. Third, it was memorable. When we first opened the door to the room, my impression was "My god, this room is small". But as we unpacked, and I started discovering the nice little touches around the room that make the absolute optimally-efficient use of the limited amount of space, I became more and more impressed. For example, most hotels I've stayed at have had a big dresser and a closet. Here, there were drawers that were concealed at the bottom of the foot of the platform-style bed, and sets of drawers to the sides of the headboard of the bed. There's a cabinet in the bottom of the AV-unit where you can hang clothes, and places to hang coats behind the door. The AV-unit also had a cabinet perfectly sized to hold a large carry-on bag, and a space at the top for a suitcase. Dimming lamps folded against the headboard of the platform bed. Also, there was a huge (7 ft or so tall by 4 ft wide) mirror against the wall, next to the window, creating the illusion of more space. Now, I'm a city-dweller writing from a relatively small condo in the heart of a city, so the Charlesmark hit a number of my sweet spots as far as preferences. In fact, I'm impressed with the layout and use of space to the point that I'm going to try to steal some of the elements of their design for my own place. However, I can see how someone with different tastes might feel a bit cramped in a Charlesmark room. If having a hotel room large enough to throw a football around in is your thing, then you'd probably be better off somewhere else. But if you want somewhere that's well-located, relatively cheap, and memorable, you might want to try the Charlesmark.

Reviews.Title: “Always our favorite or a getaway in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: scubagurls
Reviews.Content: Modern, very cool rooms. Immaculate, very comfortable & has everything you need. Not suitable for children. Love the decor & artwork! Beds & showers are great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: Road&GardenGranny
Reviews.Content: We love small properties, this was no exception. Staff remembered our name, made us feel at home. It was a joy.

Reviews.Title: “Location -Location-Location! Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toela
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Charlesmark, Nov 10 - Nov 14, for 4 nights. We arrived at the hotel at 10:00 am from our flight, too early to check in. We were traveling with another couple,so we asked to have rooms close together on the top floor, after reading other reviews about street noise. We left our luggage and headed out into the city. We walked the freedom trail and the entire city all day, and didn't get back to the hotel until 5:30 pm. We checked in no problem, and our luggage had already been put in our rooms, on the 6th floor. The rooms are small but nicely appointed, and spotlessly clean. Our room was very quiet, I would defiently recomend the top floors. The only concern I had was the floor was a little squeeky , it didn't bother us but I wonder if the room below could hear it? We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, always had lots on hand and kept it refilled. Free internet in the lounge area was a bonus,and useful for checking out places and making reservations. As my title says, we loved the location. Boston really is a walking city, and such a beautiful one, take advantage of that. The Blueman Group is great, Prudential Skywalk Wonderful,Body works2 art show WOW. So much to see so little time, can't wait to go back, and would gladly stay at the Charlesmank again

Reviews.Title: “Central but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Rooke
Reviews.Content: 29th - 31st October 2006 Trip adviser reader, Surrey,UK The reception was unwelcoming and the room was very noisy. Night porter denied there was a problem, but next day Manager admitted there is a compressor. We moved rooms which was a little better. Rooms were lovely and modern. Position is great and right in the centre near the shops and attractions. Breakfast was not particularly good and self help. No secure place for luggage after check out. It is a shame they have not adressed the noise with better insulation - it was impossible to sleep our first night. Ask for a room on the top floor !!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, too bad about the staff...”
Reviews.Author: TravelDealer
Reviews.Content: After taking a tour of the Charlesmark last June, we decided to have the members of our wedding party stay there. We couldn't reserve a block of rooms because of the hotel size, so, we just had everyone call. Last June we had a great guy who offered to walk us around, show us rooms, etc. He sold us. Then came October... A few nights before checking in we swung by to check on our reservation. The kid behind the desk was initially less then helpful. When I asked if it was possible for all of the girls to be on one floor and the guys to be on another, he exhaled and said that it would be a real problem and we should have notified him earlier. When we noticed that some of our wedding party members hadn't made reservations, I said that we would call them and have them confirm. The kid behind the desk mis-heard us to say that we wanted him to call and confirm our reservations and responded with, "That would be an absolute hassle for me to call everyone..." which I immediately had to correct him to say that _we_ were going to call our friends. He seemed relieved. After asking for something else and getting denied, I left wondering if it was too late to go somewhere else. (By the time we checked in, the girls all did end up on the same floor with the guys on the two floors above) We checked in on the Wed before our Sat wedding. That's when we met Ingrid. She was the absolute shining star. She came to the rescue when our inquiries of "can we have a late checkout on the day of the wedding" were answered with (by someone else) "I don't know that that's possible with a plethora of reasons why not." Ingrid said "not to worry, she'll make it happen." Anytime anyone in our wedding party needed anything at all, she was there to help. Every one in the wedding party (even those who weren't able to get in because they were full) loved her. Unfortunately so did the Head of Human Resources at Tiffany's who's hired her for bigger and better things. Anyway, aside from the remaining staff, the hotel itself is quite nice. The bar area and lounge behind the bar are great. There's also free internet which is wonderful. The regular sized room is a bit small with only a half size closet. The refrigerator is only large enough for 2 bottles of water. We had to plug ours in only to find it unplugged by house keeping later. Normally we don't need a lot of space, so, a room that size is fine. We didn't find the drawers in the room until we left (they're under the bed). The double room is a better bet if you're rooming up with friends. There is a breakfast put out - donuts, bagels, water, and coffee. Although we didn't have time to hang out at the bar, all of our friends did and really loved it. It was definitely hopping at night. Overall I would recommend staying here if you don't normally talk to the front desk anyway. That is, if you're low maintenance. We usually are, but, due to the wedding we had a few more needs then the average customer. I know without a doubt if it wasn't for Ingrid, we would have been a lot worse off. All of that being said, we probably would stay here again at the location was fantastic and the price is definitely right.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Charlesmark!”
Reviews.Author: penylan
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night at the Charlesmark in November after spending the previous week in New York. We were very pleasantly surprised by the quality and size of our room at the front of the hotel, its location and the friendliness of the reception staff. The room was immaculately clean and was very tastefully and comfortably furnished. The bathroom was outstanding. The location of the Charlesmark is perfect for exploring the high quality shopping in this part of Boston and there are a number of excellent restaurants in the area, though we struggled to find a cafe for breakfast. Our only regret was that we only stayed 1 night. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Boston”
Reviews.Author: josephmichael
Reviews.Content: One of the best Hotel/Bar experiences I have come across in the Boston area....Very clean rooms,great service and very affordable..I hightly recommend this to anyone looking to stay in the Boston area

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , Stylish Hip Lounge , Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: Melanie_Day
Reviews.Content: Rooms are modern, Stereos with surround sound speakers, DVD/CD Players and free movie library, free bottled water every day, free wireless internet , free breakfast. Such a deal! The hotel is beatifully decorated and spotlessly clean. The service provided by the staff was first class and genuine. The hotel has 40 rooms so the staff really get to know you. We went to the bar in the lounge every night and met some very cool people. It has a very hip vibe . Our bartender Jefferson was one of the most talented bartenders I have ever met. Smart, articulate and made great drinks. The location is the icing on the cake. Right in the middle of all the best retail shops and restauraunts. I highly recommend the Charlesmark.

Reviews.Title: “center of the centre”
Reviews.Author: dundeetripper
Reviews.Content: Myself my wife and my son stayed there late september and had a wonderful visit. The staff were pleasant and check in was quick. We requested a crib for my son and as they didn't have any available, so the hotel went out and bought a brand new one. The room wasn't the biggest but the location was as centre as it could be. We had a wonderful time here and again trip advisor was spot on with its advice. Considering its position in boston our room was very quiet. The only bad comment is the breakfast, they really could do with a toaster for the bagels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time at the Charlesmark”
Reviews.Author: Rainman16
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at the Charlesmark for a weekend getaway to Boston in October. From Check-in until we left our stay was phenomenal. The staff at the Charlesmark is young and hip but very courteous and professional. From the classical music playing when we checked in to our room to the free! internet in the lobby, the Charlesmark made our weekend wonderful. The rooms are on the smaller side but very stylish with everything we needed. The bathrooms are beautifully designed and the water pressure is unbelievable. The location of the hotel can't be beat. It is right in the heart of the Back Bay next to many restaurants and and the shopping you can handle. All in all it was a great stay and we're sure to stay here the next time we come to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: HeatherHC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Charlesmark on a Saturday night in October. The absolute best thing about this hotel is the location -- it's right down the street from a T stop, it's within easy walking distance of the Prudential Center (an indoor mall) and local restaurants, and the area (Back Bay) can't be beat for shopping, restaurants, nightlife, etc. We also loved the design -- everything was sleek and beautiful. Check-in was a breeze. Even though our room was not ready, they held our bags and then took them to our room for us. We were too excited to see Boston to want to be in our room anyway. The staff was young and very welcoming. We had a standard room on the first floor. We did not mind the size at all. There was very little walking room around the bed area, and only one person can comfortably fit in the bathroom, but everything seemed new. There are speakers above the shower, so you can listen to music while showering! The orange lollypops were a nice touch. I also liked the large, full-length mirror. Here is my gripe: There are two rooms on the ground floor through a door and down a short hallway from the very noisy bar. Since we were staying on a Saturday night and I had read the reviews on this site, I knew I didn't want to be on the ground floor by the bar. So I specifically asked to be above the ground floor. This did not happen. We were stuck in one of the two rooms on the ground floor, despite my request. I tried not to be too disgruntled, as we were too tired from our long journey to make a fuss. Needless to say, it was VERY loud back there. We could hear laughing and loud music well past midnight. However, having read the reviews on this site, I came prepared with earplugs and slept soundly. This is a lovely hotel in a great location. But be smart and bring those earplugs. You never know what floor you're going to end up on --and it could be 5 feet away from a noisy bar crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Best Location”
Reviews.Author: DINGYDOLL
Reviews.Content: Friend suggested this hotel. Proved to be a great travel experience. Smack dab in Copley Square we walked to the upscale cafes on Newbury St. and hit all the best designer stores just across Boylston St. at Prudential Mall and Copley Place. Hotel is boutique style, small enough to be treated as family - - very friendly staff is all local and knows all there is to know about Boston. Hotel's lounge buzzes with good cheer and perfectly made cocktails. People are chatty and everybody feels at home. My window view looked out at the stately Boston Public Library. Not to be missed are tours of the art and sculpture inside the library and its two restaurants...one informal and the other, Sebastian's is very elegant. Formal high tea is served at 4 p.m. at Sebastian's which looks out into the library's outdoor enclosed courtyard with fountains and sculpture. Very posh! Hotel rooms are quiet, immaculate and comfortable. First floor lounge extends into large livingroom for socializing in fancy atmosphere of white leather couches and modern decor. Perfect for carrying on a conversation as low level music plays above. Great place to relax after work and sightseeing. We had a wonderful visit.

Reviews.Title: “Mind the Cockroach!”
Reviews.Author: scrumbleton
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the strength of other reviews here but were very dissapointed. We had a superior room which was small, dark and unclean with a huge cockroach in the bathroom. I dread to think what a standard room was like. I have never been so pleased to checkout of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Will return without doubt”
Reviews.Author: wrejennywren
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Charlesmark in September and had a great stay. The rooms are a little small but are so perfectly decorated and had such nice touches that the size didn't matter. When we arrived they had jazz playing in our room and the lights on - having been traveling for two weeks and staying in different hotels I really felt like I was home and totally chilled out. The location can not be beaten you are walking distance to everywhere and only one street over from Newbury (shopping central). The T station is literally accross the street and Boston Common is a 2 minute walk. The staff were really fantastic and so friendly but not in a fake cheesey way. They helped us out with everything and seemed genuinely interested that we were having a good time. The bar was cool and we sat and chated with the friendly bar tender for ages. The breakfast was fine nothing fancy but certainly enough for me and the free internet was very usefull. My only issue with the hotel was that our room was a little noisy at night. We were on the ground floor which was quite close to the bar and on the Saturday night was quite busy. As I didn't visit Boston to sit in my room it didn't really bother me too much. Will absolutley stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JNewland
Reviews.Content: We booked the Charlesmark on the strength of the reviews on this website. The first night we were booked into a standard room which was very, very small but the location and the standards set at this hotel more than compensate for the room size. The second night we were put into a Queen room which was much larger and was at the front of the hotel but there was no problem with traffic noise. We would recommend this hotel to anyone but would say it is worth paying the extra for a Queen room.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in the heart of Copley Square”
Reviews.Author: travelerinva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Charlesmark hotel. We had read the reviews (and compared prices) of all of the hotels in the Copley Square area and picked this one accordingly. We were not disappointed! The Charlesmark is a boutique hotel perfect for couples and single people looking for a great location and a very clean comfortable room; the rooms and bathrooms are very small so I would not recommend more than 2 people in a room. The decor is modern and trendy--flat screen tv, great stereo system (played music even in the bathroom!), free bottled water in the room. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet even though we were put in the room right above the bar on the lobby level. The free continental breakfast consisted of fruit, coffee, juice, bagels, muffins and doughnuts from Dunkin' Doughnuts (I think there was also some instant oatmeal as well)--which was very nice and carefully attended to by the staff each morning. I would highly recommend this hotel for location, price, cleanliness and fun trendy atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Purpleray14
Reviews.Content: We turned up tired not knowing what to expect as we had got a good deal on the hotel. We need not have worried. It was a fantastic hotel. Perfectly situated on Boylston St directly opposite the Boston Public Library and just 100 yards from the 'T'. Rooms are quite small but nicely decorated in a modern boutique style. The bathroom was great; grey slate shower. Complimentary breakfast was bagels, muffins, juice and cofffee - just enough to keep you going til lunch. Free internet too! Friendly and helpful staff. Nice bar area and busy outside restaurant. It was a very popular place to be. Noise not an issue though. Overall a great place to stay. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: noke24
Reviews.Content: Over my recent weekend trip to Boston, my girlfriend and I chose to stay at the Charlemark Hotel, which is a boutique hotel located in a great spot on Boylston st. From the modern ammenities to the extremely helpful staff, we found our stay to be more enjoyable than at many of large hotel chains that we are used to. They made you feel as though the services they offered were entirely focused on you. The newly renovated lounge and lobby area gives off an incredibly upscale vibe and is a great place to people watch. Rumor has it Tom Brady, quarterback of the Patriots, has been seen at the martini bar there. The rooms are modest size but are equiped very nicely. We stayed in the basement which we found to be a pleasant surprise. It is extremely quiet and you're guaranteed a great night of sleep. The room was great, from the surround sound stereo to the large flat screen tv and modern bath. When staying there ask for Kyle, the operations manager, and he'll ensure a great stay and recommend all the best hotspots in Boston. I would definately stay at the Charlesmark in the future

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Stylish and Well-Located Gem”
Reviews.Author: FlyMeToTheMoon
Reviews.Content: The Charlemark is an excellent choice for anyone looking to stay in a fantastic, centrally-located spot in Boston without breaking the bank. I just returned from a 2-night visit there -- my first and only time staying here. I would return in a heartbeat, and will be thoroughly disappointed if it is not available for my next visit. The room itself was on the small side, but they made the most out of the space with an oversized mirror and shelves. There was a large flat screen tv with DirecTV, a stereo and a DVD player. The room was clean and my window happened to look out onto Boylston so I had a fantastic view of the public library and the entire Copley Square area. The staff was extremely polite and helpful. They made us feel welcome and helped answer all our questions, going out of their way to do so. The location can't be beat. The hotel sits directly across from the public library and the Copley T station. It's in the heart of back bay, with Newbury, Boston Common, Fanuiel Hall, Downtown Crossing, Chinatown all within walking distance. With the green line T stop right out your door, you can get to any other part of the city (Boston College, Harvard, the airport) with ease. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes boutique hotels -- this is not a roomy, luxurious chain-hotel room. It's modern, minimalist, and stylish, with small rooms and a funky feel to it. There is a lobby bar which spills out onto the street....you can dine and drink outside on Boylston. There is also inside lounge with a projector tv and two computers for hotel guests (with a printer as well). The continental breakfast consists of Dunkin Donut bagels and muffins, juice and coffee. I really enjoyed my stay here, as a 30-year old married woman visting with girlfriends. If you're looking for a quiet roomy place away from the hub-bub of the city, it may not be the place for you. At night, I had no trouble sleeping as the bar downstairs and outside traffic did not seep into the room at all, even with a window facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot!!”
Reviews.Author: Ont
Reviews.Content: Location - AAA1!!!! We were greeted very nicely, with some advice as to how to get started in the city. Our bags were looked after, even though we checked in early, & were found in our room, after an initial lunch & neighbourhood tour. Being a walking city, we took advantage & strolled from here to most points of interest in the city - Heritage Trail, Italian District, Financial District, China Town, Harbourfront walk, etc. - & to the west, Fenway Park. Then, of course, the incredible Duck Tour (ha, ha) was just around the corner. What a fantastic, fantastic city!!! What little time was spent in the room was great - very comfortable bed, which was so welcome after the miles put on the feet - TV & sound system very good, but really just used for news/weather updates (Goodness, was it hot). Good continental breakfast, & access to internet/email appreciated, as it allowed us to stay in touch. Sorry to say, did not take advantage of the on-site bar - cold Corona's at rest stops, throughout the couple of days, had looked after that necessity.

Reviews.Title: “what a find”
Reviews.Author: calimerox
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 days at the Charlesmark and what a wonderfull experience it was. It is in a perfect location to do all the "touristy" things, the room was a good size and spotless (room 502). On the 5th floor there is very little traffic noise, so a good nights sleep was had by all. Ingrid at the desk and Adam in the bar also deserve a special mention for their hospitality and helpfulness when required. Boston is a fabulous city to visit and we had a ball. If you want an excellent place to stay in an excellent city then this hotel has it all

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexhhannah
Reviews.Content: Weighing everything - value, service, location, amenities - this is truly one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. This small hotel wraps everything together incredibly well. Please note, this is not a luxory hotel and is not a kids chain hotel. This is a hip, personal, fun hotel with great rooms, great location in the middle of Boston and excellent friendly service. From check-in and booking with Ingrid at the front desk (who actually remembered us calling and asking her about location, etc.) to the room with speakers in the ceiling, free water and a well used and helpful Top 10 Boston Guidebook in our room that was ours for the stay, the little touches and important things (clean comfortable bed, excellent shower) were thought of and included in the stay. The hotel itself has a Euro Chic feel (without being at all overbearing) and each night as we walked home the bar was open with a small crowd of people lingering in the lobby or in the bar outside. The location is a stones throw away from busy and crowded Newbury street but a little out of the way to make sure that quiet and solitude exists once you are in your room. Please note, this is not a hotel with gorgeous views, or three elevators - this is a small, charming hotel that makes it easy and fun to explore Boston and its neighborhoods either by foot or subway (across the street) that is truly a pleasure to stay at. I could not recommend it any more highly.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love it here! This is the only place to stay in Boston. It's like my home away from home... comforable, independant feel, friendly staff (personable, not reading from scripts) and FREE breakfast!!!!!! Why stay anywhere else???

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Charlesmark, as others have said, is a very nice place to stay in an absolutely great location. I just returned this morning, and have nothing but good things to say. I wanted to post something on tripadvisor.com because I learned about the hotel on this website and very much appreciate having access to such a wealth of information before traveling. My room was very small, but the bed was comfortable, the pillows (four) were just right, every morning I was given two more water bottles (chilled), the air conditioning worked, the showers had good water pressure, the towels were soft, the breakfast (continental) was fresh and abundant, the internet was always available, my questions were answered with accurate and helpful information. I paid $169/night for a single. There is a pretty good Thai restaurant right next door. Oh, and the bar downstairs (that spills out onto the sidewalk when it's warm) is a happening place at night. Only drawback, and this isn't the hotel owners fault, is that my room backed up to an area that was very loud at about 2 in the morning with the extended noise of garbage being dumpted and with what sounded like 1 million beer/wine/booze bottles being poured into a dumpster. You may want to pack earplugs

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: MyHobbyIsTravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a real gem. Boston's Back Bay is just out the front doorstep. It is located across the street from the Boston Public library and a few steps from Copley Square and the subway stop. The room I stayed in was compact but had everything I needed. Classical music, from the stereo system in the room, greeted me as I entered... which I thought was a nice touch. It was clean, stylish and quiet. The hotel provides tea and coffee in the evenings, and a light breakfast in the mornings. Computers are available for internet access, and wi-fi is available for those who have their own wi-fi compatible laptops. The hotel staff were very accommodating, pleasant, and informative. And the price can't be beat.... in such an expensive location, it is a great hotel for the cost. Anytime I'm in Boston in the future, The Charlesmark is where I'm going to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Attitude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Love the space, but the receptionist is rude and abrupt. Shame it could be great venue except for the attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience is Right on the 'Mark'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We agree with most of the previous posts. Our upgraded room on the second floor (201) was roomy enough but small by American standards. Size aside, the room and hotel has much going for it. Great view of the street from the windowsill (the marathon finish line is right outside). Direct TV provides lots of free channels and PPV movies. On top of that, the hotel offers a wide selection of free videos. Two PCs in the lounge provide FREE internet access 24/7. The staff was consistently friendly and helpful with all of our needs. Try the sour apple martini in the trendy little bar downstairs. For breakfast, unless you just want fruit, OJ and coffee, take a short walk up Boylston to Finagle a Bagel across from Copley Square. One of the best features for us was that the T stops were literally seconds from the Charlesmark's door. A walk of a few blocks in any direction will get you to the Prudential Center, Newberry Street, or the Public Gardens and Boston Common. Overall the Charlesmark is the epitome of convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish without breaking the bank”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thought the Charlesmark was a very stylish hotel, and very reasonably priced for the area. We paid $199 per night for one of the larger rooms, which was adequately sized, and I found the decor and the furnishings to be very modern, and clean with no obvious wear and tear. I particularly liked the bathroom - it had a walk in shower, no bath, but everything was very stylish, with nice toiletries etc. The bar (which I believe has been recently renovated) was fabulous - all padded leather walls and plush seating. Really enjoyed the breakfasts - they were fairly basic, coffee, juice, bagels, pastries, fruit etc., - but they were excellent quality, and with newspapers and two internet points available to browse through, it made for a very pleasant start to the day. On our last day we decided to venture out to breakfast with a friend and on the recommendation of the hotel found a great value and wonderfully tasty breakfast in a bar a few blocks down Boylston Street. If you want style, good value, and a personal touch you don't get with the large chains, I would go for the Charlesmark every time.

Reviews.Title: “Chic on the Cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Charlesmark for three nights and it suited our purposes well. However, we are low maintenance travellers ie. Our needs are a good location (which it certainly is), clean, decent sized rooms, and generally somewhere quiet and safe to rest our heads. And the Charlesmark ticked those boxes. We were on the sixth floor in a Large category room, and it was quiet and clean with good air con and a big window and a v. small but extremely clean bathroom (Sorry, that should be shower room - as it did not have a bath). If you are a traveller who requires a bit more fussing over, and needs things like robes, ironing boards, room service and staff who'll run around after you, then the Charlesmark may not satisfy you. We found service friendly and fun, if not overly attentive. (We asked for some shirts to be pressed and eventually had to walk around the block to sort it out ourselves, when a requested ironing board never arrived). The breakfast, which is included in the price, was adequate if you just need a quick bite to start the day, and is served buffet style, so you certainly don't need to go hungry as there's plenty of it. Overall, good for those who spend most of their time out and about and just use their hotel as a sleeping/refuelling spot.

Reviews.Title: “Character and Courtesy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our 5yr B-school reunion was hosted by the Sheraton and we thankfully decided to stay at the Charlesmark, a short walk away in a great central location. The Charlesmark has small quiet clean rooms with a London flat type feel. If you don't like feeling like one of the masses, you would be well suited at the Charlesmark. It comes with complimentary bottles of water! Even better than the unique style throughout was the genuine courtesy of the staff. Very helpful with transport advice and flagging taxis during a rainy/busy weekend. Daniel and Lannhi - Dallas, TX

Reviews.Title: “college digs in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: sflil2006
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beat--can go almost anywhere by walking or riding the T; lots of restaurants and shopping near by. Rate reasonable--cheaper during mid-week; friendly and helpful staff; ok continental breakfast Downside: the halls and rooms are small, cramped and a bit worn--feels a bit like an upscale college dorm; can hear street noise even on the 6th floor; noisy A/C; maid did not replenish shampoo, etc. If you want cushy digs, might want to stay at places like the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: NapaNomad
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Charlesmark the first week of May. I chose it from TripAdvisor reviews and was satisfied overall with the hotel. The hotel renovation and rooms are very clean, modern and comfortable; although quite small. The bathroom was "standing room only" for one to shower, brush teeth, etc.; but nicely done in stone tiles. We had a "premium" room with a queen bed and single sofa sleeper (little futon sofa). To me it is "no frills" accomodations; minimal space, minimal storage, tiny fridge that holds just 2 bottles of water (complimentary, daily). I would classify it as more of a business destination. The staff was aloof, but available. The lounge was full each evening; with patio seating on the street. There is plenty of great things to see and do right out the door and the subway is right on the same block. The hotel's continental breakfast is substantial enough. But trying to find a "full breakfast", eggs, etc; within walking distance is a challenge. One morning we opted for the Westin Hotel's breakfast, about 2 blocks away. It was lovely and the tab was $50 (!)...on the last morning we disovered a great hide-away for breakfast at the Boston Public Library, downstairs off the courtyard. A small cafe with egg sandwiches, bagels, etc. Beats the Burger King. Bottomline, the cost of our room ($189 daily rate) was reasonable for the area, surrounding neighborhood is great and our top floor (6th) room was quiet. No real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: IrishRamblerIreland
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Charlesmark at the end of March for three nights. I think the hotel was really lovely. Very clean, modern and really good value for money. Our room was small but that was made very clear on all the reviews we had read so we were prepared. When we arrived, the room was bigger than I expected. The bed is smaller than a normal double in the standard double room. I'm petite and found the bed short. Pay the extra and get a superior room for the bigger bed. We found the Charlesmark really central and the hotel is very close to lots of bars and restaurants. Apart from the size of the bed the hotel really is some thing special. Breakfast was plentiful with a lot of variety. On our final day we left our bags with reception when checking out, So we could do some more sight seeing in this amazing city on our return our bags were just inside the public bar area, there was no bar tender there and our bags could not be seen from reception. We were not happy, we thought they were going to be stored some where safer than very close to the front door. Being completely fair, the reception is very close to front door also and the bar is practically in the reception, they are so close, and I doubt much go's on with out reception knowing. I guess the Bostonians are far more trusting than the Irish. Just to add when I was booking via the internet I found Justin very patient and helpful. Note for management! I am impressed that you take time to answer any emails, which seems to reflect negatively on the hotel. I feel the manner you use can be a little personal and harsh. I feel that if I were to stay again in the hotel, which I hope to do so again given the opportunity, I might be a little slow to alert you to any issue I may have, fearing the response. I feel there is a fine line between dealing with an issue professionally, with out taking it on personally. The hotelâ€™s quality speaks for itself, trust that and stay professional!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Charming”
