Reviews.Author: D678
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. It is seconds from the Copley T and minutes from Newbury St. and the Prudential Center. I'll definitely stay here again. Our room was rather small, but it was incredibly incredibly charming and comfortable. I loved the all tile bathroom with the large shower and stereo sound coming into the bathroom. There were very nice touches throughout the room. The bed was very cozy and the lighting was very soft and soothing. The staff was helpful and friendly. The bar is hopping at night and you can just go downstairs for some nightlife. I highly recommend that the hotel offers its guests some vouchers for the pub or a happy hour. That would be a lot of fun and a very nice touch for the guests. I also think that they could really beef up their breakfast options. The breakfast was very simple: bagels, coffee, muffins, donuts, and apples...no toaster. However, you can walk down the street for countless breakfast options, so it doesn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel Beware (or anyone else seeking comfort or amenities)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was offered this hotel by my corporate travel department -- excited to try a new boutique hotel instead of the standard Marriott, Westin chains, I booked this hotel for a Monday night in Boston. The location is in the heart of Back Bay, but it is definitely not for the business traveler. Beware - there is no parking or valet. You can double park on Boylston Street (arguably one of the busier streets in Boston) and then drive three blocks to the Prudential Parking Lot ($38 for 12 hours). It happened to be raining this day, so I found this particularly uncomfortable. Beware- there is no luggage check or bellperson. The manager offerd to watch my bags while I parked the car. When I returned, I found my bags and briefcase in the middle of the lobby (next to the public bar) and a sign on the front desk that read "Manager will return in a moment." I was not pleased that my bags were left unattended in the public lobby, but they were safe and sound, so I just waited for the Manager to reappear. Beware -- the rooms are small. I had a reservation for a king non-smoking room that was reserved with my credit card, including a two day cancellation policy. When I entered my room, I found a tiny full size bed. I returned to the front desk, but was told there were no king size beds available. The manager showed me a list -- apparently I was on the list for King size rooms, but I checked in too late (9pm) and they were all gone. I showed him my confirmed reservation from my corporate travel service (I work for a Fortune 50 company that makes travel arrangements for 30K employees all over the world), but he gazed at me perplexed. I asked him if he could offer me anything else and he said no. I was tired so I returned to my room. I unpacked my suit into a closet the size of a kitchen cabinet (no joke) and put my other clothes in a drawer under the bed. Beware -- there is no place to work. I needed to to check my email and get some work done. I looked around for the desk. I found a writing counter that slid out from under the TV, but didn't know where to sit. I found a folding chair in the kitchen cabinet/closet. The hotel only has wireless internet (the kind you find at the Days Inn type establishments), which wouldn't work with my computer. Frustrated again, I decided to go down to the Lounge and have a drink. Beware -- the lounge/bar closes at 10am. I went down to the lounge at 10:03pm. The bartender abruptly informed me that the lounge was closed. He spun around and continued conversing with his co-worker. Foiled again, I went back to my room Beware -- the bed is not comforable. I retired to my room and decided to get in bed and watch tv. The bed was hard and the pillows caved into a small ball -- barely providing any support. When even the most basic hotels are upgrading to pillow top mattresses and medium or firm pillows, I was surprised by the lack of comfort. I think this hotel is better suited for Eurpoean leisure travelers on a budget looking for an Ikea-style experience in a good location. Business travelers beware.

Reviews.Title: “Chic & Friendly, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My business colleague and I stayed at the Charlesmark for 2 nights, and both of us loved it! The decor is lovely ("Eurochic" and very functional -- I love the gray/stainless/red splash look downstairs, and the IKEA look of the rooms), and the location can't be beat! The staff was young and very in-the-know about what was going on in the area, and very efficient. The rooms were small, but no smaller than boutique hotels I've stayed at in London/Notting Hill and Brussells, and both my room and my colleague's (two different single layouts) were very functional; we had no problem working together on a project in the evenings with two laptops and a pile of manuals/spec sheets. The WiFi and in-room entertainment systems were great extras (satellite jazz in the shower is decadent). The rooms offer tiny fridges with bottled water, and the bar downstairs makes a great martini. Didn't stop for continental breakfast, but the spread looked quite nice. I also admit to wandering the halls one night to look at all the artwork... floor 5 has some especially nice "around Boston" works. I've already passed on business cards for the Charlesmark to 4 friends who travel frequently...

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Charlesmark in March, while in Boston for a conference. It was within easy walking distance of everything, the staff was great, and the room clean, comfortable and cozy. It was a great refuge at the end of a busy day to kick back and listen to a cd, and chill out. It was a great value for the money. As a woman traveling alone, I felt quite safe in the hotel, and in the neighborhood around it, even out in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michaelgt
Reviews.Content: Excellent location accross the street from Copley metro station. Nice continental breakfast included, free internet service for guests. Enjoyed the clean modern art decor rooms. Good value for money as Boston hotels are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Small, personal and fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Book Goddess
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel has great staff and is in perfect location. And I mean GREAT STAFF! Always helpful, quick to respond, personable. The rooms are small but very well appointed with stylish touches such as a huge mirror to create a larger feel to the room. Another touch is the great stereo system in each room. The bathrooms have been upgraded and have glass tile and stone throughout. Very nice shower. Points made in some reviews about plumbing and small rooms with small beds are correct. But the management's response that the small rooms are VERY economical for Boston is well taken, and given that I am a small person, none of this detracted from my stay. My friend had one of the larger rooms and sure enough the bed was larger too. Note that there is no refrigerator in the rooms - but instead a tiny refrigerator/heater that holds a couple of bottles of water. Also, the carpeting in the halls is badly stained. Don't let this keep you from your room, which has fresh paint and is well maintained. I LOVED my stay! The room was quiet, clean and I slept like a log. The buffet breakfast was fine, and the bar at night is great fun. They have a wonderful bartender named Jessica - she rocks. Two big thumbs up, and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter25
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location! Super friendly staff, thanks guys, very clean and charming. Breakfast is included, so is complimentary water in your room and the price for what you are getting at the Charlesmark is amazing. The rooms are small but very charming and most importantly very clean. Again, a great staff that tries very hard to make it a great stay. Next time that I am in Boston I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think the other reviews say it all. We finished off our holiday with a night at the Charlesmark and what a lovely way to end! The service was excetional and the room had everything you could have needed. Breakfast was casual but lovely and what great cocktails in the bar!

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Boston”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Cheers to the staff at the Charlesmark Hotel. People that know the area and also love the area. They told us where we should go to in this amazing city and what we should not miss. I quote the front desk staff agent Ingrid "You can not get bad seafood in this city" She was right. She always had a REAL smile on her face even after pulling a double shift two days in a row. ( I only know this because I saw her morning and night when I was down at the desk) She is from Boston (A true Red Sox fan) and will give you the best places to see while your there. I even got a chance to meet the owner Mark in his new bar that even with the music blasting (not bad) it does not come up in the rooms to make you call and yell at all you would never know it's even playing up until 1:am... I told him about his amazing staff and also that he had to give Ingrid a raise, he told me she just joined the staff less then a month (WHAT).. Hats off to the best staff at a hotel. I have been all over the world and stayed in hotels that go for $500. a night, they have NOTHING on the jem of Boston.. Good luck to you all there in what I know will be years of good luck...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Time!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! A few words that come to mind are: - Modern (great "in room" amenities/not out dated like a lot of local) - Affordable (stay in a great place witha great location for 1/2 the price) - Clean (let's just say I'm not worried about the sheets!) - Comfortable (great bed, great night's sleep) - Friendly (the staff is so much fun and the Lounge is an absolute blast) - Location (right in the heart of boston) I've stayed here a number of times for overnight trips to Boston and have never been dissapointed - It's always the first place I check for availablity and am sure to recommend it to all my friend when they come into Boston! - Dan

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Charlesmark”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Date:Feb24th-28th Reviewer: Visitors from Kildare My wife and I stayed in this fantastic hotel. We were extremely impressed with the hotels location, cosy room, in- house cd and overall ambience, boston is a beautiful city and the locals are very helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The charlesmark hotel was a very awesome choice!! we had six girls for a bachelorette party -- so we were pretty loud and crazy!! our rooms were secluded from the rest of the hotel (so we didn't bother anyone) and the best part was the service. Everyone that works there was soooo nice and helpful and very funny!! We all agreed that the style of the hotel was very beautiful and modern. I would definetly stay there again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Everything”
Reviews.Author: twinklescud
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently had the pleasure of visiting Boston and staying at the Charlesmark. The hotel is absolutely wonderful (and so fairly priced too)! Our room was very nicely furnished and very modern and the bathroom was very clean with a nice healthy supply of white fluffy towels. The satellite TV was an added bonus. The location is great - very close to the subway station (which can take you practically anywhere in the city and beyond); walking distance to the coolest shops and restaurants and other places like the pharmacy and if need be, the grocery store. My boyfriend and I love to walk so we found it quite convenient to be able to shop downtown and then walk back to the hotel (mind you, it's a bit of a walk but nothing too damaging). The staff was very friendly and helpful. Calvin, in particular, was so fantastic and nice to us that I almost wanted to take him home with me in my luggage. He was so helpful, funny and charming that he made staying at the Charlesmark even better. Thank you, Calvin. With all the great things about this hotel (price, rooms, location, staff) I will definitely stay here again should I have the chance to come back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay.............”
Reviews.Author: perrycrimmins
Reviews.Content: What a gem! I read the reviews and was not dissapointed. Booked a delux room for Dec 2005 and got a very comftable bed and a setee area. Power shower and a suberb surround sound system. Big TV ,CD and DVD. Excellent breakfast of bagels - tea - jiuces - etc , all day long free coffee and internet connection 24/7. Cheerful , helpful staff and a superb location next to the T. Great rooms at a great price booked on Expedia. Stayu here and you will love it. I can not wait to go back! Perry and Kathy - London - England

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, great service, great bar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent last weekend at the Charlesmark Hotel and I am thoroughly impressed. With such low rates (under $150) I was a bit suspicious. But my stay was great from the moment I checked in. Calvin at the reception desk went above and beyond, presenting me with a beautiful (and free) map of Boston and informing me where my office was located (I stayed for business). He provided me excellent walking directions, even letting me know where the best restaurants and coffee shops were in that area. That's service. The decor of the hotel and bar is modern, very nice. Everything in the hotel seems brand new. I spent a lot of time at the bar trying their many martini variations. The bartender was friendly, and she put the football game on for me. Best of all she was a bit heavy-handed, which is very necessary in the cold weather. I highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just spent four nights at the Charlesmark Hotel and could not have been happier with our stay. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very stylish. My wife and I were very pleased with the entertainment system and the wonderful classical music that was playing when we entered our room. The bar/lounge that has recently opened has an relaxed and comfortable atmosphere and a great martini menu. We are planning on coming back to Boston next year and will definately be staying at the Charlesmark.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Pricey Boston”
Reviews.Author: SunnyNJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two days with my husband and 9 year old daughter. I came to this hotel because of all the great reviews I read on this website and I was not disappointed. I did have a room in the basement but the noise was minimal and other than that the room was very nice and clean. The best thing I can say about this hotel is the staff were great. We had never been to Boston before and they were a great help getting us to where we wanted to go and offering recommendations. I don't think the larger hotels in the area could offer this kind of attention to their guests needs. I did a lot of research before choosing this hotel and I am glad I did--the other hotels in the area were way too expensive. I would definitely go back. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: lisabellab
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from three nights spent at the Charlesmark with my sister and mother. I chose this hotel because of its location, its rates, and the recommendations on this and other Web sites. I was NOT disappointed. We found the staff exceptionally helpful, the rooms very well appointed, and the location highly desirable. If I could improve on anything, it would be the size of our room. (The three of us stayed in a room with one queen bed and a small couch that converted into a bed.) Calvin, Kyle, and Dolores -- the staff members on hand during our stay -- spared nothing to satisfy us. They were friendly, helpful, kind, and accommodating. Our room was tastefully decorated with the latest modern fashions in bedding and accessories. This included a full stereo with CD player, a large television, a cordless phone, cool clock radio, and a miniature (tiny) refrigerator stocked with COMPLIMENTARY bottled water. I almost forgot to mention that they also included a DK Boston guidebook. Even the towels at this place were nice; thick, clean-smelling, new. We all liked the tiled bathroom and the HOT water in the shower. The three of us particularly enjoyed our breakfasts here. We helped ourselves to instant oatmeal, fresh fruit, Dunkin' Donuts goodies, bagels, orange juice, coffee, and hot chocolate. We dined with other hotel guests in the area used nightly as a lounge. It doubled comfortably as breakfast seating while CNN aired on the large-screen television. One of my favorite features of this hotel was the complimentary high-speed Internet access. We were able to check our email, print boarding passes, and take care of any other personal business using the two computers available to guests. Though none of us had laptops with us, we saw others taking advantage of their free wireless Internet access in the lounge. The bar in the lobby of the Charlesmark is something of a spectacle. As a young person, I can say it added to the appeal of the hotel, but I can easily see why my mother wasn't particularly fond of it. Though the bar was quite full at nighttime, we were not at all bothered by its patrons or the din of them enjoying their evenings. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who was travelling to Boston without children. Single people in the 20 - 40 year old range will most certainly enjoy a stay here. The staff truly tried hard to make sure our stay here was enjoyable. I wish I could say that for every hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...with just a few quirks!”
Reviews.Author: jillhomeuk
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the stylish Charlesmark. We stayed here at the end of our honeymoon, and wanted to finish it in style. The Charlesmark certainly delivered on this score. Previous reviewers may not have got to see the cocktail bar. It is indeed gorgeous, as with everything else here, stylish. The 2 negatives about it though is that while staying here, walking through the entrance to the bar to reach the stairs to our room felt like we were gatecrashing someone elses party. The freely available coffee has also disapeared, but the basic breakfast remains. Our room was in the basement, and didn't smell musty at all, no, not one little bit, instead it smelt a bit like a dentist surgery. Still, once you get used to the rather dark conditions, the rooms are excellent, with some very nice touches. A decent fridge and entertainment system is always very welcome at the end of a long day sightseeing. Location is excellent, the hotel stands on the finish line to the Boston marathon, and is very near the underground railway stop. Despite the proximity of the new bar to our room, we were not disturbed by the noise at all, except for the sound of people coming down the stairs to use the public bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an ideally located hotel in Boston. The decor, breakfast, and amenities were outstanding. Most of all, I loved the helpful staff, especially Calvin. He helped get me a cab to the airport at 4 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Charlesmark is great”
Reviews.Author: aneee
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to England after spending 5 days at the Charlesmark. The only thing I can find to complain about is that the new swanky cocktail bar was opening the day after we left. The rooms were super ,sound system great and the showers fabulous. we were on the 3rd floor and experienced very little street noise. The staff were all friendly and helpful, plenty of on tap coffee. Bagels fruit and muffins at breakfast plus all the papers. We really had a great time there and would certainly recommend it to any of our friends travelling to Boston...go and have a martini in the new bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice touch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the third time within the past year we have stayed here. We have a son in school here. The place is perfectly located, very charming and the staff is always available and very helpful. Music on when you enter your room after check-in is a very nice touch. We will keep coming back. Jim

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: PDH
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the Charlesmark and having read all the reviews on Trip Advisor we knew what to expect. It is in a perfect position and is ideally situated for seeing the sights of Boston. Yes, our room was small (my wife especially missed wardrobe-length hanging space) but it was well designed and well decorated. We appreciated the â€˜modernâ€™ touches like the sound system and the dimmable bedside lights. The bathroom was also quite small but beautifully fitted and the shower was a treat to use. There was an air-conditioning unit outside our window but we soon got used to it switching on and off and it did not disturb us. The staff were very friendly, efficient and helpful - they offered to look after our luggage for the whole of the day before we checked in and the rest of the day after we checked out until our flight in the evening. Good continental breakfast in the relaxing lounge area and muffins and coffee available for the rest of the day. There was some work going on - Reception has been moved to Ground Floor and its previous area is being turned into more rooms and the Cocktail Bar was being finished off (opens in November) - but it was not intrusive. The Cocktail Bar looks to be a sophisticated addition, as are the new tables and umbrellas outside the front door. Our stay at the Charlesmark was a pleasant and relaxing experience and very reasonably priced for the area. We really enjoyed our visit to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Parents Weekend”
Reviews.Author: kejibeard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from visiting our daughter at college in Boston for parents weekend. Many of the hotels in the areas surrounding the colleges and universities tend to hike their prices up a bit and many of the 'affordable' hotels are often booked early. In the past we have stayed at the Fairmont Copley, the Hyatt in Cambridge, Marriott and others. The price of the Charlesmark was about $100 less than any of those for this same weekend so we decided to give it a try. So here is my review - the good and the not so good. 1. Location is great. It was raining most of the weekend but it is only about 50 yards to the T stop. The hotel is also an easy walk to just about any type of store or restaurant you could need. 2. Hotel Staff: We only met a couple members of the staff the entire time we were there and both were friendly. 3. Our room: Here is where the hotel looses points. From what I've gathered after re-reading all of the prior reviews, we were probably in one of the least desirable rooms of the hotel. Even though we payed extra ($249/ night before taxes) for a 'premium' room, our room was a dark, musty smelling room in the basement with no windows to the outside. The windows that were in the room looked out onto a hallway and have bars on them. Not only does this seem like a fire hazard to me (I asked and this would be a violation in Virginia) but the light from the hallway seeped in thru the shades and made for a miserable nights sleep. On the plus side, the room was very clean. 4. Miscellaneous: The hotel makes a big deal about offering 'hundreds of TV channels including movie channels' and bottled water, however out of those hundreds of channels probably less than a dozen actually came in focus. The bottled water is a nice touch but for water drinkers like my husband and myself, 2 small bottles doesn't go very far. Neither was a big deal for us because we are not TV watchers and I didn't mind walking around the corner to the grocery store to buy my own water. Would I stay here again? Not at $249 a night for a basement room. My sister stayed at a bed and breakfast on Beacon Street for about $100 a night the same weekend. No it was not as close to a T stop and no it was not as new & clean feeling but it was a large 4th floor room with real working windows and a refrigerator in the room. If choosing the Charlesmark, ask to not be in a room in the basement and remember, part of what you are paying for is the location. A few blocks further from a T stop will probably save you a hundred dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and shower!”
Reviews.Author: saidean
Reviews.Content: After a 24 hour flight/transit/lack of sleep, we really valued the wonderfully *powerful* hot shower that Charlesmark hotel provided. The room is a tad on the small side, but considering that we spent most of our time outside the hotel running around Back Bay (extremely convenient from the hotel) and neighbouring shopping centres (eg Prudential), we hardly found the size of the room a problem. The staff were helpful and the room had little additions that point to it being a boutique hotel - mini hifi/cd player, metal plated light switches (that dims the light the longer you touch the plate etc), a nice big stand-alone mirror, complimentary mineral waters etc. The bathroom had a sizeable shower 'cubicle' which was big enough for 2 (compared to other B&Bs we stayed in New England, this was a plus). Did I mention that the shower was nice, hot and powerful? lol A big plus after suffering a 24 hour flight when you just want to wash down all that stiffness and tiredness. There were lots of nearby eating places so that's not a problem. Our room on the 6th floor overlooks the Boston Public Library and the finishing line of the Boston Marathon (I think!)... Traffic noises wasn't an issue (aside from the rare sirens) plus the air conditioning helped. Internet connection is available either at the lounge area (2 PCs provided for guests) or rooms have wireless connections for those with notebooks. Breakfast was continental which meant muffins/bagels/cereals etc + coffee/tea/juice/fruits. That's good enough for us to start our day! Overall, enjoyed our stay there! Recommended! (ps. Excuse the mess in the photos - they were taken right after we dumped our luggage in the room. The room looks a lot more cozier than as shown - lighting from the camera flash spoils the ambience!!)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for my fifth anniversary and it was perfect. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The rooms were very modern, spotless and I loved the decor. The beds were very comfortable and the location could not have been beat. I would definitely recommend this hotel. I will be back! The staff recommended a tremendous restaurant about a block away - L'espelier - phenomenal! Also, we came back to a nice bottle of champagne on ice in our room as a congratulatory gift. All in all, a perfect anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Gourmet Service on a TV Dinner Budget”
Reviews.Author: salmondan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Charlesmark. Excellent location- doors down from the T, shopping and restaurants just around the corner, comfortable room (we had a queen size), and all the extras included with no additional cost (bottled water, fresh fruit, continental breakfast, computers with internet access,and even a bottle of champagne for our anniversary)- made for a wonderful vacation. But what really pulled the package together was the attention to detail that our concierge Calvin Cherry provided us- greeting us at 1PM in the morning with a smile, after hours dinner connections, chilled champagne and a lovely note of greeting, followed by fresh coffee when we awoke after hours- and that was just the first 24 hours! Only complaint was the musty smell of the stairs and basement hallway- avoid the basement if you can, but don't turn it down if it's your only option. Hope to have the opportunity to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a larger room ,which was attractively decorated, if rather dark .Despite the higher price of the room,I was surprised to find that it had no windows to the outside.As mentioned by another correspondent, the room smelt musty. Breakfast was described as " continental",but it was not clear to us ,with the cramped arrangements and limited variety ,which continent was being referred to. Overall, I was disappointed at the value for money,which might have been better with a better room.The location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luv2dohair
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long stay in Boston and we stayed at the Charlesmark (my husband and I). We have absolutely no complaints about it. It it such a nice hotel, awesome decorations, cool bathrooms, the staff is very friendly and always willing to help or give suggestions, breakfast was good and the hotel is in a perfect location! We were able to walk everywhere! I must admit, my legs hurt like heck but we were still able to walk everywhere!! The construction at the hotel is all finished already ( I've read some complaints in past reviews, but there is no more going on.) We had the oppurtunity to stay in both the standard and queen rooms and I must admit, the standard rooms were pretty small, but the queen rooms are just fine! My husband and I really enjoyed Boston and especially staying at the Charlesmark Hotel. Things we did and enjoyed included: The Freedom Trail Boston Duck Tour Fenway Park Tour ( a must ) Fanueill Hall Red Sox Game

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: JenSpen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Charlesmark June 2005. Minuses: Do not stay in a room on the ground floor of this hotel. We had to walk through construction to get to and from it. It was a strange feeling because reception is on the 2nd floor so it did not feel like we were even staying in a hotel. There was no view from this room either, just the backs of the surrounding buildings through the alley. And the window was high in the room, making you feel like you were in a basement. We had to keep the AC on high (which was freezing) or else the room smelled musty. Pluses: Location location location! Very nice bathroom wired with speakers from the sound system. Internet access in the common area.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: SommerinTexas
Reviews.Content: We just got back yesterday from Boston and the Charlesmark Hotel. We stayed there for a 3-night mini-vac and couldn't have been more pleased. The only negative of the place is that the rooms are small. However, they make up for that in every other way. Breakfast is included every morning (pastries, bagels, fruit, coffee, OJ). Your mini fridge is constantly stocked with complimentary bottled water, and if you run out, no problem, they'll immediately get you more. Free computers and internet service are located in the lobby. They also put guide books in every one of their rooms for visitors to use during their stay. It's the little things that count, right? Aside from all these plusses, the location of the hotel couldn't be better. There is a subway stop literally across the street from the hotel, tons of bars and restaurants and shops up and down the street. We highly recommend the Charlesmark, and the next time we go to Boston, we'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Give the charlesmark a try”
Reviews.Author: Jason_Rees
Reviews.Content: To echo the views of former guests this hotel has a great location, in the heart of boston yards from a t stop (which are easy to use and very cheap) . The rooms are clean and well presented, they are an average size and perfect for a city break. The new cocktail bar (yet to open) will be a good addition and the reception staff polite and helpful. I would certainly stay here again, we had room 402 at the front of the hotel with views Boylston St and was very light and airy.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot, but a couple of asides -”
Reviews.Author: JRO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Charlesmark August 26 and 27, and have some mixed feelings. I was generally pleased as it is right in the middle of the Back Bay, literally at the marathon finish line (which may be as close as I ever get to that!) You can walk to most of the sites and activities fairly easily, but know that I walk a lot and this may be daunting for some. It is a 1/2 block from the transit system, though. It is, also, centrally located to tons of restaurants and shopping. The staff ranged from very friendly and accommodating to slighly dazed and spacey - they were all young and not quite professional (but trying). I was left with the impression that everyone trains at some sort of chic hostel. They are in the process of serious renovations or completion of this hotel, so be aware. This isn't necessarily annoying, just a fact. Breakfast is adequate as in muffins, coffee, juice, oatmeal packets, etc. The baked goods were from Dunkin Donuts daily. The rooms are Very small and the bathrooms compact, and I mean small as in you should either be married to or exceptionally good friends with a traveling companion. There was no tub in our bath, but the slate shower was fabulous - good pressure, too. The toilettries are seriously lacking, so pack in. The stereo system is a nice touch - I don't know if this is surround sound or just a small space. Beware that if you are facing Boylston St (as we were) it is quite noisy throughout the wee hours. I'm not convinced my stay was worth quite what I paid for it, but Boston is a pricey town and this is a good location. The rooms and property were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Mark!”
Reviews.Author: Ace624
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Charlesmark for 4 nights this summer. Had a nice room with a view of the library, not noisy at all. Yes, the room was small but you're really only there to sleep anyway. The room is clean and well furnished. The bed was comfortable and the a/c works great. Nice modern bathroom with a great shower. One suggestion would be to have more of a reading light for bedside reading. The breakfasts were nice ( a toaster for the bagels??) and the internet was a nice touch. The location of this hotel is very good and just a short walk to the metro or Newbury Street. The office staff were friendly and very helpful. We would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahowarth
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent Hotel. Very good value for money, excellent position and very efficient and friendly staff. Rooms are smallish but have everything that is needed. Would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Well deserves its high ranking among Boston hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Quality space, Unbeatable location, Great staff. I stayed 4 nights with my son on a college visit tour, and will stay again when next in Boston. The rooms are small but inviting, and the small number of them (33?) gives the place a very human scale. Attention to detail is apparent everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After having travelled for a week in the Cape area, we stayed for 2 nights at the CharlesMark. What a wonderful hotel! Staff is very friendly, and knowledgeable. Rooms are intimate, very clean. We even took pictures of the bathroom for our house renovations! We had been looking for an internet cafe since being downsouth, and it was great to finally have internet. Free local calls is a great idea. Good location to major shopping areas, and top quality restaurants within 200 metres of the front door, close to Boston Common. The only thing is that maybe sound proof class would be a good idea if there are concerts nearby. Oh, and piping coffee/water for the continental breakfast. We have already decided to stay at the CharlesMark again and to pass on the name of the hotel to other Boston travellers!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Treemonkneesha
Reviews.Content: The Charlesmark is right across from the amazing Boston Public Library (go for lunch and check out the art) on vibrant Copley Square. The staff is charming and very helpful, the rooms are lovely and modern, the price is great, and there is a T stop right across the street. I plan to stay here next time I'm in Boston. They also have fresh fruit and bagels, coffee and tea, a large pitcher of ice water (which we needed in that June heat wave) and a computer you can use right in the lobby that over looks the street. There was construction going on in the front of the building when we were there, but it was not an obstruction to us. The workers were friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Boston. We also booked this hotel on the strength of the great reviews @tripadvisor.com. The location is VERY convenient to everything -- plus a train station stop is right across the street. The decor and attention to detail are excellent! We enjoyed the extras like guidebooks to borrow, free continental breakfast, in-room entertainment system, and internet access. The hotel is also in the process of building what looks to be like a great cocktail/bar area in the front. My only suggestion is avoid getting a room along the front of the hotel (those that overlook Boylston) if you are a light sleeper. The street noise is loud most of the night. Other than that, this is a great hotel. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Boston and had booked this hotel on the strength of the great reviews. It is in a great location, across from Copley Square and handy for the Charles river. The rooms are small but well equipped and look to have been recently refurbished. The friends with us had stayed elsewhere before but rated this hotel above other more expensive hotels. One bonus is that a basic but good breakfast is included, and tea, coffee & water are available all day in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Full marks at the Charlesmark”
Reviews.Author: rabelaus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was superb. Really enjoyed the little touches (guidebook to borrow, breakfast, entertainment system, newspaper clippings in the lobby). The entrance hall was being developed, but looked like it would be up to the standard of the rest of the hotel when it was finished. The staff were friendly and helpful (except the receptionist on at 5:30am who did bring the tone of the hotel down a bit - just don't check out then). The only small problem was trying to find the hotel in the beginning - we walked past it twice!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Tomscobra
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small but a greal value. Located across the street from the Library and a subway stop. One block from Newbury street and 2 blocks to Legal Seafood and Copley shopping mall. We were there 2 nights and it was quiet, clean and nicely equipped. Even a free guidebook to use and return in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Boston's charming hotel at great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I avoid huge, impersonal hotels with huge, unconscionable room rates. The Charlesmark is a small boutique hotel off Copley Square in Boston, Mass. We had a wonderful experience over Independence Day weekend. Great view in R. 601, of the park and the historic Boston Library. (Go there: John Adams personal library in Rare Books and a beautiful courtyard). Also see USS Constitution, Old State House, JFK Library, John Adams Historic site in Quincy (subway), walk Beacon Hill, Quincy Market, Freedom Trail. Lots of good restaurants with outdoor seating, and plenty of shops nearby. The staff is very helpful. I had a fractured foot, so they suggested the all-day trolley in lieu of the Freedom Trail. They gave me a surprise treat for my July 4 birthday. They were great with subway directions, and restaurant suggestions. It doesn't stop there. When I left my cell phone charger, they mailed it to me free of charge. One suggestion: To avoid a room mix-up, after you choose and book a room over the phone, ask them to make a notation: "Do not move" or "Keep room-wants view"

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Boston Experience”
Reviews.Author: honeymoonitaly
Reviews.Content: Our weekend stay in Boston was terrific! The city was truely wonderful, and we got to see it all based out of our hotel room at the Charlesmark. From the moment we opened the door to our room, I was impressed. Soft classical music played in the room upon arrival, a nice welcome to a relaxing yet exciting weekend. The room was very comfortable, clean, quiet and well-designed. Cozy bed too, a plus for couples! The small hotel perks were not lost on us... hotel service was personalized and unique, nice to stay some place where the staff remembers your name!

Reviews.Title: “don't bash the charlesmark!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending 4 nights at the charlesmark prior to our trip we did a lot of research on this hotel (reading reviews!!) we booked a standard room and knew it would be small so we prepared ahead time not taking huge suitcases. The only problem with the room was the floor outside of the bathroom was always very wet, besides that it was decent room it had a tiny fridge with bottle waterThe shower pressure was great but bathroom was tiny, so it was hard to get ready. the hotel location is Great!!! the T is just outside the hotel was very convenient. breakfast of bagels and fruit was also a nice added feature. the staff was also very friendly as well. like the management said in earlier reviews just do your research before booking so there are no surprises and you know what to expect!! for the price and location in boston you can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this little boutique hotel last week... great experience there. The staff was terrific, room was beautifully decorated, and there were no incidental charges. Location in the middle of the Back Bay is convenient to shopping and business needs. Would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and small and noisy”
Reviews.Author: CTD5678
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the Charlesmark and while the experience was okay, there are decided advantages and disadvantages. Location is very convenient to spots downtown and the hotel is clean and service was fine. I really like the sound system and the internet capabilities. The rooms are nicely appointed, but as several other reviewers have noted, quite small. For a single person like myself, that wasn't much of an issue, but I would hesitate to book with another person. Hallways are hard to manage with luggage and certainly if you meet another person! My biggest concern was the noise from floors above and in the hallway at night and the morning, due to the lacki of sound proof. Boston's filled with hotels of quality - this one will has a niche, but will have a hard time competing if its average guest wants to crash after a day around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: njj17677
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all the bells and whistles from the outside....yes you do have the video player and stereo system, and flash lighting system in each room. The staff are very friendly and breakfast is included in the rate. But what is fundamentally missing is having a good night's sleep! This is the main point to staying in a hotel! I was woken up early every morning due to the lack of black out curtains or blinds in the room. The room was on a corner, so had 2 windows so was extremley light despite the normal blinds. Secondly around 2am every night I was woken by the trash being collected in the alleyway. The room was also rather small with a shower cubicle (no bath) which smelt of a stagnant fish pond/tank!! In short, this hotel appears to have all the nice extras, such as free phone calls/internets.....but the fundamental things are missing. I would not stay here again, depsite the great location. Spend a bit more, and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Charlesmark”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Charlesmark last May, and again this May. It is a truly terrific place. The rooms are splendid! Beautifully decorated, the decor is all original artwork from local artists. This hotel is very unique, and extremely comfortable. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and helpful with tourists inquiries. I highly recommend this hotel for tourists. For less price than a standard, boring chain, one can stay at a nice hotel with a local flavour.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location....”
Reviews.Author: slsiege
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a decent room at a decent price at a great location, a half-block from Copley Square. I could walk almost anywhere I wanted to go: Boston Commons/Public Garden, Quincy Market, Symphony Hall, Fenway Park, and many of the historic sites. (All right, I walk a lot.) Newbury St. is right around the corner. For bad weather or longer hauls, the Copley T stop is steps away. As for the hotel itself, the staff was friendly and usually helpful, the small lounge was nice, and the modest continental breakfast is a plus. So are free local calls and the CD stereo. One odd touch: a tiny refrigerator kept stocked with bottles of spring water. Now for the annoyances. Number one: the rooms are TINY. Mine was just about large enough for myself. Also, there wasn't a closet per se; you have to hang jackets, slacks and shirts in a floor-level cabinet space. (Real wood hangers, though.) Coats go on the hook by the door. Heating/Air Conditioning is on the noisy side, though not egregiously so, but setting the control so that you neither freeze nor roast can be tricky. Operating the cable TV can be a problem for the technologically challenged, and the set is at an odd angle, but you should eventually get the hang of it. My biggest gripe is the lighting: besides the nighttable lamps, there was only a none-too-bright floor lamp. One desk guy told me I could have had another lamp shortly before I was going to check out. Oh, yes, there's a computer and printer in the lounge. But it was virus-ridden and useless when I had to print my return boarding pass. Fortunately there's an internet cafe at 252 Newbury, a couple of blocks away, though it's not open terribly late. The minuses didn't spoil my sleep; that and the location made this a positive experience for me. On my next trip, though, I will check out other hotels as well as this one.

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for three nights and in short Bad points: room 606 is small and you will struggle to fit two people and luggage (OK shopping !) in there easily. Noisy (trash collected every night we were there). Room was either too hot or too cold, it was difficult to get a happy medium as the aircon was noisy. The room does not have blackout curtains or blinds. There is construction at the entrance to the hotel, but we were not disturbed by this. Good points: Location is excellent with everything you need very close by including some very good restaurants and shopping. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Local calls are free as is internet usage. Our room was clean and reasonably well equiped (although the TV was in an odd place!) So would I stay here again ? Probably not, I'd want to give somewhere else a try although I would stay in this area again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel very much and the staff were very friendly. There was construction going on at the entrance when we arrived but I'm sure this will be cleared soon. The rooms were clean and tidy with a good TV/stereo including free video rental. They were, however, a little small for two people and three large bags. Great location with lots of food/bars/attractions in the neighbourhood. Definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CAGAL626
Reviews.Content: This hotel can't be beat for the location and the friendly staff. However, if you are driving to Boston, this may not be the best location for you. There is really no good place to pull over and drop off your luggage. Besides the person at the front desk, there isn't anyone who can come down to help you - no bellman. Getting to the "closest" parking garage is a bit of a hassle as well. Then you have to repeat it all when you leave. Take a taxi or the T! Also, they are in the process of adding a restaurant on the ground floor so be prepared to walk through a bit a construction site on your way in.

Reviews.Title: “Marathon Weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Charlesmark Hotel for the Boston Marathon weekend. The location is ideal, and the hotel is modern, and very cool. We had a room overlooking Copley. Our room was filled with technological goodies. My favorite was the surround sound stereo with a speaker in the bathroom, while my friend took advantage of the hunderds of channels available from the satellite TV. Obviously, Marathon Monday was the highlight of our trip. As I did not run, I watched from the hotel lobby, overlooking the finish line. A girl at the front desk helped me track my friend's running progress on a computer in the lobby. More importantly, the hotel owner and staff went out of their way to provide food and beverages in the lobby for us spectators... and at no cost!!! It seemed as if the hotel was celebrating Marathon as if it was a holiday. We thoroughly enjoyed our time in Boston, a very lovely city - if you've never been, you should certainly go. Just be careful of Newbury Street, home of shopping galore, I nearly spent all my money the first night!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for Boston”
Reviews.Author: mao23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Charlesmark for two nights and was pretty pleased. It's a good deal, especially for the Back Bay. The staff was very friendly and helpful, email access in the lounge was very convenient, and the continental breakfast was perfectly adequate. However, the rooms are small. I was traveling alone and had one of their smallest rooms and while it was fine for one, two would be a squeeze and the closet space was very limited. The only other downside of this place was the 5:30a.m. trash pick up! I realize this is completely beyond the control of the hotel but it is something for light sleepers to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - great location”
Reviews.Author: olderguy47
Reviews.Content: Where to start? I picked this hotel based on reviews on tripadvisor. I was happy with our choice. The location was good for a couple of reasons: a half block from the T, across the street from the Boston Public Library (and a bank of public access computers), and there was a healthy selection of restaurants down Boylston within a few blocks. Also my teenage daughter wanted to go running, and we were three or four blocks from the Charles River with great running paths. There was a mixup when we first got to the hotel. Although we reserved a room to sleep three, it turned out our room was handicap-designated and only slept two. The night clerk made an accomodation for us and we were all happy. The front of the hotel is under construction which really wasn't any problem. The breakfast served in the second floor was quite adequate. We were there three nights. One morning I had a doughnut, the next a blueberry muffin, and the third morning a bagel. The bagels were excellent! Very New York like. Also a bowl of fresh fruit and choice of coffee, tea or OJ. Although breakfast was over at 10 AM, the fruit and remaining goodies were out until evening. My daughter liked that she could play CDs in the full stereo in her room. There is a lending library of VHS movies, but we were always too tired to watch them. There were problems with internet access on the computer in the lounge, but that was okay. There were problems with the soda machine in the basement too (the cans came out hot instead of cold!). But that really didn't overshadow the good value that this hotel was for us. The staff was uniformly helpful and friendly. Restaurants: we liked Legal Seafood at the Pru and the food was really good at The Atlantic Fish Company. We'd gladly come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel”
Reviews.Author: vbw
Reviews.Content: I LOVE the Charlesmark. Great decor and location! I would stay here everytime I go to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: idonthave1
Reviews.Content: In the best possible location to be in all of Boston, Charlesmark is an amazing deal! Very nice rooms with very comfortable bed, and decorated with local artwork. Loads of free features... continental breakfast, wireless internet (fast!), Direct TV, and free videos to watch. I highly recommend this hotel as you will find nothing else in Boston where you can stay so cheap, so well, in such a nice neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Charlesmark”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was one of the best I have experienced. The price was very reseanable, which actually scared me, but i was very pleased, it was extremely clean, quaint, stylish, comfortable and in a great location. The T is right across the street, it serves a sweet little continental breakfast and the staff are great. I can not recommend it enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: denjules
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel Feb'05 mostly due to the reveiws on this site. As previously mentioned the hotel is well located especially for our needs as we arived via AMTRAK. The price is also a welcome site as we have stayed in boston before and paid alot more. The Hotel is nice, compact and has good facilites. yes the rooms are small and we had one of the delux rooms I think the standard room would have been too small but they were comfortable and as others have mentioned they have a very good sound system and televison system. Our only gripes would be that our room was facing the main road and the windows are not sound proof at all and this kept us awake till late and them woke us up quite early and we were on the top floor! Also we were staying during snow and very cold weather and even with the heating on full in our room we couldn't get warm! Saying all this we would stay again mostly due to the location and the value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great Gadgets, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Looseal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last week, simply as the reviews on Tripadvisor were so good, and we were not dissapointed. The location is superb and the hotel staff were so helpful. Agreed the rooms are compact but they are stylishly decorated and the technology within such a small space is unheard of in many of the hotels that I have stayed in. The price is great value for money and the breakfast a refreshing change in a country where you usually have to pay extra. I would stay there myself again and will recommend it to everyone.
